description:
First time, so I ordered a medium Steak and Cheese (American) with works and their home made hot sauce. Very good, the bread is awesome, just the right amount of toastiness and big enough to hold everything. The meat is good quality and grilled with thin sliced onions.  It all comes together in one awesome sandwich! 

The owner is super friendly,  told me the meatballs and sausage are home made. He also said the pastrami is his favorite. He loves too push the hand cut fries, maybe I'll give a try next time.  Definitely coming back to try more

The only con, wish they took credit cards...Oh well,  old school place, old school ways!
author: Douglas M.

description:
The sandwiches are hearty and fresh!
The sandwiches are CHEAP!
Especially for San Francisco!
The sandwiches are on fresh rolls
and the hand cut fries are terrific!
It's a deli like place with more modern amenities and clean!
GO!  Tons of meat!
author: Brian D.

description:
This is a very welcoming and friendly, family run, business in the Sunset.
After seeing it on "Check, Please!" a few years ago, I knew I wanted to give it a try.  I was in the Sunset this weekend around lunch time and  was finally able to visit this sandwich shop.

The Reuben I ordered today was just ok.  I would have preferred a more traditional Reuben with grilled rye bread and lots of meat.  Their version was more like a hot sub and I wished it wasn't.  I really missed the Thousand Island dressing which got drowned out with all of the extras that come standard on all of their subs.  More meat would have been good too.
All Sandwiches Include: Mayonnaise, Mustard, Tomato, Lettuce, Pickles, Oil, Vinegar, Hot Sauce, And Your Choice Of Cheese: American, Swiss Or Provolone.

There was a lot of toasted bread that made up the sub.  Even though I asked for a medium, I was uncomfortably full from the carbs alone.
The potato salad I ordered as a side was just ok too.  Creamy but not very flavorful.

The place is a little rough looking on the inside.
author: Thomas D.

description: East coast style subs on the West Coast? SOLD! If you're in the Sunset in SF and are hungry, go here. If you're not in SF, you should go to SF and eat here. The place has been around for decades, and the interior shows it, BUT don't let that deter you. The sandwiches are amazing and well priced. And the hand cut fries are out of this world. The meatball sub is made with homemade meatballs, and you could tell by the way they melted when bitten into. If for some reason you don't scarf down the whole sammie in one sitting (I know I did), heating it up the next day is a treat. The sandwich is just a good - if not better - the second day with all the flavors marinating together. So, I think it's safe to say I liked this place. The staff is super friendly and the food is killer. What's not to like?
author: Jessica S.

description: Great sandwiches! ordered the steak and cheese. First time eating something so similiar to a "philly cheesesteak" but this stands out on its own. The big fries/chips were very unique and tasted like potato wedges.
author: Jason L.

description:
Im so glad I was able to finally unbookmark & check in at this place after officially bookmarking it over a year ago. I love me a juicy philly cheese steak sandwich anytime on any day, so when I found out that a well known, Family-owned sandwich spot was literally walking distance from my workplace, I knew I had no excuse not to try it. Rewind to yesterday, as I turn in my badge and parking permit, I met up with a friend of mine to finally try Yellow Submarine! 

To save us some time, my homie called in our order-yet we ate it inside and sat among one of the few tables that are inside the spot. As my excitement built, seeing my sandwich for the first time was it. Wrapped in a white paper, I was so surprised at the "medium" sized sandwich looking at me. I couldn't believe how big this was. Meaning it could easily be shared between two hungry people. Needless to say I had leftovers for dinner.

So I ordered the traditional cheese steak sandwich which included within; American Cheese, delicious this Slices of steak, lettuce, tomato, in-house hot sauce, mayonnaise, mustard and pickles. In the future, I will order my sandwich WITHOUT: mayonnaise, mustard and pickles. I feel like these flavors are overpowering, therefore you aren't able to really enjoy the juices from the sandwich. Don't get me wrong, the sammie was still yummy, but I think without those additions it would make the sammie, perfect!
author: Lene N.

description: I first rolled into this submarine because I saw a KQED feature of this place and decided to check it out. The subs were pretty good. I had the cheese combo (because it was the only vegetarian one) so it felt pretty normal. But my friend had the Italian one and he said it was only okay too. The fries were very surprising and unique though and obviously very fresh out the kitchen. I enjoyed the family run sub vibe and would go back if I were feeling like sandwiches.
author: Christa L.

description:
I was having a crappy day. Pardon me. This is a family business. And the steak and cheese sandwich, saved the day. Well at least the time it took to eat that hoagie and proper potatoes oh and Stewart's Cream Soda. Thank you, it is so good to see a genuine family business putting on a show.
 I only wish I took a picture. I just couldn't wait.
author: Mark C.

description: There sandwich have been good but it's really a tos up. I came about 2 weeks ago and they were closing but there hours in yelp and google said a different story. When I told them and asked what there hours were he got mad and tried to give me a speach in how he "does this". Hella rude, I was tryna help you out. This is how mad I wasn't. I went back for a sandwich because they were goodish sandwiches. Well the potatoes were basically boiled in oil. Supper soggy, limp and the larger ones weren't even cooked all the way so I re fried them. The sandwich was mostly bread. I notice when you say roast beef they got supper skimpy and if you say steak and onions they load it on. Is this because that mix is mostly onions? Probably.
author: Kayla S.

description: My boyfriend is a San Francisco native and he's been eating here since he was about 4 years old, we love this place, I love the originality and the owners are wonderful people! Old school atmosphere which I also love and the food is consistently delicious and unique! A definite must-try place to eat if you're in the city!
author: Tabitha H.

description: If this photo doesn't do this place justice, I don't know what will. Slightly toasted bread, and delicious toppings. Huge portions. The tuna was delicious. I'm in love!
author: Daniella J.

description: Really good spot for hot subs. I shared a large pepper steak, big enough for lunch for my boyfriend and I. It was soo delicious. Super fresh tasting meat and vegetables, on delicious sourdough. The hot sauce gives a nice zing of flavor. I can't wait to try again
author: Alex K.

description: Grandma and sons working as a family business. The fries are amazing. The pepper steak sandwich was bomb. So be more mom and pops place in Sf!
author: Narit B.

description: Finally made it to old school sub shop at in the Inner Sunset. After seeing this place on Check Please, Bay Area, I wanted to try it. I attempted to go there on Sunday, but by the time, I was able to go there, it was closed. Today was the day, and I finally made it there. I took the N-Judah out there, and it drops you about a Football field length away from the front door. Went I got there, the door was closed; however, there were people inside. One of the women working the counter, opened the door and I was in there. I ordered a Large Steak and Cheese along with an order of Fries. I brought the sandwich back home, and it was absolutely delicious, and the fries are not regular fries, they are big and round. The seasonings on the sandwich, and the hot sauce was amazing. I will definitely take a trek out to the Inner Sunset again for a great sandwich.
author: Jeremy K.

description:
This old school, simple sandwich shop that toasts their bread on the grill has been here for ages! It's neighborhood  gem and as with all restaurants along the Irving Street corridor, parking is always difficult, so just depend on the public transportation with the N Judah train that passes by.  During lunch there is always a line out the door , but it moves quickly, just remember your number. I went here first time back in 2002 and order the pepper steak sandwich and it was excellent! 

So meeting an old friend we selected this place on a beautiful, sunny  Saturday early afternoon on June 24,2017 for lunch and we ate in. We paid cash  and I ordered the toasted Italian Combo and got my ticket number and found a seat  in the back dinning area that can fit maybe 15 people.  They call your number and you go get it at the counter.  The staff here I get is like a family feeling where small staff and they work well together and I think it's the same people from last time I was here! LOL  
Hard to find good sandwich shops these days. I will always pick up a sandwich if I pass by and eat it later. 

Just FYI, They have Dirty Chips potato chips brand and their salt and vinegar chips tastes better than the Kettle brand salt & vinegar chips brand!
author: Priscilla L.

description: Excellent sandwiches and selections! Owners are super friendly too! Wait wasn't long either!
author: Rose I.

description:
Big, hearty, glorious old-fashioned sub sandwiches

I first went to the Yellow Sub back in high school, way back in the mid-1990s. It was a rite of passage to eat an entire sandwich (always a large steak & cheese) in one sitting. In my old age, I can only eat half of it and save half for later.

I try to visit a couple of times every year, including during breaks back when I had gone away to college. I've introduced a bunch of friends to the place over the years. There are a few tables, but it's a great place to pick up a sandwich to take to the park or Yancy's for a game.
author: Matt C.

description: Great tasting sandwiches!  Just looking for a quick lunch while touring the city. Turns out, this was close to where my wife went to pharmacy school. She didn't remember it but if it was near me in college I'd be here every day!  Excellent bread, generous fillings. Come for the food, not the decor.
author: Scott R.

description:
Yellow Submarine offers delicious sandwiches. The restaurant is usually very busy and sandwiches take a while to prepare so I recommend calling in beforehand with your order. 

I ordered a medium toasted hot pastrami sandwich. While the medium was just the right amount, there is a large option available if you have a hearty appetite. 

Seating is available inside. There is street parking but it's very hard to find an available spot in this busy neighborhood.
author: Katie C.

description: Cash only establishment and worth every penny. Family owned and great service. We ordered the pepper steak and Ruben both were awesome. The bread is out of this world. We had our 8 month old baby with us and owner gave her some bread and cheese. Very very sweet. Great place
author: Waael A.

description:
This family owned sandwich store is amazing, the owners are proud of what they make and put a lot of heart into their food. Highly recommend the steak and cheese sandwich! Extremely tasty and the bread is baked to perfection. 

By the way,
- you can order grilled onions to go with your sandwich if you're not a fan of raw onions
- they only accept cash and check
- sometimes they do close earlier than their posted store hours if business is slow
author: Jennifer L.

description: YUM YUM YUM! Amazing neighborhood spot to get a great sun or sandwich. Growing up near New York this is my favorite place to come to get an Italian sub like back home.
author: Kim P.

description: Classic hole in the wall with amazing subs. Definitely recommend for a quick lunch break!
author: Sarah N.

description: Yes! The Italian combo sub with their homemade hot sauce was FANTASTIC. Great service, friendly people, quick food and an excellent sub. Will be back!
author: Alexa S.

description:
One of the best places in town. I would happily recommend it to my friends. Easily the best sandwich spot closest to UCSF/Parnassus without breaking the bank.
Orders can be placed by phone, and I think they partner with a few delivery services. 
It's a family-run business and everybody's very friendly, it's simple, and yet very authentic and it tastes delicious. There is a good selection of sandwiches, and they are always made-to-order, and you can get them in two different sizes. For my appetite, the large is too much, but I order it anyway and keep the other half for later :)

If you would like to dine in, there is a separate room with natural light and many tables, as well as a bench outside. Or you can take your order and walk down two blocks to Golden Gate Park. 

Pretty sure it's a cash-only operation which is my only complaint.

Note sometimes the door is closed and can be a little sticky to open, but you should persist!

Parking can be a little tricky sometimes because of the ongoing construction (can't hear a thing though) but it's not too bad. If you really can't find anything nearby, there is a parking lot at Kirkham & 7th Ave, about 1.5 blocks away. There'll be a spot in the lot or along the way, I guarantee it.
author: Matthew C.

description: Wow the Yellow Submarine is amazing and authentic. We come all the way from Tracy to have their Veal Parmesan roll. It is amazing, huge rave from us!
author: Jennifer G.

description: The pepper steak sandwich is freshly cooked and extremely filling--great price too.
author: Justin L.

description:
Very nice family owned sub deli. 
If you're near UCSF and need food this is the stop!
author: Steve S.

description: First time here was 1988 when I was in dental school. Always great and have been coming back with my family ever year.
author: Alfonso D.

description: Love these fresh of the grill sandwiches! Homemade French fries/potatoes chips are delicious! Just remember it's cash only tho.
author: Jaxxxie P.

description:
Had a craving for a good sandwich and found this place nearby. 
Picked up a late lunch and ordered a chicken sandwich with avocado and all the fixings, medium size.  The medium was actually quite large and overflowing.  It was absolutely delicious!  The meat was warm with delicious caramelized onions which all just melted the cheese and made all the ingredients come together into a juicy flavorful sandwich. The restaurant was clean and service was very polite & welcoming.  It looks like a family business and it was quite cozy.  I definitely will be going back!
author: C S.

description: This is one of my favorite sandwich spots! Every time I go there, I get the same thing and it never disappoints. Highly recommend the Italian combo - it's perfect and the toasted sub bread just adds another great level to it. If you like hot sauce, their homemade hot sauce is delicious and comes standard with a bunch of other fixings on the sandwich.
author: Ben M.

description: Pepper steak sandwiches used to be better. Perhaps they've been off lately. Potato "fries" are sort of a rip off too. Would rather frequent Lou's although this location is more convenient. I appreciate their service and positive attitude but the food doesn't really measure up anymore.
author: Suzette C.

description:
We were visiting San Francisco and asked our hotel concierge for a recommendation for a restaurant near the Golden Gate Park. She told us about The Yellow Submarine sandwich shop. We were a little skeptical about it but decided to give it a try. The staff was friendly and patient with us and we were glad that we stayed. The sandwiches were large, fresh and hot. We ordered chips and then saw the hand cut fries. We had to have some of them too. The price was right. I only wish that they had a soda machine and ice. We got a Snapple tea and it was cold.
I would definitely eat here again. The owner came over and talked with us. I am glad that we over looked the outside of the restaurant and took a chance.
author: Carol B.

description: One of my favorite sandwiches ever. Run by the same family as long as I can remember. Almost always get the pastrami with extra homemade hot sauce. Love it!
author: Apollonio L.

description:
I don't understand the hype around the Yellow Submarine. It's on several lists of best places to get sandwiches, but I was personally disappointed by the taste of my sandwich. Just to back up, I didn't realize this was cash only, so my boyfriend and I had a walk a couple blocks down to the nearest ATM. Fortunately they prepared our sandwiches while we were waiting.

I ordered the pastrami sandwich with everything. Looking back, I'm attempting to deduce what exactly I didn't like about the sandwich. Maybe it was the onions. I expected a pastrami sandwich to taste spicier and smokier, but it was sour to me. I probably just need to be better in tune with which ingredients I like and don't like to maximize my utility at Yellow Submarine, but even so, I was not impressed with the quality of the sandwich as a whole.
author: Stefanie C.

description: After my first sandwich from The Yellow Submarine, I will never eat another "chain" sub.  The service was tremendous and the food was delicious.  I actually had enough for two days.  The subs are such a  bargain I can see making the trek to this Submarine heaven on a regular basis.  A big THANK YOU! to the wonderful family who owns and works at The Yellow Submarine!
author: David C.

description:
It's been years since we made a return trip to Yellow Sub. Hubby wanted a sandwich and ended up buying 2. I really like the fact that they toast their bread really crunchy and for $8 the sandwiches are long maybe not with as much meat as some would like but the sandwich is filling.  Hubby got a pastrami and roast beef.  I took a bite of each and the pastrami is tasty with a lot of flavor.  I thought the roast beef was a bit bland.  
The place is in need of a face lift, it's really run down looking now.
author: Ry T.

description:
I got a large Italian steak sandwich with everything. This was my first time going to this place so I wasn't sure about the sizes, but when they said large, they meant it. The sandwich was huge. I would say at least 2 times the size of a subway footlong. The meat was tender and cut up into little pieces and the sauce they put in it made the whole thing very juicy. 

I would go again and the prices are amazing. Just before yo phone your order in before going cause there's usually a wait. Even with phoning our order in we still waiting for about 10 minutes.
author: Bowen W.

description: Another one of my dads go to spots while he was in college in SF (it's safe to say he has great taste). Love the mom and pop shops- they always have the best food. This place is great -subs fill you up and fries go a long way. The bread is nice a toasty just how I like it, Yum!
author: Jay A.

description:
Drool! 

These are some of the best sub sandwiches I've ever had. All of the ingredients went together so well that it's almost like magic. If I lived in this neighborhood I would eat here all the time. 

This is a grab and go kind of place. If you plan on sitting there to eat, don't get your hopes up. It's a very basic space and a little run down but don't let that distract you from the amazing sandwiches. 

The homemade chips/fries were super tasty and crunchy. I would recommend sharing an order with a friend to cut down on the grease but they were very good.

This is a must if you love sandwiches but don't really care for the super flashy, fancy places.
author: Kaley K.

description: This place has been in business since the beginning of time. Food is great, but I wish they put more steak or pastrami in my sandwich.  Feel like it's a bit of a rip off for what you get.
author: Heather K.

description:
A review can't do this place justice! I was at UCSF today and needed to grab lunch. All of the places located immediately around the hospital had pretty bad reviews and I NEEDED to refuel. The photos by themselves sold me!

When we showed up, it took a second just to make sure we were in the right place, but as soon as we walked in we received a warm welcome, asking if we've ever had one of their sandwiches. Our reply was no and the man at the counter gave recommendations. The Reuben and Steak sandwich were more than we expected! The meat was lean and cooked and flavored perfectly; the bread was toasted with just the right balance of crunchy and soft. 

To top it all off, the garlic fries were recommended as well and what a pleasant surprise! Freshly cut potatoes cooked beautifully with a well seasoned fresh garlic mixture. 

All that to say, I would definitely recommend to anyone and everyone!
author: Kourtney A.

description:
Stopped in just before close on a Saturday evening with a few friends; this is a small, old school sandwich shop with very little room to stand inside to order, and a small area of tables in the next room (luckily it wasn't busy, since 4 of us took up the entire entryway). Recommend calling before going if it's near closing time, as when we called they mentioned they'd likely be closing earlier than the listed time. 

The entryway awkwardness and tricky parking aside (street parking only), we had a great experience! The guy who took our order was friendly and didn't rush us, and the sandwiches were HUGE and delicious! I ordered an avocado and cheese sandwich. It had tons of vegetables on it and I'm pretty sure there was an entire avocado in it - YUM! The bread was chewy and dense, just like good, freshly made bread should be, and they toast it in the oven before making the sandwich. Highly recommend stopping by for a great sandwich.
author: Christine H.

description:
The prices listed on the Yelp menu are completely outdated. The large is $10.59 (because who orders a small?)

So I order two sandwiches. Per taxes, this should come out to $22.98, but somehow it rang up as $23.04. $0.06 for the brown paper bag I didn't request?

What kind of evil is this? First, this place is cash-only. Second, who carries around change?! FOUR CENTS. Super sneaky way to load up on tips if you ask me. 

Sandwiches were quite OK. It's large, but unfortunately it's mostly bread. I'll give that it's somewhat tasty. A fair comparison would be Little Lucca, which I prefer a lot more; Little Lucca gives more meat, takes credit, and has a good sauce. But if you're here and don't want to hop into a car then... well, I'm not sure what to tell ya.
author: Andrew C.

description: The pastrami and pepper steak was amazing! Would definitely make another trip out to eat here. They are cash only so make sure you have some. So worth it! They also don't have a restroom inside but the seating area is cute.
author: Justine S.

description:
I was beyond impressed with this little gem in San Francisco. My best friend just moved to SF and after our day of sight seeing, we were starving! A mutual contact suggested trying Yellow Submarine and swore by their amazing sandwiches. 

Walking inside, it looks like it could use a good paint job but hey it just adds to the decor and they have been around for ages! 

The sandwiches were finger licking good-- totally not kidding. We ordered the chicken and the BLT which came fresh out of the oven, warm bread and all. We had them cut it in half so we could each try it. 

This is on my list of places to go every time I come back to San Francisco. I unfortunately didn't take pictures of this creation, but next time. 

Xx
author: Mariam G.

description:
After a couple bites of our hot pastrami sandwich, my boyfriend said, "Roxie's has some competition." ..and if you've had Roxies, that's saying a lot.

After a hike up at Mount Sutro, we decided to try The Yellow Submarine for the first time, and we were not disappointed. There were, however, #regrets for sharing and not getting a sandwich to ourselves.

We'll be back! And it's CASH ONLY folks!
author: Camille B.

description: Best sandwiches ever!! If you don't come you're def missing out . The family is super sweet. I have been coming here for years and even though I live in the east bay now I always make sure I take a trip out here
author: Maria W.

description:
I was disappointed today bcuz I order roast beef and it didn't taste right.
I come here 3 times a month so I know the taste but today roast beef tasted like microwaved. Bread was toasted too much.
It seems like they were short staff.
If I go back. I will order something else.
author: Kyong K.

description: I have been coming here for a long time and I must say... Today was the lowest point in my experience getting food from this place.  I ordered the large hot pastrami sub and brought it home for dinner.  When I opened it up it was all bread, lettuce, toppings and sauce.. and almost no pastrami whatsoever. They might have taken one slice of pastrami and shredded it up into the lettuce but my god... for over 12 bucks I expect to actually have PASTRAMI in the PASTRAMI SANDWICH I ordered....  Such a shame... I have been coming here off and on since I was a kid in the 80's.  Maybe rent has gone up or something but you can't just rip off customers like that, its a disgrace.
author: Julian H.

description:
Okay so...

3 stars because the sandwiches are astoundingly delicious!! The minus 2 because I'm literally sitting in here right.now and like... (I'm guessing he's the owner? Whatever he is, he must be the HBIC) whomever, he just went OFF on the nice older lady making the sandwiches... I'm talking, YELLING at her in front of like 7 patrons.. obnoxiously yelling and talking to her so disrespectfully that it honestly scared me and CLEARLY scared her too.. and everyone in the room.. how scary.. yeah.. totally weird experience  and it's obviously messing with my ability to even form coherent sentences.. so yeah. There's that. 

Great sandwiches though.
author: Chelsea E.

description:
I go by this place everyday on my way to work, and I'm kicking myself for not stopping by sooner. The owner working the counter was friendly, speedy, and had a definite mom and pop shop vibe. 

I ordered the Steak pepper sandwich in medium (which is PLENTY) for a lunch much cheaper than some nearby joints. Bread was still warm and crunchy I got home and everything melded together nicely. Steak was nice and toothy and everything tasted super fresh. Food came relatively fast. But fair warning, it's cash-only so come prepared.

They have a dining room off to the side with a cute painting of the old menu, with a sense of humor. For example, the cheesecake illustration was a wheel of cheese sliced like cake with a birthday candle.
author: Michelle C.

description: Best pastrami sandwich I've had in a long time. The guys running the place are top notch. We came in with a giant family full of special orders and they totally accommodated us taking over their dining area with kids at lunch time. Definitely recommend the food & appreciate the good service.
author: chris h.

description: I would give it a 5 star review if they weren't out of alcohol and avocado on a Saturday afternoon. I was so sad cause I don't eat meat and was looking forward to trying they're avocado sandwich! Oh well. Got their cheese sandwich instead which was huge even though I got the medium. Really good! Friends got the pastrami and they loved it as well. Fries are little delicious slices instead of the usual French fries, which you can definitely share as they're huge. I'll come back but I'll call before I get there and there's no avocado again!
author: Ruby S.

description: This place is one of my favorite sandwich places to come to when I'm in San Francisco.  The turkey sandwiches is one of my favorites
author: Jacqueline H.

description:
I saw this place on Check Please! years ago and always wanted to stop by.  I took a class nearby and needed to warm up from the Inner Sunset cold so I decided to stop by for a sandwich.  It's a bustling place and there was a large party that took over the majority of seating in the room next door (large parties, please be conscious of this as this limits seating for the rest of us and taking an extra long lunch together is not optimal in a busy place like this, especially on a Saturday at lunch time - c'mon peeps!).  

My hot pastrami sandwich with everything on it hit the spot and warmed me up - it was flavorful and fresh and toasty warm!  Luckily, I was able to snag a small table in the bag after finagling a chair from another table - it's a small place so you've got to work it a little bit.  The guy behind the cash register had a bit of an attitude (you still need to pick your cheese as there are 3 choices, and it is not clear on the menu that provolone is on every sandwich - a little more patience on your part would have been nice), which really wasn't appreciated, as I was cold, hungry and had never been there before.  

I also brought home a corned beef sandwich for later - it wasn't quite as good as the pastrami but it was a-ok.  I might be back but maybe not on a Saturday at lunch time when it is mobbed.
author: Maile N.

description:
My first visit to Yellow Submarine and also my last.

I ordered a Rueben Sandwich, you all know the good ole Rueben, hot pastrami, sauerkraut, Swiss cheese, thousand island dressing and rye bread. I also ordered these kool looking thick cut fried potato chips. They asked me if I wanted ketchup with my potato chips.

I explicitly tell granny that I wanted Rye Bread. 

I then see the cook throw a hunk of meat on the flat top and then pull some sauerkraut out of a bucket and proceed to grill it and then hack it all into sawdust? Then he throws the "hash" onto a white sub roll that is almost 10" long and bigger around than a baguette with melted cheese. The ratio of filling to bread was 2 to 10. Seriously, who wants a loaf of bread to 1/2 cup of meat?

The sandwich was abysmal and the fried potato chips should have been served with packing tape because the tasted like cardboard.

Seriously, with stiff competition in the prepared food business in San Francisco, how is it possible that such bad food exists?

I guess this is why Subway exists along side Yellow Submarine. People will eat any old schlock and these operators continue to call it food.
author: Perry V.

description:
Sandwiches are good and its huge! I had the chicken sandwich (ordered one large to split with a friend and it was still very filling). Coleslaw was just ok (nothing special, just coleslaw). I saw other people eating garlic fries and it looked pretty good lol. 

Reasons for 4 stars:
- CASH ONLY (why???)
- Wasn't really happy with the service -- the place wasn't really set up when we went so we had to place the chairs and tables ourselves. They forgot to give us our coleslaw so we had to remind them. We had to keep going back to ask for stuff (utensils, napkins, etc.). Service could definitely be better.
author: Erika S.

description: Nice local sandwich place near my apt! I asked the owner what he recommends and he just listed off so many things and everything sounded so delicious. I ended up getting the steak and cheese sandwich with Cole slaw. I thought the Cole slow was average but still pretty good. I loved their homemade hot sauce that they put in my sandwich. It's actually not that hot, to me at least. I think I couldve used a little more mayo or cheese in my sandwich, only because I just love saucy sandwiches. It seems like their fries are also supposed to be good and I'll try them one day!
author: Stephanie K.

description: Used to come here, from the east bay, with my boy when he was little in the early aughts. Best grilled subs ever. Love these folks who have been making great food for decades. Can't wait to make a visit.
author: Richard S.

description:
Gahhh sooo AMAZING!! I stumbled upon this place and this place hits the golden trifecta: price, quantity, and quality.

If you're ever in the UCSF area, I highly suggest getting a sandwich here. Also, be sure to get the FRIES!! They're unique and like a hybrid with a potato chip. It was nice to get some crispy chips and also thin potato-wedges. I initially ordered my sandwich for no fries thinking about my "diet" and went back in line to add an order of fries. 

I ordered the turkey sandwich and it was sooo delicious! I scarfed down half the sandwich in minutes... if you like your food spicy, don't forget the hot sauce. After half the sandwich I was pretty full. I used to live in Boston and I actually never heard of Boston styled subs. haha. but the Yellow Submarine is now one of my favorite places to get a fresh sandwich. Mmm... If i'm ever around, I'll be back to order more.
author: Janet H.

description:
The sandwiches taste good. But there were several issues. The customer service was terrible. These people don't behave nice enough. They look aggressive. You should ask for every single thing, napkin, sauce, fork...you just can pay by cash, I guess it is because of tax (and I don't like it!)
This place was very dirty! I don't know if there ha been any health check ever or not. I didn't feel good to eat at this place at all and I don't think that I would be there again....
author: Babak G.

description:
Keeping it old school. I lived in the Sunset and never came here and now that I live in the Richmond I make the trek over a few times a year for the steak and cheese.

Do come here.

The staff are very friendly and the customers, at lunch time, are mostly from the school.
author: Justin S.

description:
*CASH ONLY ALERT!!* 
Mentioning the cash thing because I didn't see it in reviews before going, and had to turn back home to grab some. 

That being said: 
This place is great. Seriously. Go eat there. What are you still doing home? Grab some cash, Go! 
I called ahead, food was ready when I got there. 
Sub was delicious, got cole slaw on the side, delicious. 
10/10 would recommend.
author: Brittany B.

description:
Been here 30+ times now. Figured I should leave a review.

It's not the cheapest nor the biggest sandwich you can get, but it's one of the better places in SF. I usually get the steak or Italian. Easily worth the price.

Oh, and get the House Hot Sauce!
author: Daniel S.

description: We had the Italian Steak and requested extra hot sauce. Drove home 15mins or so, left the sandwich on a counter for another 30 mins. Popped it in oven to heat it up and to my surprise the bread is still VERY CRUNCHY. Who likes soggy bread right? :-)  the size is HUGE and definitely a good value. I couldn't rave about the filling as it wasn't as spicy I thought it would be. However will def come back to try other flavor and prolly have it right away
author: Hester D.

description: The steak sandwich is amazing! This place is family run, and it shows that they care with every sandwich. Our order has been perfect every single time. I highly recommend.
author: Jon L.

description: This is the best place for hot sandwiches in San Francisco. It is a small Mom and Pop/Son run shop. You can't miss the bright yellow paint job on this joint! I go back and forth getting the hot corned beef sandwich and the pastrami! I can go for a little of the homemade hot sauce, but not too much! It is super spicy! The house made chips are great! Service is fast and friendly, typically mom is working and she makes a mean sandwich! Some tables and chairs in the restaurant, but Golden Gate Park is just blocks away! Grab a sandwich to go and head to the park! Love The Yellow Submarine!
author: Michael B.

description:
This is my favorite sub sandwich place. Is my review flavored with my memories of being a teenager with my boyfriend and friends and grabbing subs and going to Big Wreck and hanging out? Hell yeah!!!! But, why am I still coming back 30 years later and turning new friends on to it?!?! (Also, I never stopped coming here) 

The sub sandwiches are delicious, especially if you ask for the homemade hot sauce ...and make sure you get an order of fries
author: Edi M.

description:
New rule: there should be more Beatles-themed businesses: Mean Mr. Mustard's Deli, Strawberry Fields Produce Stand, and a candy store that only sells Savoy Truffles.

Oh, and for the restaurant itself? Well, my steak and cheese sandwich was pretty good, but a little greasy, and the facilities were sort of dirty. Worth going to at least once, but not one of my favorites.
author: Erik B.

description: A tiny little sandwich shop that lives up to its reviews. I had the Italian and it was phenomenal. The best part was the bread. Crunchy, fresh and delicious. I'll definitely be back! make sure to get their hot sauce, it's totally worth it!
author: Crystal K.

description:
These sandwiches are just about as good as it gets.

We visited this shop during a trip to San Francisco.  Seriously my sandwich was one of the best I have ever eaten.  I ordered the Pepper Steak and had a side of the home made potato chips to share with my family.  Everything we ordered was excellent.

Inside of the restaurant is no frills and they take cash only so come prepared for that.  Otherwise, excellent food.
author: Pier H.

description:
I ordered a large Italian Combo with everything. This ~$9 sub is so big, it is definitely two meals worth of deliciousness. I am suffering from tiny Asian girl syndrome: I feast with my eyes, but have a tiny stomach. I had to split this yummy sandwich with the boyfriend, who was equally satiated. That's how big this thing is!

The bun is perfectly toasted: just enough for that delicious crunch, but still soft enough to bite. The saltiness of the meat was well balanced by the bun, pickles, lettuce, tomato, and mayo/mustard. My main disappointment with Yellow Submarine is their closing time, Mon-Sat 8:30 PM and Sun 5:30 PM. This would be an awesome quick late night/after a crazy crosstown adventure/back from the club/hangover type of meal. 

Here are the quick tips:
- Long line during peak hours, so I suggest calling ahead and ordering.
- There are tables inside. But if its nice out, go to Golden Gate Park and have a picnic and enjoy brief moments when Carl the Fog is not covering the Inner Sunset.
- Obviously, parking is difficult. Its SF what did you expect?! Public transportation or walking will get you hungry for their monster subs!

Despite the closing time, this place is great. I will definitely be back to try their avocado sub and their sides. Anyway, this reminds of my the classic Semisonic song. I know who I want to take me home...and its this large Italian combo sub from Yellow Submarine.
author: Vivian C.

description: Amazing!!! The sandwiches here are delicious and so are the enormous fries. I usually get a medium sized sandwich since it's already pretty filling to me since I get the fries too. The fries are so different from other places because of how big and delicious they are and that's what I love about them. The service is quick and attentive too. It gets busy sometimes so make sure to come earlier!!
author: Cee H.

description:
The Yellow Submarine is a Boston style deli, whatever that means, that offers typical deli options with thin veggies. 

The place looks like a hole in the wall, you order your food at the counter, then realize they have a dining rooom to the left. I ordered the Italian sandwich, with tasty salty meats and some fries.

+s : fries were potatoe slices, like thick potato chips. Hearty sandwiches. 

-s : small ordering area, cash only, dining room is a little grungy w old menu prices on the walls
author: Marlon T.

description: I've been coming here for decades now and it remains almost unchanged from the first time I went.  The Reuben is not at all traditional, but it is my go to.
author: Tony G.

description: The best sandwiches ever. Grilled to order. So good. Family owned and super friendly. Have been coming here since my UCSF days in the early 90's before being "married with children".Unfortunately don't live in SF anymore but whenever we are near by, this is a must stop for me and the whole family. Yes, it's that good! So happy to see their mom still running the counter after all these years.
author: Q S.

description: Got the turkey sandwich and was super disappointed. Asked for no mayo or mustard, but got bread slathered in mayo. The entire sandwich was super bland, but luckily the pickles were the saving grace and prevented me from angrily rating this place 1 star. Also make sure you specifically ask for cheese or they won't give you any. Cash only too. Just an average sandwich place, many tiers below subway; I won't be back.
author: Sam L.

description: I travel from the Mission for this coleslaw. It's just like my family's recipe,but they are in Los Angeles. Coming here is easier,and don't forget your sandwich!
author: Ernie M.

description: I love this place and I hate sandwiches. I started going there with my father since I was 4, and it is still just as amazing as it was back then. Every chance I get I bring people to try it out, and people always love it. The sausage sub with everything on it and a side of homemade chips will never disappoint.
author: Fredicka N.

description: Great spot! Good quality subs and sandwiches! Also pretty nice fries. It's very affordable and high quality! Highly recommend.
author: Jakob P.

description: The most delicious sub sandwiches. The steak and cheese sub was amazing and don't forget the fresh cut potatoes. Be sure to bring cash!
author: Nicole W.

description:
Thank god I don't live in the neighborhood because I'd for sure be hitting this sandwich shop up daily. Erryday. 

The folks that own it are this sweet family to whom the pursuit of the perfect sandwich is a higher calling. Also, their fries are legit. Great bread, good ratio of meat to plant toppings. Boston-style sub? I have no idea, I just know it's a delicious style sub.
author: Tara H.

description: This place is AWESOME and fairly priced. The large sandwich is HUGE, the fries are great and they now offer fresh garlic fries!!!!!
author: Jessica C.

description: Bomb bomb BOMB!!!! Love this place. Mom n Pop shops are IT!! Food is sooooo good. I ordered the pepper steak and it was delicious. Very nice service and very clean place.
author: Jojo P.

description: Italian combo was perfectly toasted and delicious, a great lunch.
author: Andy B.

description: It's an old-school Place been in the neighborhood for years remember cash only but all the ingredients go together but if you do go around lunch time make sure you get there early cuz the line is long but good toasty great sandwiches
author: Nicey S.

description: Still the same, delicious, as it was when I first came here in 1976 when we moved to the neighborhood...some things are best unchanged!
author: Marc T.

description: Love this place so much! Family owned and run business, they make their own hot sauce and it's insanely delicious. Not sure if they bake their own bread, I think they might and it's the real star of these sandwiches. I recommend the Salami sandwich, its the bomb. Also the fries are super unique and delicious. Cash only!
author: Negeen E.

description:
Cash only. Let's be forewarned before heading over there expecting to use a debit card or something. I mean seriously, who has time for cash these days?! Good thing the guy who took my order was really nice, otherwise I would have been perturbed that I had to pull out cash from the suspicious looking ATM machine they conveniently placed on the other side...

I ordered a simple salami sandwich. The first bite I took, I knew it was one of the best salami sandwiches that ever entered my mouth. That or I was hungry. The bread was the best. It was super crunchy on the outside and dreamy on the inside, perfect sandwich bread I say. It was toasted so that added to the delish aspect. They didn't skimp on the salami either. Thumbs up!
author: Sharon B.

description: I'm never disappointed when I eat here. Subs are very meaty and filling. I don't like the olive oil and vinegar thing but the hot sauce is very yummy! The only down side is that it's cash only, but they are worth it!
author: Reyna D.

description:
Came here one night with my two cousins and since it was 10 minutes to closing, we couldn't sit down and eat. BUT. It was okay 'cause there was a bench outside with a small table that we used. 

This place is located on Irving St. so parking is all on the street and metered unless you come here after 6pm, but even then it might be hard to find parking so good luck! 

The inside of the store is split into 2 rooms. Once you enter, you'll be facing the kitchen and the cash register where the menu is and chips and drinks that they sell as well. To the left will be a room with all the tables and chairs you could sit at. No bathroom, though. :(

Altogether we ordered a medium roast beef sandwich, medium steak & cheese sandwich, and an order of their fries because my older cousin claims that they are delicious and yummy and you just have to get them apparently and a snapple. Together, those items cost about $19 and some odd number of cents.

The service was friendly. The cashier was friendly and took our order quickly and an older lady helped make our sandwiches. 

The food was amazing. Like, geezus. The bread they used was toasted and the fillings all complimented each other along with the meat. Between the steak & cheese and the roast beef sandwich... roast beef wins. Their fries are definitely a must-get because instead of looking like regular fries, they are actually sliced up pieces of a potato that are then put into the fryer. Very good. 

Overall, shoot. I can't wait till I get the chance to come back here again. :)
author: Venus L.

description:
I enjoy knowing random facts, but I just can't seem to find legit source as to what a "Boston Style Sub" is.

CASH ONLY 

I walked in, and closed the door behind me. This space is a bit small, but cozy. I looked at the menu, and then looked at Yelp to figure out what's good here. While browsing yelp, I saw that it was cash only and quickly scoured my wallet to see if I had enough money. I had enough for a Medium sandwich. 

Pastrami with "The Works" & Provolone - Med 7.40ish after tax - Overall, this sandwich seem fairly large upon opening it up. However, it was not as filled up as I had hoped. The layer of meat was less than I expected, and it could definitely use just a little bit more veggies.

The specifics:
- The bread was perfectly toasted. There was a nice fluffiness to the inside, while being crispy on the outside. You need to eat this sandwich immediately or else it will get soggy.
- The veggies were a bit under par. Couldn't really tell how fresh everything was, but the tomato flavour didn't really pop, and the lettuce was very neutral. 
- The meat was good, just could have added a bit more at this price point.
- See pictures for sizing. The Med was about 8.5 inches long, and 2.6ish inches tall. 

- Asking for Extra Hot Sauce - When I was waiting for my sandwich to be made, I realized that "Extra Hot Sauce" could have either meant the sauce is extra hot, or I wanted twice the amount of hot sauce. I'm not exactly sure how they took it, but they ended up asking me if I wanted the mild sauce or the spicy one. I asked for the spicy one.
-- The hot sauce is subtle. You don't really notice it until you stop eating for a second. It's not super spicy, but you can probably taste the tang.

I think this place is worth giving another shot. It was flavourful and definitely pretty yummy. I want to try the steak and cheese and fries next time. Seems A-OK. Not necessarily recommending it, but I'll probably return one more time.
author: Kaje Y.

description: LOVE this place!! Yellow Submarine is my go-to sandwich place in SF. The owners are really nice, and you can tell they are really passionate about food. The pepper steak sandwich is incredible. Get the homemade spicy sauce! Cash only - but not expensive at all. Definitely worth visiting!
author: Rachel K.

description:
I had a flash back so I returned and actually found my favorite sandwich store from the 70's!  I so love these old shacks that just won't go away, especially in the age of modern flashy submarine stores.  I just asked the guy to build me a pastrami sandwich to cure the munchies as if I'm going to be executed tomorrow at San Quentin.  I should have ordered 2.

Ohh, the sandwiches are terrible so don't go - that way the line is shorter.  

These sandwiches remind me to 'tower of power - back to oakland', 'earth wind and fire - shining star', 'Chicago - saturday in the park'.  

Yours truly,

Washington Eagles - All city wrestling '79, they still have my name in the locker room.
author: Ken T.

description: This is hands down, the BEST sandwich joint in town. I grew up in the neighborhood and have been going to Yellow Sub for over three decades and they are great! The Sandwichs are delicious and are consistently so. Jack, Rami and "mom" are a fixture and when I have been away from the city for a while, it's like seeing friends I have missed. Regardless, it's always a pleasure to see them. The steak and cheese with extra grilled onions is my go to. If you haven't been to Yellow Sub before, I would say that's a good place to start. If you like spice, get it with both the regular and the Homemade Hot Sauce.
author: S B.

description:
Dang. Now this is how you make a sub sandwich.

Italian combo has a plethora of delicious meats and "the works" is the holy grail of sandwich toppings. Ask for the homemade hot hot sauce... Do not get it on the side... Do not pass go... They will had you a toasty sandwich that is perfectly balanced and made with love.

The guy (and owner) at the register is really nice, and was very helpful after he asked and learned that we were first timers. He recommended some great options and chatted with us later about what to get next time.

Medium is actually large and the large is actually huge. Order of fries is enough to split. They arent super crispy due to the cut, but they are decent. GREAT food to price ratio, which seems to be slowly disappearing from the inner sunset.

I'm a little upset that this is the first time I've visited this spot in my neighborhood. So many delicious sandwiches I've missed...

Only complaint is it's CASH ONLY. This fact will definitely keep me from coming here more.
author: Haley J.

description: First time customer but will definitely come back! They were very friendly, and the sandwiches were bomb! The bread was so warm and crunchy!
author: Christine R.

description:
First, I'd like to present you all with something valuable: the menu.

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-yellow-submarine-san-francisco?select=Ka-cdG4TYJUnVjtShVCAgA#Ka-cdG4TYJUnVjtShVCAgA

Second, I'd like to clarify "The Works" that the gentleman's head is blocking: pickles, tomatoes, lettuce, onions, oil, vinegar, mayo, hot sauce, mustard, and cheese options of American, Swiss, or provolone.

Third, I'd like to recommend that, no matter what sandwich you get, get it large ($8.95 versus $6.79 for a medium), and it will serve as two meals. Whether you eat it for lunch and dinner, or you split it with a friend (or enemy, or frenemy), that choice is up to you.

Fourth, I'd suggest that you add on an order of $2.29 FRENCH FRIES (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-yellow-submarine-san-francisco?select=Ka-cdG4TYJUnVjtShVCAgA#b8CiWqO26hdDai4j9tvBlw). Because they will be unlike any other french fries you have ever eaten--like softer, thicker versions of huge potato chips. Oh, and not oversalted. They are GREAT.

Last, but not least, is that my friend and I split a large STEAK & CHEESE sandwich with provolone (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-yellow-submarine-san-francisco?select=Ka-cdG4TYJUnVjtShVCAgA#af9eCmNlfLud7bDsGny3Pw) for $8.95. It's a LOT of food (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-yellow-submarine-san-francisco?select=Ka-cdG4TYJUnVjtShVCAgA#1bc5Pfy1HaDKtQzzuOoqtg), but tastily so. The steak is fairly salty, but the salt is tempered by the sandwich fillings and the chewy bread. And let's not forget how amazing melted provolone is.

Conclusion: filling and affordable. Good.
author: Adele F.

description:
I just love this place. For over 15 years I've been coming from San Jose just to have a sandwich. I absolutely love the fact its been the same people working there this entire time. It's family owned ! 

I wish they took credit cards but they dont, there is an ATM outside but its normally broken SO bring cash just in case! 

I get the roast beef with avacado  its soooooo damn good.
author: Danielle B.

description: Great steak and cheese sandwich. The bread was top notch and the size was huge. Service was also really great. Definitely go if you are hungry for a quality sub.
author: Jason T.

description: Amazing steak and cheese with awesome home made hot sauce definitely the best sandwich in the city!!!
author: Colleen D.

description:
Delicious subs and awesome service. I had the steak and cheese, my son had the Italian combo--both great. The hot sauce was added to the latter and added a great heat. The mustard they used was also delicious. Go for everything on your sub--you won't regret it.

The medium was filling for me and the large looked like a good size for a hungry person. The IBC root beer with real sugar was a nice touch.

There are several decent size tables inside and they aren't all pushed together. It's a very nice casual dining area.

This feels like a family sub shop and reminds me of ones I grew up with in Buffalo, NY. The menu selection is great and the bread excellent. I'll definitely visit here again when I'm down in Inner Sunset.
author: Kevin H.

description:
Who lives in a yellow submarine? The best local sandwich place in the Sunset, that's who! This mom and pop shop has been alive and kicking for longer than I've been alive and they've spent that time perfecting their subs. But, let's be clear, this is a submarine sandwich joint, so if you don't like subs... you might not believe the hype. Also, it's cash only... which is a little behind the time.
 
This is subs done right! If you need suggestions, the Steak and Cheese is classic while the Rueben is top notch. And before I forget, the fries! They are thinly sliced pieces of potatoes... these ain't your mama's fries, but they are phenomenal.

YUMMER SCORE: Food - 8 Service - 8 Experience - 7
author: Ryan M.

description:
Came here after our Lyft driver suggested it as some friends and I were looking to quell our hunger on our way to Hardly Strictly Bluegrass Festival. I could tell it was popular because of the line and packed dining area, but I think that got my expectations up too much as a result.

To start, it's cash only. There's an ATM right outside connected to the store...but of course it charges you a service fee. To add, the owner/man at the counter was not happy to take our orders. I'll give him the benefit of the doubt that he was maybe just having an bad day, but nonetheless he condescendingly told my friend he was waiting for him to pick what cheese he wanted when it was pretty clear my friend didn't even know that he had to do that. Moreover, no "welcome's, please's, thank you's, enjoy's, good bye's, etc." were exchanged, even after I thanked him and bid him farewell. I encourage the management here to try and take an interest in the customers - food only gets you so far in my opinion...and there are a lot of sandwich shops in the city.

Of course, though food only goes so far, it is the reason we came here in the first place. That being said, I will first say that my sandwich definitely tasted good. I got the Italian Steak Sandwich. It was stacked with meat, the cheese melted all throughout, and the bread stayed warm and soft. You get a savory taste of all the flavors as a result of whatever they used to pepper their steak - felt nice on the taste buds. I got the medium sized sandwich and it was honestly large enough for me to split into two meals. Overall though, the sandwich was grand, but didn't blow my mind. There are plenty of sandwich spots in Sunset, I wouldn't particularly say that this one stands above the rest based off of taste alone. 

I will be back to try another sandwich and either validate or invalidate whether the man who took my order was just having a bad day or not. However, I feel like it will be my last trip if the benefit of the doubt I'm giving him is invalidated. If we were only allowed to use five words in our reviews to describe our experience, I think I would say: Tasty potential, but needs work.
author: Shayan S.

description: #2 sandwich place I've ever been to. The #1 is in McCall, Idaho and is a totally different type of sandwich. The family that runs this place is so nice and so great to watch. If you extend a tiny bit of courtesy they will treat you like you've been a family friend forever. The sandwiches are always great. The homemade hot sauce is great and recommended. I've been here too many times and will come back any time I want a good sandwich in the city.
author: Curtis P.

description: Place is great. Old school, been here for a long time. Great sandwiches, homemade fries. Same son and mom combo at the place all the time. Cash only. Get a great sandwich and walk to the park!
author: Nathan G.

description:
Cons: Don't take cards and when asked for water they give you a small lukewarm cup from the back (meaning I would have to continually ask). 

My review is for the popular pepper steak sandwich with everything on it. I came here on an afternoon weekday and overall, it really did not "wow" me, which is why I gave it a 2 stars "I've experienced better" review. I have just been to sandwich places that offered more meat, with amazing special sauce, and were HUGE (specifically thinking little luccas). The person taking my order just seemed bored and not very welcoming. Maybe he was having a off-day? It could have been the fact that I took it to go and had to travel 10 minuets before eating it that it was soggy and less amazing as the rest of the reviews say. I will be giving this another try in the future since it is conveniently close to me but I think I will try another sandwich option. I will update if there needs to be any major corrections on this rating.
author: Maybo H.

description: They are not the best in the City, but the best in the neighborhood. Steak and cheese sandwich is the way to go for me. Service is efficient and memorable.
author: James C.

description:
Ok let's talk about sandwiches. A go to grab and go food for people on a daily basis! But what makes a good sandwich?  The quality of ingredients? The amount of toppings? "Secret sauces"? I would say all of these go into a top notch delicious sandwich, but what most places do with simple precision and speed yellow sub goes above and beyond and takes the time to wrap up amazing Sandies. 

   You can feel the warmth of yellow subs passion for sandwiches just walking by. But if you step inside this cozy little corner inner sunset sandwich staple stop you'll immediately fall in love. The overwhelming aroma of freshly grilled onions and steak just makes my mouth water. Fresh cut potato chip cut fries? Don't mind if I do. Add garlic? Why yes please!!! Homemade hot sauce on my steak and cheese please sir and yes I want the works!! 

  If you find yourself in dire need of a amazing sandwich that's made with love and passion. This is your stop, I do suggest calling in ahead because the wait can be rather long at time. Ranging from 15-20 mins!!! 

Ps. The veal Parmesan and steak and cheese will make you an addict. Always go hard or go home with the homemade hot sauce!!
author: Robert B.

description:
I was first introduced to yellow submarine over 10 years ago by my neighbor. I been going at least twice a year since. The food taste is still good however I have a few complaints. 

The price has seemed to go up constantly. On some level I understand but considering they always have taken only cash and many sub places can offer better prices. I don't see how a sandwich can cost $10.80 after taxes. That is just the sandwich nothing else.

The sandwiches themselves have also seemed to get smaller. I don't have photos of any time years ago but it's what I perceive. 

It is still a good submarine place. However with competition being better priced for the value I only come here to relive the flavor.

Important tips are that every submarine comes with 

Pickles 
Tomatoes
Lettuce 
Onions
Oil (who knows what type?) 
Vinegar 
Mayonnaise 
Hot sauce ( definitely ask for extra!!!)
Mustard

And choice of cheese either

American, Swiss or Provolone
author: Nathan A.

description: Admittedly I had not been here in a few years. It was reminded about this place while watching Check Please.  Stopped by at 6:10pm on a Monday to find the door locked.  A guy arrived at the same time as me picking up an order.  The owner(assuming) said "we have his order but we can't make yours".  No explanation! And their hours are posted as closing at 8:30pm.  So, I basically have no need to ever patronize this place again
author: Terry M.

description: Solid sandwich shop. Can't believe this place has been around for 40+ years!! Service was off the charts. Friendly, and really came through on something that they absolutely did not have to do. If you're in the hood, definitely check it out.
author: D R.

description: The Yellow Submarine is the gem of this neighborhood, I could eat here everyday! I tried many other subs but I have to say that nothing beats these ones. The fries are also great, and the people that run the place are super nice. Try it for yourself!
author: Agustina A.

description: I always get a large avocado sub with all the fixings (don't leave off the delicious hot sauce!  It's not too spicy but nice and tangy).  The best sub I've ever had!  I crave it regularly.  The staff is friendly in a gruff, no-nonsense sort of way, which I appreciate.
author: Helle S.

description:
I went here for lunch and got the Pepper Steak sub. The medium sized sandwich was pretty big and filling. The warm and toasty sub was great. The potato chips were good but a little greasy. Basically its just thick slices of potato fried up. 

They have a small seating area with some tables. It can get crowded during lunch hour.
author: Alexander L.

description:
First review ever because this was hands down the largest sub I've EVER had and only shop named after a Beatle's album. I recommend sharing w a friend or SO! For $10. I got a large sized steak and cheese with everything but mayo, which came in at about 1.5x the width and thickness of a subway footlong, and same length. And after eating half a sandwich, I, a 5'9 human being, was satiated for the next 5 hours from the very generous amount of steak.

The bread is also very nicely toasted and has a crunch to it, while the steak and cheese offer a balance of softness.
author: Shelley C.

description:
The sandwich was good but I would say its over hyped. Def not a place to go out of your way to have, but if you're in the area, it's not a bad place for a sandwich. 

I got the steak and cheese which was decent and had a lot more flavor than the turkey sandwich that my girlfriend got. I do like the vinegar they add.
author: Peter H.

description: Great fresh sandwiches that is perfectly toasted! Fries are to die for when they are slightly crispy! Very delicious!! It is a must-go!
author: Chrysanthemum R.

description:
3.5 Stars!

In the world of sandwiches it is highly competitive. shops are putting ingredients that normally you wouldn't be put on a sandwich 20 years ago. Yellow submarine seems to stick with the basics and has been doing them good for years now

There are certain factors that i like about YS: one, they toast and heat their meet. Something so simple like this can change a sandwich entirely and still today not a lot of places do it. Two, they  keep it simple. They do go for fancy garlic spreads or special cheeses, just the normal works with a splash of hot sauce. 

I wasn't excited about their high prices, i ordered a salami sandwich with cheese and the works (lettuce,tomatoes,pickles,lettuce, mayo/mustard and hot sauce) and it was $10. Sandwich was about 12" long - pretty big sub, but $10 is probably one of the more expensive sandwiches. Even ike's place doesn't charge that much and they cram hella crap into their sandwiches. 

I did enjoy their sandwiches, because i can appreciate the simplicity of it. I love sandwiches and i can't believe that some places can't taste better than a turkey and cheese sandwich that you make at home for free. Its hard to justify coming back because i make this sandwich at home as well since its not overly complex. 

So here is my overall rating 

Would I recommend this place? Yes! 
Does the sandwiches taste good? Yes! 
Is it worth $10? Questionable 


Its like going to the movies and paying $10 vs staying home and pirating it lol jk.
author: Ryan R.

description: Great cheese steak!  Must get the house 'home made' hot sauce.  Cash only, but worth it.
author: Jai V.

description:
I love the simplicity of this place! My friend took me here as our first stop of our SF Food Adventure and I was just amazed by how delicious the sandwiches here were. This Mom & Pop Show only offers one kind of bread and the sandwiches here are just really simple. You can really get a good taste of everything you're eating and every bite is just so heavenly. Don't forget to add the spicy sauce to your sandwich either!

The portions here are huge and enough to share with two people if you get the large sandwich. It basically looks like two medium sized sandwiches when you order a large. The fries here are also really delicious and not like your average french fry, They're actual round potato slices, and it compliments the sandwich well! Can't wait to come back!
author: MyTien P.

description:
Been coming to this shop for years but never got around to writing a review until a cousin who was visiting alerted me to the fact that a lot of the yelp pics made the sandwiches look unappetizing. n_n;;; I decided to rectify the situation with a pic of my own and a glowing review. =D

I personally love how nice and attentive the staff are. Always greeted with a smile and they're super nice on the phone when I call in. I'm also very Asian when it comes to my sandwiches meaning I expect it toasty, crunchy and loaded with toppings (where be my lettuce McDonald's!!??). When you add on avocado they pretty much give you the whole thing! Mmmmmm. I've had the pepper steak, cheese steak, tuna, corned beef, hot pastrami and chicken. Pretty pleased with all of them but the chicken and corned beef were a bit saltier than I would have liked but then again I have been accused of being bland by my friends. =P The cheese steak is my personal fave, cheesy with caramelized onions and tender pieces of beef! XD if you're in the area and craving a tasty sandwich this is the place to hit up!
author: Jennifer O.

description: These sandwiches are so fresh and full of great flavor. I've only gotten one and that is the philly with everything on it and I will never get anything else. Try it and you will be hooked
author: T G.

description:
Kind of a hole in the wall, wouldn't have noticed it without Yelp, but great sandwiches. Nothing fancy, just expertly done subs. 

One of my favorite Italian subs I've ever had. Again, nothing fancy, just fresh ingredients and everything was proportioned just right.
author: Steven K.

description:
Came here for the first time and ordered a turkey & ham sandwich. My friend had the pepper steak sandwich.

Small little shop right on the corner that's CASH ONLY. We didn't know and didn't have cash on us so the man behind the register allowed us to run down the block to the bank while he makes our sandwiches and pay when we got back.

No complaints for this sandwich shop. I love sandwiches and am very picky with how it's made but this place is great.

*HIGHLY RECOMMEND* getting their French fries. They cut them into potato chip shapes and are fried to perfection. Depending on the thickness of the slices, you get crunchy chip textures and soft fries textures.

Yellow Submarine, definitely recommended!

I ordered a medium and it was pretty big so I was able to bring it back home to enjoy after.
author: Christine N.

description: great selection of subs including toasted subs. the large is probably 10-11" . we got the pastrami , corned beef, and an excellent Philly Cheesesteak as well. The garlic "fries" are actually potato slices and are also really good. A basket it enough for four people. Nice people running the place too. parking wasn't a problem, there is a small pay lot on 7th if you don't find street parking.
author: Dave M.

description: There is no better place to get a submarine sandwich in the Sunset District. My best friend and I share the large chicken sandwich because it's definitely enough for two. The fries are really cool and fresh and delish. Natural soda is available. The staff is chill.
author: Angela F.

description:
The Yellow Submarine on Irving is a convenient sandwich shop that offers basic sandwiches at reasonable prices. I've had both their steak and chicken sandwiches; both were good but nothing to write home about. 

Recommendation: 
-The large size sandwich is a better cost-value option - you will have food leftover. 
-Bring cash... cash only

Verdict: 
Because of it's proximity and convenience, I visited Yellow Submarine a couple of times. I wouldn't go out of my way for it though.
author: Laila A.

description: Had the steak and cheese and it was delicious. Make sure you have cash because there are no cards accepted.
author: Eddie P.

description:
Love this very old eating establishment.  The sandwiches are made to order and made with love.  I had the pastrami and Ruben.   

I was even pleasantly  surprised when I ordered the garlic fries.  Usually when ordering fries they are long and lean and usually come out of a bag.... BUT these fries were homemade!
They potato slices wit chunks of garlic and seasoning on them.  I must have had 2 large potatoes.

The owner is a cute little elderly lady that was so sweet. 

This is a great place for a yummy sandwich!
author: Tammy B.

description: I was excited when I thought this might be a good sub place in the neighborhood. This however is not it! The subs seem mediocre to me and the staff is stingy with ingredients even if your willing to pay for extras.  I really don't want to recall one incident but with all the other times I felt this place was subpar, there was one occurrence that totally turned me off to them. My girl ordered a sub and wanted avocado on it, however the guy behind the counter refused to give her avocado on it even though she was willing to pay for the avocado The reason? They did not have enough avocado, so they wanted to "save" it for people that ordered vegetarian sandwiches... even though there is a market where they could've bought extra avocados if they run out just a few blocks away. They decided to just play hardball and refuse to please the customer. If a customer is unreasonable, I can understand that, however this was a perfectly good request but they were too stubborn to care. Good customer service is not their priority which indicates what they serve is not important either. I'm reasonable but this place is not the kind of business I can support.
author: Martin G.

description: I hesitated to write a review because the lines are always long as it is, but the owners are so nice and the cheese steak sandwiches never disappoint. I always get them with the homemade hot sauce, but tell them not to put too much or your mouth will def be on fire!
author: Hanster P.

description: Really good people behind the counter who will happily explain the menu. Super good food, good prices. Cash only which is always annoying but worth it.
author: Preston C.

description:
I work in the area and come here every now and then. This place is pretty good. Their bread and the hot sauce they put on their sandwiches is what gets me. Very old school vibe. Haven't tried anything else, so I can't judge it anymore than I have! 
Although the health score kinda makes me cringe.... being in the restaurant biz, anything under a 90 is kinda unacceptable in my eyes.
author: Bat V.

description: Very nice people. They have really good fresh cut fries. Not a huge fan of the sandwiches but they are pretty popular.
author: Kimia R.

description: Being from Boston, this is a nice treat. I spoke with the current owner and learn that the previous owners previous owner was from Boston. They've got great sandwiches reasonably priced, and a very relaxed environment.
author: Rodger R.

description: Bread is pretty good. Comes out toasty,warm, crispy, and crunchy. I Always say that the bread can give away how good a sandwich will be and for this sandwich it definitely did some justice. The turkey sandwich is prolly a 7/10. For a sandwich and what it comes with.. it is kinda basic but still a good simple sandwich. Nice vibes, and good service.
author: Nikole D.

description:
the Yellow Submarine features Boston style subs....cold cuts, pastrimi .. reuben, many variations available (m.7.35 lg 9ish) 

order at cashiers, pay, wait for food, dining area to the left.

eats: reuben (m7.35)
-sammie looked huge, mostly bread though
-meat thin sliced, not memorable
-stuffed with lotsa fine sliced lettuce, tomato, pickles, peppers, mayo, cheese,
sauce, pickles, sauerkraut?, etc.-the works
-had vinegar taste overall
-bigger than Ike's, not as tasty

crumbs:
-5-10 minutes wait time
-looks like a line, 4th person in line is literally standing outside the door.
some psychology at work here.
-only 1 sammie maker.
-patrons waiting outside the door.
-lack of parking may discouraged me from repeating
no great desire either.
author: Victor G.

description:
My first time here.

I decided to go today to eat for later... I got the steak and cheese with no tomatoes, pickles, and mustard. I just don't care for those things... but I end up getting the works regardless of what I asked for.

Oh and did I mention that a fly flew out once I unwrapped my sandwich? I think I just saved his life. Cool beans.
author: Karry D.

description:
Solid place to get sandwiches. It's been around for years and the family owning it is very nice, police and friendly. My favorite sandwiches are the avacado, and the Italian. My boyfriend and I usually order one of each, and swap halves to have a little bit of both. FRIES ARE AMAZING HERE -- definitely something you can't get somewhere else. They are russet potatoes that are sliced to look like potato chips, then fried like french fries. Love the shape! Usually soggy with a few "chips" -- just the way I love them.

Tip:  you can call ahead of time and order your sandwiches so you don't have to wait, which is a huge time saver!

The low health score kinda scares me, but I've just accepted it. The sandwiches and fries have always been so tasty, so much that you can't help but eat them.
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Nice hot sandwiches with plenty of fixings an easy walk from UCSF. A medium is plenty. No bread choices, but the bread they have is great - soft on the inside and warm and crisp on the outside. Family owned, this is a cash only operation.
author: Julia L.

description:
One day after the gym, my sister and I were looking for a place to grab lunch real quick. I only had $8 in cash and some change. We saw that it was Cash Only, but thought we could still afford a large sandwich, based on the pictures of the menu on Yelp.
Price update: $6.99 med, $9.19 large

We only ended up being able to afford a medium Reuben sandwich. :(

We saw some people with the French fries $2.29, and it looked so good! couldn't afford it though, so I will have to come back and try it. It's different from the fries you see at most places, these ones are round (more like the shape of a chip), just like how my grandma used to make them!

You can also phone in your order to lessen the wait.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Yum yum yum!

Delicious sandwiches! We came here around 2pm on Friday afternoon and the place was bustling. We ordered an Italian Combo and a Hot Pastrami sandwich. It takes about 10 minutes for the sandwiches to be ready but they were delicious! Definitely worth the wait. They're pretty big sandwiches and stuffed with meat. I'm kinda hungry just thinking about them.

We got our order to go but there are tables inside to dine-in. If they had a better beer selection, we probably would have stayed. 

A must try!
author: Kimberly B.

description: Not even close to what I expected, it was soggy, the bread left a lot of room for improvement, the amount of pastrami was sad it reminded me of the old Wendy's comerciales, "WHERE'S THE BEEF" ,it was all bread and lettuce and before I went in on all websites that came up it mentioned 2 diferente combos that supposedly hadn't been around for years, after all this they don't take credit or debit only cash no smiley faces definitely won't be going back
author: Osvaldo C.

description:
Cozy sub spot with efficient service, huge sandwiches, and really a great price! 

Got the Italian steak with provolone and the works sin mayo and it came out quick, hot and delicious. Saw another customer eating the fries (they look like thick cut kettle chips) and I'm gonna have to try them next time. 

The medium is HUGE (and less than $8?!) like it could satisfy even the largest of appetites. Get the large with fries to split with a friend and I (almost) guarantee you'll both leave very full and happy. 

Really solid sub spot, definitely better than sub center on west portal if you're needing a go to spot on this side of the city. Just a block away from GGP as well.
author: Siobhan T.

description:
Lets start off that this shop has one of the nicest familys running it. I grew up in the neighborhood and would always see the mother making sandwhiches. I rarely see her now that they hired a new cook. He does a equally good job as the mother and sons

Theres two cute hunky brothers that work the register. (had a crush on the younger one since 6th grade) hahaha. I remember YEARSS ago, when i was in  elemantary school I didnt have enough money for my sandwhich I ordered. I said I would go home, a couple blocks away, and be right back. One of the bro's, I forgot his name, said it was fine...even though i still owed like 6 dollars!!! My family were regulars and Im sure he recognized my face. I never forgot this friendly neighborhood gesture, and always leave a tip in the tip jar.  

for the past 15 years, ive always ordered the pepper steak with 2 orders of fries. I LOVE the fries, more like thick chips perfectly crunchy. Make sure you eat the fries at the shop. They get super soggy if you order takeout. The sandwhich too!! Theres so much juice pouring out the sandwhich that it usually soaks through the paper to-go bag.

The sandwhiches are consistantly good and satisfy my sub cravings. I wish they added more meat in the sandwhich though. Theres ALOT of bread, which isint really a bad thing since its crunchy and delicious...but it wouldnt hurt to have a little more meat. Being a carnivore i always appreciate lots of meat in a sub,

For always being friendly neighborhood faces, i give 5 stars to The Yellow Submarine.
author: Andrew V.

description:
I've pretty much become a regular here.
