You'd think I tried everything on the menu, but I've only tried about less than half, which include the steak & cheese, Italian steak, pepper steak, avocado, turkey, dry Italian salami, and hot pastrami. You can't go wrong with their Italian steak or pepper steak. Those two are similar, but definitely my favorites! They toast your sandwiches, so the bread is slightly burnt at the edges, making it very crispy and crunchy. They also pack your sandwiches here with fresh ingredients: shredded lettuce, tomatoes, onions, and pickles. You can choose between a medium or a large, both of which are HUGE! If I'm really hungry, I can definitely finish a medium all by myself.

Every time I come here, I've gotten quick, friendly service. It's often crowded here during weekend lunch times. I highly recommend phoning in your order. Hands down, The Yellow Submarine is my favorite sandwich shop in this neighborhood!
author: Priscilla W.

description:
I've been coming here for 10+ years and I always, ALWAYS order the same thing: medium steak and cheese with everything + hot sauce and fries. The sandwich is a good size, I usually can't finish all of the deliciousness.  The roll is toasted, the veggies are fresh and the meat is juicy and so flavorful.  The fries aren't your normal fries, they are softer with a large surface area, still tasty nonetheless.  

Service is fast, cash only.
author: Lesliegh H.

description:
Huge sandwich within walking distance of campus, with a cutesy catchy name, and looks like an inexpensive hole-in-the-wall?  No wonder the Yellow Sub is a beloved staple that you'll constantly hear good things about.

The sandwiches are delicious, especially coming from me because I've always had a meh attitude about sandwiches.  I got the Italian sandwich, which had the perfect flavor from the peppery Italian meats, a thin layer of melted provolone, a bed of lettuce to balance everything, and the crispy bread.  Mmm, toasty.  I suggest sharing because it's pretty big, and by the time you get to the second half, it's not warm and toasty anymore.  Oh first world problems...

I also tried the fries, which are cross sections of fried potato.  It's very interesting unlike any other fries I've ever seen, and it'd make a great Instagram (wayy too many In-N-Out grams out there), but in terms of taste I don't think it was anything too amazing.  

It's a little over $7 for a medium size, which is not that cheap of a lunch.  

What worried me the most is the 66/100 health score... Even questionable-looking Asian places rank in the 80s at least.
author: Edna C.

description:
I have to give a huge shout out to the kind, efficient, super friendly young man at the counter last Saturday afternoon.  The joint was jumping.  He helped everyone with no hint of stress -- starving teens, screaming babies, harried parents, grumpy, tummy-rumbling painters on a short lunch break... no sweat for this guy.

I showed up at the peak of a big rush, parched!  I was near bonking from a long, steep bike ride that ended with the loss of my full water bottle as I hit one of the hundreds of potholes on the south side of Camino Alto.  My dehydrated brain didn't think straight -- I hadn't realized that the bottle had flown off my bike (in retrospect, a thought slowly pierced my addled consciousness -- "oh yeah-- that's what that scitter-scatter noise was boinging off my bike as I set a PR downhill.") I had, since losing this important rehydration tool, pedaled past many a public drinking fountain through Mill Valley, Sausalito, that International Orange Bridge you light have noticed, through the Presidio and then Golden Gate Park.  Dozens of opportunities to refill my remaining, empty bottle all missed.
Sad.  
Stupid.  
Blessedly, my only (weak) defense is that such a thing is entirely out of character.

Back to this wonderful young man at the sub shop:
Thank you for filling my one remaining bottle without breaking stride mid-cash register-grill flip-order taking-minor emergencies brought by various clients during a late lunch rush.  
You might have saved my life.  Who knows what idiocy I would have commited had i pedaled further without water?

I didn't taste the subs here -- but I recommend the place 100% for great customer service.
author: Scott C.

description:
"Hello yellow sub, how many sandwiches"

"One Italian combo, everything on it, house sauce."

"Any French fries today?"

"Nope not today"

"Alright it'll be 15 min"

I do this 3-4 times a week. Can't go wrong with this place. Fries are delicious too though!
author: Sean T.

description:
I'm a total fan. Great vibe and style from the owners, and sammys hit the spot every time. The Hot Pastrami has a slight edge over the Steak & Cheese, IMO - and the fries are just right. 

Honorable mention: YS's homemade hot sauce
author: Kevin G.

description:
Hole in the wall sandwich place. Loved their fries; giant round cuts of a full potato. 

Their sandwiches are big! Even as a reg, you can't eat the whole thing. Italian steak, I believe is what I got. I liked it. 

Bit far for me, but definitely more worth it than Subway
author: Bahar A.

description:
To start off: cash only...now the review:
As a sandwich connoisseur I place Yellow Sub as one of my top 3 sandwich spots in the Sunset district. I have lost count how many times I have been there, but I am in love with their chicken and steak sandwiches. When I am in need of a sandwich this is a popular spot for me. They are close to UCSF (walking distance). Family run. Small shop, but I generally pick up my sandwiches and eat them at home or library. The prices are fair and they give you a good amount. I am moving in 6 months, but that means I will be venturing out to Yellow Sub another 30 times before I leave. 

FYI: they put hot sauce on most of their sandwiches which is fine, but I am a pansy so I ask for not no hot sauce (granted its not that hot, but I feel it detracts from the sandwiches flavor).
author: Soroosh A.

description:
Very nice man behind the counter.  
I was sent here from my neighbor who has been going here for years.  He said I'd love it.  I told the man behind the counter that it was my first time but I had heard great things.  He told me he wanted to make me a sandwich I'd love then and chose the lean pastrami with homemade hot sauce.  I LOVED IT!  Light, fluffy inside, crunchy outside, FRESH bread, and delicious.  I had an organic honey mint iced tea with it and the home fries were delicious.  As he gave me the sandwich, he said, "You'll be back."  He was right!
author: Deniece S.

description: This neighborhood sandwich shop is a solid stop. We grabbed a medium meatball sub and an Italian sub, the verdict is that we will be back! We're eyeing the Reuben and Pastrami subs! Yum!
author: Heidi K.

description: Love  these subs so much!!!  The guys mom works here I think,  and she is the cutest little lady I have ever met! They're kind folks,  who make some amazing sandwiches!  Get the homemade sauce
author: Anonymous T.

description: BEST SUB EVER! if you think differently, then your probably brain dead from eating not as superb Subs as these.
author: Milton P.

description:
Awesome sandwiches for awesome prices. I have been here twice and both time I have ordered the hot pastrami sandwich, a very juicy and yummy alternative to my usual turkey sandwich. The waiting is not to long and the prices are pretty reasonable. Two times, I have ordered the medium size and only ate one half for lunch. I call this a bargain! 

Although I've only tried one type of sandwich I want to try the roast beef and other varieties as well. The all look so good. I also like the fact that they allow call in orders, especially if I am in a rush. This is a bonus to the service and sandwiches. Overall my experience here has been pleasant and I will return soon.
author: Jessica E.

description:
Boyfriends been talking about this place for the longest and finally had a late dinner here last night. Took about 15 minutes to find parking but none the less, we found parking. Looked at the menu for a bit and was greeted by a lady who in fact was the owner. Beyond kind and super sweet lady. I asked what the most popular sandwich is and she said the Peppersteak, so the pepper steak it is! They have the option of either medium or large. Medium is already huge (big enough to share) so unless you're starving and haven't eaten in days, I suggest getting the medium. If you're sharing, get the large.  Also ordered the French fries and a bag of chips.

Peppersteak sandwich was really good. The meat was very flavorful and the bread they use has the perfect crunch to go along with each bite. The fries were cut and fried like potato chips. Not as crunchy as I would want them but it had some what of a crunch outside and very soft inside! Pretty much like a French fry but it's potato chip fry (great concept.)

All in all, I would definitely go back here. I love hot sandwiches and on top of that I love fries. Parking sucks so expect to waste some time looking for it.
author: Charlene B.

description: Needed a quick bite to eat while in the area and thankfully found this gem! Great price and amazing, tasty, non-greasy food! I struggle when I eat out to find filling yet good quality food, and this fit that bill tenfold. I don't live in this neighborhood so I might not be able to come back to it, but the food was so good that I felt compelled to leave this review :)
author: Esmeralda P.

description: Finally tried this famous sandwich spot after all the good reviews i read and heard from everyone. I tried the hot pastrami sandwich with their house spicy sauce that people  have been calling it " a killer special that you must try".  Ok, portion wise, its pretty decent, for $7+ a bit you get a medium.  But it was just that, nothing special to me to be honest.  I also tried their famous fires $2.29 per order (or potato chip ), not impressed either, way too soggy.  I was told i should have asked for deep fried twice to make it right.  Anyways, there was tons of people waiting while we dine there.  I guess people just like them, unlike me. =) They were ok, but definitely didn't win my vote as a fan.
author: Jasmin Y.

description: Warm, cruncy-soft, juicy amazingness. We had the Italian combo and steak and cheese with the fries, which were like a potato chip- fry hybrid. Requested some extra hot sauce on the side. Super primo sandwiches
author: Anna M.

description: Fresh, tasty and hearty corned beef sandwich! Spicy sauce is tasty and the medium is a good sized sandwich. Definitely will try it again.
author: Juan P.

description: Hands down best sandwich shop in the world. Home made Hot sauce is so yummy. Garlic fries are good too. I'll be back
author: Jason R.

description: Love this spot, Romey and his mom go out of their way to make their guests happy,  Mom makes her sauce daily and it has great flavor.  My favorite is the Veal Parm sandwich.  If you are coming from out of town call ahead to make sure there is sauce left because they do run out.
author: Paul G.

description: Stopped in after a long flight from NY, and the 1st place we tried to go to was closed, so happy the wooly pig was out of business.  I highly suggest listening to the owners, after thinking we wanted plain sandwiches he suggested getting them with everything, as they have been doing this for 40 years, he was right. The Italian combo was the best I have had and the steak sandwich with everything. Besides the food you can tell this is a long time family run business with a very friendly family. Will return if we return to San Francisco.
author: Tosha D.

description: Best sandwiches in SF!! The salami is my favorite! I wish they came with something - $10 for large. But still not bad for the best sandwich! The 70s style shop is still a good atmosphere with illustrations on the wall reminiscent of school house rock.
author: Martie A.

description: Just about the best sandwich shop around.  I had the Italian sandwich with provolone chese. Toasted perfectly and delicious.  The sauce has just enough bite. Will most definitely be back.
author: Steve W.

description: I drive all the way from concord just to eat hear when ever I can. Hands down the best sandwiches on the west coast. And you have to let them make it how they make it, don't change anything. Fresh toasty bread great choice of deli meats. And if u go you must try their version of french fries or Potato chips.  Also bring cash they don't take anything else.
author: Jenny G.

description: Awesome Sandwich Spot. I have been looking for a good sub sandwich place that is so good for me to go to during my lunch time. My Co-workers recommended this place so I Yelped it and seen so many good reviews.  I AGREE with the reviews. I had got the Turkey sandwhich..which was so delicious.  I LOVE MY Sandwiches toasted so that was perfect that they do that automatically.  I was scared to try their hot sauce because I really can't take spicy hot sauce but their's were just perfect. It gives the sandwich a Lil kick to it.  And the fries were delicious also. Love the idea of cutting it as a potato chip shape. I will definitely be coming back.
author: Valerie S.

description: Yum!! I always get the dry salami with everything on it. I'm usually not a fan of thick sliced fries. But their garlic fries are very tasty and a must with the sandwich!! The service is always friendly.
author: Jen A.

description:
Customer service was Ok. Ordered over the phone, he took my order down very quickly,  felt rushed! This was my first time ordering here. 15mins until pick up which was awesome during a busy evening. 

My friend picked the orders up. Which was ready when he arrived 2 sandwiches. 

This review is on mine. I ordered a roast beef with everything NO mustard NO onions. The sandwich had NO flavor what so ever. And it had an "old" like taste. Probably the roast beef. I only ate a few bites. It was just nasty. I've worked in A sandwich spot for 2yrs, I know what fresh tastes like... just saying! 

+ On the plus side, the potatoe salad was yummy. (Most likely out of a box)
author: Christina K.

description: some of the most amazing sandwiches in the city. Been coming her since i was a child. Steak and cheese.
author: Carlos H.

description: I used to be a big fan of this place,  I ordered takeout yesterday,  and found a hair after my second bite, ruined it for me forever.
author: Mona S.

description: Have been wanting to try this spot ever since seeing it featured on Check Please! and finally got to stop by last week. I ordered the hot pastrami, steak and cheese, and the french fries for my boyfriend and I. Overall, we felt that the sandwiches were underwhelming. They tasted a little bland and lacked flavor. The fries were not as crispy as I expected and just tasted like cooked potatoes. It was just alright and I was left disappointed after reading so many great reviews.
author: Christine K.

description:
Ordered Italian Steak Med with Avocado
Fries (or Fresh Fried Sliced Whole Potato)
Diet

With Tip - it was about $13.

Maybe I got the wrong thing - but I haven't experienced a sickness after eating in a very long time

Italian Steak - has Red Sauce in it, maybe it was that?
I did ask for it without onions...(don't make modifications)
Or sliced lettuce, tomato?
Or the avocado?
Or the very potatoes (which were very greasy)...
Or the diet coke.

At any rate, my friend ate his Pastrami and was just fine, so I think it was either the steak or the diet coke or the avocado...who knows...
author: EJ K.

description: Simple sandwiches.. me and my dad came in earlier.. he had suggested this place since he has been coming here since he was younger and I always love to try new sandwich places, so we gave it a go.. Small spot on the corner.. there is a dining area off to the side and then on the other side is where you order and where they do the cooking. I ended up getting the hot pastrami and my dad got the steak and cheese. We also go an order of fries.. what I didn't know and think is really cool is that its whole slices of potatoes fried.. they are really good when they are fresh and come out piping hot.. don't wait to eat them or they won't be too good... (and cold). The sandwich itself is okay... lack of meat.. if I am gonna pay like $8-9 bucks, I do expect more meat.... the flavor is okay.... nothing special really...
author: Tiff C.

description: This place has very good subs. Has one of the best juicy pepper steak sandwiches with their home made hot sauce. Also they have the best meatball sandwich I have ever had. It literally tastes like a bowl of spaghetti meatballs. This place is A1, would recommend.
author: Mankid A.

description: The workers were arguing when I walked in. The meatballs in the meatball sub I ordered tasted like dog food and were extremely mushy. Would not recommend the meatball sub to anyone.
author: Charles M.

description: This place sucks! I think the people who give 5 stars to this place have some serious issues with their taste buds. I ordered a simple sandwich (turkey) and the meat tasted like some super processed mess.  The bread was tough and it was way over priced.  I wont be back.
author: Joel G.

description:
It's Saturday, 7pm. Family sitting around plotting dinner ideas. Let's do sandwiches says one. Where asks another - Yellow Sub? 10 minutes later and 8 sandwich orders decided, it's time to make the call... "Hello, I'd like to order 8 sandwiches to go please." Response: "I'm sorry but we ran out of bread." 

Say waaaahhh?!?! =O 

What kind of sandwich places runs out of bread?!?! That's literally your bread...and butter!!! But in all seriousness that's inexcusable when running a sandwich shop. Sorry guys, your subs aren't half bad but one star for the poor business planning =(
author: F K.

description: There are no words...speechless...for these electrifying sandwiches. Yes sandwiches:  toasted tender foot longs with succulent cold best cuts, cheese, sauces, veggies. And "Mamas hot sauce". Phew. But it's not only the choice simple ingredients that make these sandwiches sing. It's the balance, yes balance of ingredients. It's not about mile high meat and cheese. It's about a symphony of favors. Get the Italian and garlic fries. 2 sandwiches and basket of house cut garlic potatoes (round fries) and a water $24. That's Amore!
author: Pc M.

description: Massive, delicious sandwiches.  Great place to stop by, especially after you've worked up an appetite from walking around in the park.  Simple counter service, though there are plenty of tables off to the side to sit and eat.  Food comes out fast too.  Will definitely stop by again on my next park trip.
author: Lars T.

description: I'm not a huge fan of sandwiches to be honest, but I really like this place. I got the hot pepper sandwich, and it was delicious. Also got fries and they are oh so crisp. The wait can be a bit long sometimes, but it's definitely good if you're craving a sandwich. Too bad I don't crave sandwiches that often otherwise I'd be here quite often.
author: Julie L.

description:
Seriously move over Ike's!

This place is truly one of the best sandwich places my taste buds have had the pleasure of eating.

I decided on the corned beef sandwich and got an order of their "chips", which are slices of potatoes that are thin and fried to perfection. Not greasy at all.

The sandwich was out of this world. Flavorful meat, great combination of veggies, and an amazing sauce to complete this sandwich of perfection.

Total damage= about $8. Now that is a bargain. I can't wait to get my next sandwich fix here.

*Cash only
author: Surge C.

description: Do not eat here. Pretend you never saw this page. The last thing I need is a giant line out the door. These sandwiches are downright amazing. Quality ingredients. Perfect proportions. Carefully prepared by people who have been doing it forever. That said, everyone has their own sandwich opinion, so you really will have to just try it and decide for yourself. I'm a fan of the American Combo and the Italian Combo, but I think everything here is delicious. If you don't know what to get, get the Steak and Cheese (unless you're one of those "back in Philly blah blah blah" guys).  I love the fries, but you may not. Get chips if you aren't sure.
author: Casey C.

description: Good sandwiches. Definitely a well know sandwich shop in the city. Some of the sandwich shave a little much going on for my liking as far as flavor a go. But I'm pretty basic. Definitely recommend.
author: Mitch C.

description: I have been going here for years.  My sandwich is the pepper steak with the homemade hot sauce.  The people are friendly and the food is always great.
author: Nancy M.

description:
It's been over a year since I've went and I've only been that one time and I'm just now getting around to writing the review for it (I wasn't Yelping back then). Anyway, it was that memorable that I'm writing about it over a year later. I got the cheese steak and my dad got the Reuben; both were amazing!! How I wish I could go back, but it's so far away from  me!

GO HERE PEOPLE.
author: Alexys E.

description:
This place is my second go to in comparison to the Submarine Center on West Portal.

The sandwiches are pretty large, so look to be pretty filled. It's a pretty unique looking shop, and the service is decent. Not too shabby. But I would say their sandwiches are GOOD but nothing special. If you like everything on "The Works" (which is what they put on the sandwich minus the meat), be sure to get everything!

What IS special however is their fries/potato chips. They literally slice a potato to get these semi-thick slices and fry them fresh. Honestly, I would say that's what's pretty unique about this place.

Overall: Good food, decent service, OK price (expect to spend around $9). It's a type of "I'll-go-here-when-I-want-a-sandwich-but-I-probably-won't-be-craving-anything-from-here" place.
author: Calvin H.

description: This sub/sandwich shop was really good, and the prices were very reasonable. They charge very less for extras as well. The chicken sandwich is what I got, and it tasted amazing. One thing I would suggest is to not order the onions in your sandwich because when I did there was even more onion than chicken! But other than that I would definitely recommend it.
author: Jasvinder S.

description: My family has been coming here for years! I'd say about 8 years. Maybe even longer. Recently we started ordering the sandwiches over the phone. The last 5 times we ordered our sandwiches mine has always been wrong. They either forget avocado or cheese or both! And they charge us for both too! They also always forget the fries. I won't be coming back here. I'd rather go somewhere else and spend my money and have my order be correct. Messing up my order 5 times in a row is too much. And I've told them they mess it up every time I call to place another order. Used to love this place but honestly I'm over it now.
author: Amany S.

description:
I absolutely love their "Lean Pastrami with extra house made hot sauce." It is AMAZING! Really really good. In fact everything I have ever had from there is amazing.

Not the biggest fan of their large circular fresh potato french fries though. Just not my thing.
author: Daniel C.

description:
Yellow Submarine has some of the very best subs I have ever had!  Their homemade  hot sauce is killer and is the finishing touch on their awesome sandwiches!  I have been going here since 1986 when I lived in the neighborhood and was going to dental school at UCSF.  The sandwiches are HUGE and are so reasonable $.  My husband and I always split a large Turkey/Provolone/Avocado with the works (sans mayo).  I'll order the medium size when it's just me eating, but, again, it's so big, that I almost always have the other half packed to go.  Excellent fries, too, but only if I am sharing them with someone!

I've been there twice in the past week and it's still as consistent as ever.  Many thanks today to the owner who let me have my Nacho Cheese Doritos even though I was a little short with my change today.  These guys really know how to treat their customers!  Thanks, again!!!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
author: L H.

description: How does a sandwich shop run out of bread?!??? It would be like a Chinese restaurant running out of rice. Lame.
author: Jen Y.

description: I would give this sandwich shop 5 stars if they used mozzarella cheese but they don't and refuse to. I have been in here more than a few times when a customer asked for mozzarella and turned down for provolone. I hate provolone. Their sandwiches and round cut fries are great but I must order a sandwich without cheese. Note to owner: start carrying mozzarella, I will pay extra.
author: H L.

description: This place is a straight rip off almost $10 for a large sandwich, $2 for bottle water, and $1.50 for small bag of chips. I took my kids to the park near by and they wanted to eat sandwiches so I looked to Yelp to find a place near by with good ratings so this was the chosen one. I get there and it's like a little "hole in the wall" kinda place I ordered 7 large sandwiches, 11 drinks, and 10 chips our bill was about $120. I've seen other pictures on here with large sandwiches with "Everything" stating $8 and some change. I think the guy over charged us because he knew we where first timers  While waiting for the food I asked the guy who took our order for the restroom he said he doesn't have one. I said we don't need to use it we just need to wash our hands and he points at a hand sanitizer mounted on the wall  I said NO we just came from the park we need water and soap he said I can bring a warm towel  wth I said no thanks we will be back. Now eating time the place does look like it needs some T.L.C. and an inspection but the sandwiches wasn't all that and one of them my niece found a hair in her's and gave it to the guy and they made a whole new one HINT: wear some dame gloves and hairnets #Smh won't be going back
author: Princess V.

description:
Great mom and pop sandwich place! The bread was just right and the all the ingredients seemed fresh (especially the avocado, which is pretty much a make or break for me.) The staff was also super friendly.

Also, conveniently close to UCSF, so it's a great option when you're bored of cafeteria food.
author: Pooja V.

description:
Their sandwiches are pretty good. The bf and I come here when the wait at Ike's is too long and it's a good alternative. I always get their chicken sandwich. I love how the chicken is marinated. The bf enjoys the steak and cheese. Fries are good as well. 

Sometimes they run out of bread and have to close early. It's only happened to us once though. If you haven't gone, you should check it out.
author: Fallon P.

description: Great food.  Nice family who own and operate the business.  Back for the experience after 30 years and stoll as good.
author: Patty B.

description:
I'm new to the neighborhood, so I'm looking forward to trying out all the nearby restaurants. I started with Yellow Submarine for late lunch this past Saturday.

I ordered a steak and cheese sandwich with everything and a side of "fries." They should call them chips or something else besides "fries," because they definitely look like chips rather than fries. Nevertheless, they were still yummy. The sandwich was pretty good, but I would ask for more hot sauce next time. The meat wasn't super tender, but it was sliced thinly so it was easy to eat.

Note to self: call ahead to order to-go because they are slow! Even with just a few numbers ahead of me, I stood outside for a long time waiting for a sandwich, which should be relatively quick.
author: Annaliese D.

description: Tasty hot sandwiches with a good meat to bread ratio. I've had the pastrami which is excellent and the Italian combo. Fast, good price, could seat about a dozen people.
author: Nate S.

description: Go steak and cheese with everything + fries which are actually in the shape of potato chips but soft like French fries. Super good place. I always do pickup and my order is always ready in 20 min or less. Family owned spot so happy to support!
author: Neal B.

description:
Since my initial review, I've been back to the Yellow Submarine probably about 10 times. It doesn't help that my boss wants to grab lunch there practically every week!

Here are a few of their sandwiches that I've tried:

Meatball sandwich: Easily 2nd to their steak and cheese!

Corned Beef: I didn't care for it that much but my coworker likes it so much that he claims it's even better than the steak and cheese.

Turkey with avocado: nothing special... just your average turkey sandwich. Best turkey sandwich still hails from Arguello Market!

It seems like besides their meatball and steak and cheese sandwich, everything else was just "meh".
author: Tiffany U.

description:
The sandwiches here are fantastic.  When you order a large they literally give you two whole sandwiches.  It's family owned and this is most obviously reflected in the stellar customer service.  

the homemade potato chips were good, but i could go without it next time.
author: Mason T.

description: Best italian combo sandwich I have had in my life!!!  High quality ingredients and very very good balance of sauce and meat.
author: Aki J.

description:
After visiting the Walt Disney museum, my kids wanted to go to this place.

This Spartan, little joint with a wonderful Beatles theme is fast, reasonably priced and crazy good.

I had the Pepper Steak (pronounced Pepa Steak)

Not greasy or salty at all, with good quality fresh ingredients.

The Kids scarfed there sandwiches.

We'll be back soon.

Thank you
author: Wayne D.

description:
The Yellow Submarine is an Irving Street staple.  I give it five stars for the following reasons:

1.  A large sandwich can hit the spot for two people or you can split it over two meals (lunch now, dinner later).

2.  I was born and raised in SF and while I'd like to think there's a Bostonian-deli flair here, I think the family running this joint are very San Franciscan.  They are really pleasant, but not going to spend an hour chitchatting with you about the weather.  They have mouths to feed!  And I have places to go, too!

3.  That said, I'd like to think that we San Franciscans have quirky traits.  As a Beatles fan, you'll find me humming to Yellow Submarine on my way into the restaurant.

4.  French fries.  More like French slices of awesome.  Impressionnant, oui

5.  Convenient location, especially for UCSFers.
author: Claire M.

description:
I love this sandwich shop and I love the people here. I go with a chicken sandwich and it is lovely. The fries are excellent and not to be missed.

I wish they would open more locations. 

Also, they need a parklet!

Nut Allergy Note - I talked to the owner and they don't use any nuts in the restaurant, although they can't really vouch for the materials they use (oils, breads, etc.) since they can't control that part of the process (ie there could be cross contact in some of the ingredients they use or they may be processed in facilities that process nuts). They seemed very friendly and helpful about nut allergies, and we've eaten there without problems (but you should of course always talk to the server and carry any medication with you).
author: Sven S.

description:
I'm a huge fan of the sub shop out by West Portal. But this place is a good reminder that SF has a few great, not good sandwich shops. This place is a must try. Bring cash. It's tiny inside. So not best for groups, but the sandwiches rock. 

Not a huge fan of the fried chips, but it may have been a bad day. 

A must go for any San Francisco foodie.
author: Bethtina W.

description:
The summary: best sandwich I've had in the Sunset.

Went here an hour before closing. No line. Ordered a small chicken sandwich with 'the works' (onion, lettuce, tomato, house-made hot sauce, pickles, mustard). Set me back $8. The guy took my cash - went to the back, then came out to make my order. 

'Sorry to be asking this, but you washed your hands, right?' I had to ask. Cash + food preparation = sick = lost day at work = unhappiness. He assured me he did. Phew. Hot steamy sandwich came up less than 10 minutes later. Yay. It was huge! Ike's Place size, easy! 

I asked to use the bathroom and the elder woman sweeping the floor in the dining area said they didn't have one. 

'Isn't that illegal?' I asked. 

'It's an old establishment, honey,' and kept sweeping. 

Umm... Riight. I sat down to eat my dinner and homegirl was sweeping closer and closer to and straight up, swept MY FEET. Geez. I didn't move an inch. 

Two things: 1) thank goodness for me always having sanitizer 2) thank goodness I loved the sandwich.
author: Catherine C.

description: Definitely try this place of you like sandwiches. It is cash only so remember to bring cash.
author: Kelly O.

description:
They make a mean sandwich here, and I always forget that the larges are huge!  

So pretty much everything you'd want from a deli sandwich you can get here.  Crusty french bread is the kicker, and they toast it for you.  Fresh meats, toasted cheeses, cool and crisp veggies, and standard condiments help assemble some pretty nice meals.  

The place is small.  Cash only.  Order at the counter and they'll call your number when it's ready.  A few tables off to the side.  I always get roast beef, b/c that's my thing, but I do want to branch out and try some of the other cooked beef varieties.  

And seriously, the large is epicly large.  I finished half for lunch one day and saved the other half for the next.  Though if you're appetite is pretty big, maybe 3/4 of a large will fill you up...so really don't be afraid to get the smaller version.  Perhaps you can supplant your meal with a side of freshly fried fries.
author: Anne Marie B.

description: Been going there since high school in the 80's. Just as good now as then. I have tried everything on the menu and as an sf native it is my all time favorite.  I prefer the cheese steak with the special hot sauce.
author: George M.

description:
Not my first time at The Yellow Submarine, but it has been a while since I have had the chance to drop by and grab a great sandwich. The sauces, along with the combination of various veggies, compliment the amazing meats and toasted bread very well. They have a nice variety of  chips and drinks that go along with the sandwiches. 

Great service. Great food. An overall great experience.

Remember...cash only!!
author: Kevin H.

description:
Came here for lunch before embarking on a Study-Sesh Sunday, and I wasn't disappointed.  Ordered the Pastrami and the Steak & Cheese, yumm!  

I'm usually wary about trying pastrami at a new place (most places the pastrami is way too salty), but the pastrami here was just perfect (not too salty & not too bland).  

Overall, will def come here again, if I want a quick bite to eat.  Price is also very reasonable, less than $10 for a large sub.
author: Joshua P.

description: Excellent cheese and steak subs. Ask for extra meat if u want it a bit more hearty. Good service, they get slammed at peak times sometimes but it's worth it.
author: Jordan Q.

description: This place makes one of the best sandwiches. I've been carb loading here for 9+ years and still think they're the best! Must try!
author: Jourdain D.

description:
They serve the best subs in town, by far! Staff is super friendly, and the fries are to die for. 
I'm a vegetarian, so I've only had the avocado and cheese sandwiches, but they have plenty of options for everyone.
Trust me, you'll love this place.
author: Mariano G.

description:
I'm no sub connoisseur--give me some meat, veggies, and sauce on a well-toasted bread and I'll be happy! But there's something about Yellow Submarine that makes it different from all the other sandwich shops and has me coming back for more!

My favorites are the hot pastrami and the steak and cheese. Make sure to get the homemade hot sauce! The sizes are generous--usually I split a large with another person or I save the second half for a second meal.  

Definitely get their fries! They are slices of whole potatoes and they are so delicious!

Finally, BRING CASH! They don't take credit/debit cards!
author: Cindy N.

description: Yellow Submarine is a sandwich gem. Cute little store which has unbelievable sandwiches. We got Turkey and a steak & cheese sandwich. Both recommended. The Garlic fries were amazing! I've heard chicken and pastrami are also amazing. They have indoor seating to eat at. Cash only- but they have an ATM. Very friendly staff. Great place.
author: Alex M.

description: Excellent sandwich spot.  This family owned & operated establishment is part of the greatness that is the inner-sunset.  Great value for such excellent tasting sandwiches.  One thing to keep in mind is that they only accept cash.
author: Adam B.

description: Amazing sandwich!! The bread is nice and soft! I had the hot pastrami and it was great!
author: esme R.

description:
HUGE sandwhich.  Very polite friendly staff.  Tasty hand cut fries.  
Got the cheese combo, which  I pictured involving like an American, Jack and Provelone mix.  However, sadly it was just like Kraft Singles cheese.  Luckily the toasty melty aspect made up for it and the fresh lettuce, onions, pickles, and tomatoes, took my mind off it.  I asked for avocado as well but the guy tole me they were running low or something.  Props for the size, and toasty goodness, but with so many other outstanding sandwhich places out there, TYS needs to step their game up!
author: Chelsey G.

description:
One of (if not THE) best sandwich joint in SF. Big portion, the bread is baked just right, the meat is very tender and juicy, and they add just the right amount of sauce and veggie. My favorite is the cheese steak. I don't care much for the French fries but folks seem to like it. 

Call ahead as it can take 15-20 min to prepare!! It's definitely worth the wait though!!
author: Erick K.

description: Such a breath of fresh air. Good people doing good business. Sandwiches are great and the owners/employees are too! I didn't realize it was a cash only shop being that it was my first time in the area. I only had $8 on hand when my order came to $9. The owner (I assume) let me slide. So nice to see someone care about customer satisfaction. Will be returning soon!!
author: Christine T.

description: Great place to get a sandwich before heading out to the beach. At times it can be very difficult to find parking. Call ahead of time if you are picking up to go, even then you might have to wait in line to pay and pickup your food. Food is always consistent and pretty good been coming to this joint for over 20 plus years. If your really hungry order the fries. They are basically a potatoes cut in circles and dipped in the fryer more grease than I like but wth once in a while won't kill you.
author: Giovanni E.

description:
Cash only. We drive 40 minutes for these sandwiches and I would go twice as far. Best East Coast style sandwiches on the West Coast. Get the hot sauce. Also good for vegetarians. Half a sandwich is a meal for most.

Btw, don't get your feeling hurt by the brisk NY style of service. They are polite but busy so don't waste their time hemming and hawing.
author: Lisa M.

description:
First time here and I LOVE this place. For one, it is a really good price. The large is massive and most are under $10. I got a medium and I couldn't finish it. Second, the bread is perfection. Crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside but also not too much bread for a sandwich, it was just right. Third, the owners are great, super friendly, nice people. 

I got the turkey and avocado with provolone and everything on it. Beyond delicious. They put a little hot sauce if you ask for "everything", gives it a great kick. I also got the "fries" they are thick cut potatoes, they taste just like In-N-Out fries, yum!! My friends got the steak and cheese and that was great as well. 

I will definitely be back for more!!
author: Rhonda J.

description: Almost turned around and walked out. The guy at the counter seemed annoyed by taking our order.  They could redeem themselves with the food but unfortunately that wasn't the case.  Ordered a large avocado sandwich and split it with a friend.  Mostly bread and lettuce.  Much of the avocado was brown and I had to take it out.  Definitely not worth over $9.  Won't go there again.
author: Cheryl H.

description:
A-OK hot sandwich joint, but  a bigger fan of their tater chips! =D 

Decent sandwiches. We ordered medium steak, pastrami, chicken -- all pretty hearty, w/ fresh veggies. A medium goes a long way. Liked their soft toasted french bread. When I tasted the chicken, it had a hint of cinnamon which suprised my taste buds. Pastrami was ok, as was the steak...  Potato salad was ok - little sweet and had some pimentos, which I'm not use too. I haven't had Boston style sandwiches before so iono -- it's a good honest sandwich. (Better than some chain joints like subway, togo's, quizno's)

Service was cool. The cook took our order and another dude rang our bill.  3 sammies w/ a drink, chips, and potato salad lil' under 30. Not bad comparable to other sandwich joints in the city. Cash only, but they have a ATM machine outside. Friendly walk-up counter service.  Yellow-Sub is small, place and pick up your order counter, tables and chairs to eat inside. 

I'd come back for the tatter chips... but uhm... on the fence about their sammies... it was just ok for us.
author: Aga O.

description:
A decent sub sandwich but the food does not stand out among the numerous sandwich spots in the area. 

I tried the pastrami and the pepper steak sandwiches. I thought the pastrami was the better of the two. The texture and taste of the pastrami was perfect for the bun. The pepper steak was a bit overwhelming with flavor and grease, and needed something like lettuce or tomato for balance.
The large is pretty big and will satisfy the hungriest customer for less than ten bucks.

I was very thirsty an hour after eating their sandwich. Perhaps the meat could use a little less salt. Unfortunately, they don't have any choices for the bread, just a plain white sub roll. Cash only
author: Alfred L.

description: This is as good as it gets.  The homemade hot sauce is amazing!
author: Amber M.

description:
I heart this place!

I've been coming here since 2003, when my best friend introduced me to this place. 
I can't speak for all the different types of sandwiches, but the hot pastrami and the turkey avocado sandwiches are to die for ...literally. 
It's toasted and whatever that "secret" sauce is, it's just DAMN good. 

The fries are delicious as well. I always ask them to not over fry it. 

The only hang up I have about this place is the parking. You literally have to drive around for ten minutes to find anything within a 3 block radius.
author: Annette F.

description: Awesome sandwiches!!! I loved the bread they used and their homemade hot sauce. Dinged a point because they place could've been a bit cleaner.
author: Heather L.

description:
This neighborhood favorite sandwich inspired by the Beatles movie shop seems like it's been open forever. The mural in the dining area looks like it's at least 30 years old. They could probably use new equipment for toasting their Boston style subs.

Most of the sandwiches are $5.95 for a Medium, $7.95 for a Large. They have your usual (roast beef, turkey, tuna, pastrami, Reuben, meatball) types and a couple of steak sandwiches. You can add potato chips, salad or their fresh cut potatoes.

* Pepper steak sandwich ($5.95): an unusually messy sandwich. I liked the thin white roll (not too bready, good texture) but the edges were charred. The sandwich had warm sauteed onions, bell peppers and steak, along with the works: pickle, tomato, lettuce, onion, mayo, oil & vinegar, hot sauce, yellow mustard. It was a good sandwich but didn't have as much filling (veggies were lacking) as other places, I couldn't taste the hot sauce and the bread was charred.

Cash only
author: Lolia S.

description:
Day 4 of MWLAWMBF:
Oh, it was amazing. Before a long day of shopping, we decided to drop by to get a nice big meal to give us loads of energy before walking ALL OVER the financial district. 

We decided to go with the pastrami sandwich this time. Actually I think he was craving it because his friends went to NYC and got some. Anyways, it was delicious. We got a sandwich to share and some fries. Perfect for our day in the city!
author: Nina Y.

description:
Really quick, friendly service. Subs were great! 

If you order fries be prepared for what amounts to "potato slices". Still delicious just a bit different than what you might expect.

I had the Reuben a pretty sweet.

This place is not too bad a walk from the park either! 

Would definitely eat here again.
author: Brett H.

description:
Avacadogasmic! 

Great sando spot in the inner richmond. Reminds me of a sandwich spot I used to hit up in my home town. Fresh bread and toasted just right. Highly recommended if you are craving a tasty sub! 

today's menu item: Avacado sub!
author: Callie O.

description:
Downgrading to 3 stars because the neighborhood parking conditions make it literally impossible to find a spot to park here.  In the case for last weekend, I drove around the block for 20 minutes while my friend ordered our sandwiches inside.  By the time I got home, I tore into the Italian steak sandwich and it was well worth the wait.  

I think we will call ahead next time we order because I'm an idiot!  I'll definitely be back at Yellow Submarine when I can snag a parking spot and enjoy my sandwich inside their store.
author: Ben H L.

description:
CASH ONLY

It's something I always have to remind myself before going and also a way to determine if an unplanned stop for a sandwich is justifiable. 

I always get the roast beef with everything on it and usually the large so I can have half for dinner and half for lunch the next day. And at $8-9 for a large sandwich split into 2 meals, it's hardly breaking the bank (a plus for broke students like myself when they're too lazy to cook). 

I definitely agree that the people that own it/work here aren't the warmest people around but they're polite and will engage you in some small talk if you come during a less busy hour. 

This place is super easy to get to too. Just hop on the N line and hop off at 7th! You can't miss the submarine on the window :)
author: Anna T.

description:
Sandwiches have always been great, and today was the same.  The bread is always toasted crispy, perfectly toasted

Today we had roast beef, turkey, and Italian combo. 

Just wish they had a bathroom, or a second location in SOMA!
author: Jon H.

description:
Hot pastrami with homemade hot sauce and avocado for 7 bucks is as good as it gets. I love this neighborhood place, the guys are some of the friendliest I've come across. Best sandwiches in the city, hands down.

Don't forget to order their fries. So bomb.
author: Sam G.

description:
I love the fries.  They are thick slices of real potatoes.  They are more soft than crispy, but they are so wholesome and homemade.  

And the sandwiches are huge and delicious with the freshest ingredients.
author: Needles K.

description: Can't say enough good things about the sandwiches at Yellow Submarine. One of the hidden gems in the Inner Sunset. My go-to is the steak and cheese - it's excellent. Be sure to get the homemade hot sauce!
author: Nicola V.

description: This neighborhood friendly sandwich place is very good.  Personal favorite is the Hot Patrami but many more to choose from.
author: Alicia R.

description: Let me start by saying that the food here is really good. But you should grab your food and get the fuck out because the people here suck!! One incident I called an hour before they are supposed to close and whoever answered the phone barely let me speak. She kept rushing me. She didn't greet me when she answered. I figure they might be busy but when we got to the restaurant 5 mins later, there wasn't a single customer there. The workers were more concern about closing an hour early and going home. Their attitude is shit. They don't have any structure and worst of them all is they have shitty customer service. 30 mins before closing , two customers came in and the employers turned them away; even though they had 30 fucking mins left. Last time I come here. P.S. Fuck the bitch who answered my call!
author: Hasnain M.

description: I've been a patron at The Yellow Submarine sandwich shop since the late 1970's!  Same owner...same great subs.  It's refreshing, in a city that can change dramatically in just a few weeks, to see the same establishment going and going well (it appears!)... it gives a sense of reassurance that not everything changes so quickly as it so often seems.  Well, the prices are a little higher than in the late 70's (duh)... good food, good people.
author: Randy O.

description: Everything a sandwich should be: made-to-order, fresh, delicious, and huge. Yellow Sub has become our go-to sandwich shop - and as a loyal Ike-ster, I'd never thought I'd say that. Every sandwich I've had here is fantastic, but steak is my absolute favorite. Don't be picky - get everything on it and trust that they know what they're doing. And remember to bring cash.
author: Lindsay S.

description:
I was headed out of a meeting with my supervisor when I saw philly cheese steak on the banner of the store. Immediately, I had to get a sandwich here. My supervisor said he had been many years ago and claimed the sandwiches were pretty bomb ( my word not his).

So I ordered the peppered steak and it did not disappoint. It really hit the spot. I will definitely return whenever I am in the area again.
author: Ernesto C.

description: Ordered a turkey sandwich with the works.  Shit was so bland I only ate half and dumped the rest.  What an embarrassment as a sandwich shop.  I mean my god the place looks like shit as well.  Half assed ownership like there is no pride in this place at all.  Just a below average sandwich shop.  Nothing special about this place.  Won't be coming back!
author: Domino P.

description: The sandwiches are really soggy, I got the pepper steak and it was just falling apart.  Will skip next time.
author: Sean H.

description: This place is the bomb! 5 stars all the way,  steak and cheese with house chili and avocado is my thing!
author: Ricardo R.

description:
I have no idea what qualifies a "Boston style" sandwich, but since Yellow Submarine makes the claim that these sandos are a direct representation of what you can find in the most populous city in Massachusetts, it must just mean that they taste really, really good!

This is one of those places that has literally been on my radar since I moved to San Francisco a little over one year ago after seeing review after review pop up on the front page of zeee Yelp. I don't really get out to the Inner Sunset too often, so when I found myself just a few paces away, I had to finally head in for a taste.

They make their sandwiches hot, so if I had to guess, I'd assume that that lends a small hand to the "Boston style" in which they propose. I often wonder why all sandwich spots don't choose to heat up their cold cuts and stone ground wheat, because just about all of my favorite joints have that in common (Ike's, Fillmore Street Cafe, just to name a couple). They sauté their meats and peppers much like a Philly Cheese Steak, so perhaps that's another example of what makes a Bean Town special. 

Their most popular sandwich is the steak and onion (if memory serves me correctly), but since I don't eat moo cow, I went with their second most popular; the chicken. Upon suggestion from the owner, I lathered it with the house made hot sauce... and I'm glad I did! I almost want to ask homeboy if I can just buy an entire bottle to keep in my fridge, because this stuff gives Tapatio a run for its money!

Overall, I was very impressed by my inaugural visit, and if I lived in the 'hood, I could see this as a regular stop in no time.
author: Ruggy J.

description: We are a fan of The Yellow Submarine. The subs are toasted, the onions always come grilled, and the portions are generous. The large is enough for two people to share (if not super starving). The only thing we'd recommend against is getting the American cheese as with it, the flavors all together ends up tasting something like a McDonalds burger. We love the steak and cheese otherwise.
author: Amy D.

description:
I often wonder if my one more review to the list of 400 reviewers would even matter anymore. Nevertheless, I yelp. 

Good sandwich place. I can tell that a lot of locals come here. The dining area was ok. 

I got the pepper steak and enjoyed it. I felt that there wasn't enough hot sauce and when I asked for more, they just put some sauce on a paper in the basket. Advice for patrons who preferred extra spices- just ask for extra in the beginning when you order. 

I would have liked more meat in my sandwich. The bread was very thick and bready; maybe that is why I felt that there should be more meat. 

Because they have a great grill- I would say that you should order a sandwich that is anything grilled like pepper steak or grilled something. 

The potato fries are amazing. I never had fresh fried potato chips like that and appreciate how they recognize the simplicity of fried potatoes. In my opinion, a potato is good on its own if you cook it properly. It really doesn't need a whole lot of seasoning- but then again- that is just my opinion. I don't like overly salty food. 

If I live around the area, I would come here from time to time.
author: Anna C.

description: Their sandwiches are made-to-order, lightly toasted and fresh!  Want fries with that?  They have unique deep fried potato slices.  For more information, a professional review is: http://hoodline.com/2015/04/inner-sunset-heroes-44-years-of-the-yellow-submarine-sandwich-shop
author: Bruce D.

description: Mom and pop shop that makes good, hot and toasted sandwiches. There's a little dining room to the left once you're inside. I had the cheese steak with everything and the sandwich had good flavor. There's a bit of a wait to get your sandwich though; Around lunchtime the wait was about 15 minutes after ordering. There was a good number of other customers ordering and waiting too.
author: Ali F.

description:
Remember dudes: CASH ONLY.
There is an ATM right outside just in case you do forget. Sandwiches are reasonably priced at ~$7 for a half sandwich (which is PLENTY BIG for the average diner), or ~$9 for the full sandwich. To be honest, I could barely tell the difference between a half and full pastrami sandwich.

Service was very curt and quick. I would recommend checking out the pastrami, Italian, and peppersteak sandwiches.

My pastrami today was delicious. However, (1) they didn't have their homemade hot sauce for unlimited use. In fact, the guy hovered over our table while I frantically squirted all the hot sauce I thought I might need on both halves of my sandwich. Pretty awkward. and (2) the meat to bread ratio was way in favor of the bread. Don't get me wrong, the bread is perfectly toasted and great. It's just, I felt robbed of some pastrami (although Yelp pictures may evidence otherwise).
author: Dan K.

description:
Meh...it's only ok.  I really wanted to like this place, because the lady working the counter was super nice.  She even left extra sandwiches outside for the homeless people.  She definitely took the time to make our sandwiches.

I had a veggie sandwich and it just lacked any type of taste.  I had to ask for the vinegar myself and just doused my sandwich with it.  I guess i'm just brainwashed by a Marina Sub's type of sandwich.  Soak that sandwich in oil baby!!
author: Kyle W.

description:
CASH ONLY.  I went here for lunch on Fri 5/28/10 on my day off after spending the day at the Japanese Tea Garden & the Botanical Garden.  It's on Irving St which isn't very far from Golden Gate Park.

They have a huge menu which lots of meat choices & some vegetarian for sandwiches.

I got a Medium (no small size) corned beef sandwich for $5.95 before tax.  They toast the bread & grill the meat w/ cheese.  They add pickles, lettuce, tomatoes, onion, mayo, mustard, oil, vinegar.  You can add or take out what you want.

I just ate 1/2 and thought it was enough food for me.  Ate the other half for lunch the next day.

They also sell sides like: cole slaw $1.65, potato salad $1.65; or french fries $1.95.

Desserts: carrot cake .65; cheesecake .75; chocolate chip cookie .65

Dining room in the room on the left.

CASH ONLY.

Seen on Check Please! Bay Area:
http://blogs.kqed.org/checkplease/2008/04/25/the-yellow-submarine-reviews/
author: Ann L.

description:
I arrived early for a job interview and just wanted to get something to eat. the small sandwich shop caught my eye while I was walking down Irving Street.
I tried to open the door before they were open. The guy who opened actually opened the door and welcomed me in a pleasant way. It is a small mom and pop shop that sells great sandwiches and recommends a few like the pepper and steak, hot pastrami and the Italian combo. Great selling point.
I ordered a steak and cheese medium and bag of chips.
The medium sandwich is like almost 5 - 6 inches, and fresh veggies, olive oil, vinegar, hot sauce and mustard. The sauce , oil and vinegar and black pepper is the kicker and this is the unique blend of Boston style sandwiches. The sandwich is huge and was good. The bread could have been toasted longer.
Next time I will get the hand cut fries cooked with canola oil when I am in the area.
There is a room with chairs and tables. A lot of business around the area.
Service is 6/5.
Food is 4/5.
No rest rooms though.
Ambiance is 3/5
author: Jade M.

description: I ate here while I was visiting the city, and I came here and got a truly amazing sandwich! I will definitely be coming back. The inside was very cute, and the people working there seemed really nice and happy. I got the American, and I highly recommend it. The price was great, and the food was delicious! Definitely the most satisfying meal I've bought in a while. Try the homemade hot sauce on your sandwich!! I had never tried it before and I don't even usually like spicy food, but I loved it. Seating is limited, but it's all part of the charm and appeal!
author: Julie M.

description:
This place is amazing! One of the few legit sandwich places left in SF. The Italian Combo is great, I always get a large with provolone and the homemade hot sauce. 
They make excellent sandwiches. It's dumbfounding how many places in SF you can spend 12 dollars (or more?!?!?!) to get a "regular" sandwich, only to feel gipped... Not the case here. I always leave full and happy! Their fries are delicious as well. 
The people working here are kind and hardworking individuals. I am glad that there are still places like this left in the city.
author: Dale S.

description: Great subs and the fries where awesome as well.  I recommend this place and I am sure I'll be back again.
author: Sean B.

description:
This place will go down in history as one of my favorite sandwich places in San Francisco. Don't get me wrong there are a lot of great ones like Ike's, but for some reason this one tasted homey for me. The food was comforting, place was small, environment felt right. This place was just good.

The sandwich I had was the Pepper steak and damn the sandwich was HUGE! I had to split it in half with my girlfriend.... the good thing was that the quantity matched the quality. And the fries!!! damn it was good. I recommend to come here if you are a local or a tourist.
author: Sonlay V.

description: Great hot sandwich shop. Place gets pretty busy. Flavors are on point. Prices are great. Medium is ALL you need! Trust!  Family owned and ran.  Cashier isn't rude.  Grab a sandwich then walk down to the park nearby to enjoy!
author: Wouldn't You L.

description:
Vegeterian with hot sauce. Drool. 
French Fries. Drool.
This place really serves top sandwiches.
author: Emily D.

description: I've had much better sandwiches, many many times. I've lived in a lot of places, so maybe have had more sandwich experiences?? I paid $10 bucks for nothing... I don't even think they put all the ingredients in. Skimpy on the meat and lettuce..only things I saw. The whole thing swallowed by a huge piece of bread. Bread's cheap, why am I paying $10 for bread?! Overrated in my opinion,  I believe they were good once but no more. I'd recommend going out to other sandwich places and not coming here just for the name. (Like I did)
author: Anna B.

description: I've been going here since 1973 ! they make the best pepper stake sandwich around....with an order of their fries and your good to go.... the price is right.... parking sucks unfortunately :(
author: David R.

description: This is by far the best sandwich I have ever had in my life. Everything about it is absolutely delicious. Their fries are more like thin potato slices and they are also soooo delish.
author: Sarah C.

description: Kinda bummed by my tuna sandwich was decidedly forgettable. I've seen this place for years and was really hoping it would be better. Will try to go back and get something else and see if that does the trick.
author: Misha T.

description: A sandwich cannot be any more perfect... amazing bread, delicious steak and pastrami, the best fried potatoes i ever tasted.
author: Cary E.

description: Total hole in the wall and CASH ONLY. But it is totally bomb. I ordered a cheese steak with the works and their homemade hot sauce. Had I known the wait would be so long I would have phoned my order in before hand, but still I really enjoyed the food. The portions are massive, I ordered a medium sandwich and it was the size of my forearm. Perfect for a hangover.
author: Kelly W.

description:
I've been intrigued by this place (the name lured me in as a Beatles fan) and I finally stopped in today. 

I was not impressed. 

First, there is only one option if you're vegetarian, which I am: the Avocado sub with everything on it unless you specify otherwise. I ordered a medium Avocado without the vinegar and onions. 

Second: price. I don't understand how a $6.45 medium sub cost me $8.03. I'm new to SF so I still don't know the taxes here but that was a lot on top of the cost of the sub, unless I was charged for extra avocado, which I better not have been. Read my next point.

Third, the size was decent but the amount of fillings weren't. There wasn't a lot of avocado. And in my big fat opinion, if you advertise a sub as having avocado, and it's the ONLY vegetarian option, I think it should have a decent amount of that ingredient in it. 

Fourth, I didn't think the customer service was that great. I walked in and asked if there were any other veggie options. The guy was hasty in explaining that avocado was the only option. So I ordered that. Then two girls walked in after me and he gave them much more attention in figuring out what to order. 

Their meat subs are probably fabulous, but I will never know since I don't eat meat. This review is for the veggies. I won't be going back.
author: Jung F.

description: I love the yellow submarine!!! Homemade sauce is so delish... Oh and the homemade fries too :). The place is small and parking sucks in this area tho, but other than that the sandwiches are bomb!
author: D G.

description: Best subs in the city!  Highly recommend the hot pastrami with the home made hot sauce!  Excellent!
author: Daniel A.

description: The Pepper steak is to die for!  I've been coming here since I was 10.  The Pepper Steak sandwich is the best in the city!  You have to get the wagon wheel cut fries!  Delicious!
author: Shaunte B.

description: Tasty sandwiches with big portion sizes. Been going here for years my 2nd fav sandwich spot to little luccas. If you sill hungry get some appetizers or sides they delicious. Love the atmosphere of this place & customer service. My favorite sandwich spot in the city. Prices arnt too bad either
author: Danny F.

description:
I had high expectations for this place since it was featured on "Check Please, Bay Area." I was really disappointed with the sandwiches that we ordered. 

Positives:
+ Warm toasted bread
+ Large size was HUGE for $8.00
+ Reuben sandwich tasted good 

Negatives:
+ Cramped dining spot and a bit dirty due to the bread crumbs from previous diners
+ Bland flavor for the pepper cheese steak
+ Fries (potato slices) were soggy in a couple minutes
+ Cash only
author: Jackie S.

description:
Seriously, probably the best sandwich I've ever had.

I feel like Liz Lemon in 30 Rock when I crave their sandwiches.  The bread is toasted warm and soft and there's just a special kick to their subs that make it really good.

I usually get a large and eat it in two sittings.  My favorite is the turkey, but peppersteak is a close second.

You HAVE to try this place, It's perfect for lunch!

Bring CASH!
author: Gloria C.

description:
OH YOU DIDN'T KNOW?!?!? YO ASS BETTER CALL SOMEBODY!!!!!

Yellow Submarine is delicious! I have got to go to Boston and try the real thing because YS subs are the bomb.  Bread is always nice and toasty on the outside, but still soft on the inside.  YS keeps it simple, just the way I like it.  Just meat, some veggies, mayo, and some secret sauce.  I'm not into over the top sandwiches that pile up on ingredients making the sandwich hard to eat (you know who you are.)  I've had a few different sandwiches here, including the pepper steak, pastrami, corned beef, and turkey.  All of them are great, but the pepper steak is by far my favorite.  Certain places do certain things well, and YS does the pepper steak exceptionally well.  Their fries are a must order as well.  The fries are actually cut like really thick chips, which is unique, but a nice touch.  My recommendation: Eat your sub there while it's still hot!
author: Anthony N.

description:
After finishing up training at Kezar Stadium, I was craving a sandwich and decided it was time to check out Yellow Submarine. The steak & cheese seemed pretty popular so I went with that---no mayo. The bread was nice and toasted. The meat was alright. Overall, a nice warm, sandwich. Nothing to spectacular about it but it's a solid meal.

3 stars.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
This is the place that made me open a yelp account. For many, I imagine the original motive is to beseech abstinence from the vile gruel that insulated their taste buds or compromised their bowels.  I, however, became a yelp convert after witnessing divine sandwich intervention.

Yellow Submarine sandwiches are huge, perfectly assembled sandwiches made fresh, topped with homemade hot sauce, and served with homemade circle-cut fries (not included with sandwich price).  Simple and perfect.

Ordering is easy. Enter the restaurant via the front door, order the large hot pastrami sandwich with home-cut fries, wait, pickup completed sandwich, and proceed to consume in whole, despite it being large enough to share with a friend.

In addition to the tasty subs, the people are also great. Your sandwich will not be prepared by some 15 year old with no prior experience in food preparation, hygeine, or speaking in complete sentences.  Rest assured, your sandwich is in the hands of a 40-year veteran.  Not only skillful, I found the man who took my order to be kind in a sincere way that is not seen in national restaurant chains.  He appeared proud of his work, and damn well deserving if you ask me.  This is the kind of guy you simply want to support with business.

May your future be filled with giant sandwiches.
author: Wesley J.

description:
Please hear me when I say this: THIS is the BEST sandwich i have had in SF.

i love sandwiches. i especially love hot, melty, delicious, perfect sandwiches.

my boyfriend i come here AT LEAST ONCE A WEEK. it is that good.

and we have it down to a science: large steak and cheese... with extra cheese; add avocado (hell yes); home-made hot sauce (it's HOT!); and why bother with any veggies besides onions (which they grill WITH the steak, mind you)?

SO GOOD. perfect lunch, any day.

AND..... their fries? perfect. they take a potato and slice it width-wise, so you get perfect, fresh, rounds of potato slices that are crispy and tender at the same time.

Seriously, this is a perfect meal, hands down.

and... it's a little mom&pop boston style shop that's been here since the 70's. again, YES. PLEASE.
author: Molly E.

description: Great sandwiches and fries. Had the pastrami and homemade hot sauce with provolone and all the fixins. Wow. Not to mention the full cut fried have a nice salty crunch without being over - fried. The sandwich was made from a fresh, well toasted baguette and the pastrami, mayo, hot sauce, grilled onions, spicy mustard and hot sauce created a pseudo au jus which kept the sandwich juicy without being soggy.  The owner (son) did a great job orienting me to the menu. Food was delivered quick, hot and delicious!  Will definetly be back!
author: Kabeer S.

description: I came here a lot as a kid because it was the only place in my neighborhood that made decent subs. Maybe it's because I'm nostalgic for this place, but I still think this is the best, old-fashioned sub in town. No frills, freshly made, and the best hot pastrami sandwiches! The best part is their friendly service. I still remember when I went here a few years ago, and as usual, asked for avocado slices on my sandwich. They apologized and told me that their avocados hadn't ripened enough, and didn't want to serve me a sandwich with unripened, hard avocado slices. It was nice to see that even after all these years, they still care about the quality of their food, and will always offer the best to their customers. If you're in the mood for a nice, hot sandwich, this is the best place to pick up a classic sub! Perfect for a picnic in Golden Gate Park nearby!
author: Jessica L.

description:
I've been coming to Yellow Submarine since the 80's.  The sandwiches are Boston style and comes out hot and tasty.   The portion is huge. Well worth the $$. It's a tiny little sandwich shop with a dining room in the back.  
The potato chip shape french fries goes great with the hot sandwiches.

- Cash only.
author: J M.

description:
Wow.  This is a good place for sandwiches.  No wonder it's been around for 35+ years.  The Italian Combo is so filling (esp if you get the large like I did; only could eat half).  Get it with the works (all toppings and sauces).  The homemade hot sauce is good (nice kick).

But like others have said before me, what really puts this place over the top are the fries - they basically cut a whole potato into thin slices and fry it but leaving it somewhat soft too.  Yes, artery-clogging ... but worth it (once in a while).

Large sub + fries was $11 plus change.  Not bad, esp b/c you won't finish it and will have leftovers for lunch the next day.

Went at an odd time (past 3pm weekday) and so no line at all.  Still took them about 10 minutes to make the sandwich and fries though.  TLC ... I like it. 

Cash only,
author: F. P.

description:
Have been going for years and just got around to write them up.

Great family and staff, sandwiches so big they are two meals. Simple but done well. I have pretty much tried each sandwich. The steak are the best. The bread is done just right. Grill those onions!

A great neighborhood place.
author: Joe Bob J.

description:
You get a lot of food for your cash. Large messy sandwich that is so hot, it burns your mouth. They dont take plastic and the ATM at the corner is out of order when I arrived.

Friendly staff, good seating but can be a little confusing to order. I was waiting behind a lady waiting to order and some jack ass runs in, belts out an order and ignores us completely. 

I like Sub Center better but this comes in second.
author: Mario A.

description: The food is amazing. I am glad places like this are still around. The health score concerns me tho...
author: None O.

description: We love the Yellow Submarine. Call in an order and it always takes exactly 20 minutes. They are a little busy in there all the time so don't expect super friendly service but the sandwiches are great! Not East Coast style necessarily but very yummy. The medium size (the smaller of the two options) is still quite large. I like the steak and cheese or steak and peppers but I got the Italian combo last week and it was also great. I would maybe not recommend the reuben but only because I am from NJ and used to piles of corned beef and the portion here is a little small. Overall great place in the Sunset to grab lunch or quick dinner.
author: Jennifer R.

description: After hearing several great reviews, I came to try the roast beef sandwich and it definitely met my expectations. I was afraid it might have been overhyped, but I was pretty satisfied. For the price, it was definitely a decent portion. It could probably even be two meals but I was pretty hungry so I ate the whole thing in one sitting. The fries are pretty unique in that they're circular slices. I was pleased with how it was crispy on the outside but soft on this inside. Another great sandwich I've heard of is the avocado sandwich so I'll definitely be returning to try that.
author: Angela P.

description:
Cheap, delicious, and they have a lot of fixins. I have tried the meatball sandwich before as well as the veal parm and both are great! Don't forget to try their fresh chips, which will make every Pringle and Dorito for the rest of your life taste boring and cold.

I don't understand what all the hate is about. I've never had a bad experience here. And the price only sweetens the deal.

and it is SO MUCH better than IBs greasebucket. I know. I went to Berkeley too. So stuff it.
author: Josh K.

description: Great toasted subs, fresh cut french fries, their phone ordering is flawless and the service impeccable.  If you want a great toasted sub, come here.
author: Bad Y.

description:
Umh...I love hot sandwiches.  What I love even more....are cheap, tasty, hot sandwiches!

My cousin introduced to me this place which is located in the Sunset district.  Hole in the wall -no frills no thrills.  The elderly woman is choppin' it up with her metal spatula on the grill, preparing my favorite hot sandwich:  PASTRAMI.  Pepper Steak is pretty good too. A good portion of meat with toppings on a toasty bread - slightly crispy on the outside but soft and chewy on the inside, for less than $10.

The place is super small but very popular so expect to wait in line. It's a family run business and the mother and sons are very nice, hardworking folks!    

The best sandwich spot...HANDS DOWN!
author: Diana M.

description:
Classic sandwiches with the specialty of adding vinegar and hot sauce to their sandwiches. The head staff there was very distracted and slow. I was ready to order and stood at the counter for a good 5 minutes. Waited for him to walk around, fill some change in the register,picked up a phone call and placed an order before he acknowledge I was ready to order the whole time. I ordered the avacado sandwich because sometimes flavors are truly put to the test with the simple form of things. The sandwich was toasted to the point where the rim of the bread was burnt, but I didn't mind it too much since it was a minor mistake. I wish I was about to detect the vinegar and hot sauce more. I barely noticed it in my sandwich nor it helped to bring out the flavors in other ingredients. Turns out you have the option of asking for a spicier hot sauce which is homemade, but that option is only available if you ask during your order, its not on the menu.

Overall, its decent for a typical sandwich. Can't say its my favorite. By the way, they provide indoor seating for those who like to enjoy their sandwiches fresh out of the prep station.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
A co-worker suggested trying this place so I did.  Glad I did!  I was put off at first by the small order counter/kitchen area.  The menu looked old and didn't describe any of the sandwiches so I had to ask, "What's on it?" for every thing that looked interesting.  I went with an Italian, fries and iced tea.  After sitting down in the dining area, my sandwich arrived hot and melty.  Wow!  Looks and smells great!
The sandwich was toasted and soft.  The meats were thinly sliced and everything tasted fresh.  A very good sandwich!  I'll be back
Street parking is tough around here.
author: Pablo R.

description: Had the Large Pastrami Sandwich and Potato Chips Fries - definitely worth the 10 mins looking for parking! A hidden gem in SF.
author: Gabriel T.

description: They would get a 5 star if they took credit/debit cards and not just cash only.  It would also be cool if they had a big sign indicating their cash only policy.  Other than that, the subs are outstanding and so delicioso!  Nice location and great customer service!  We love this place and eat here as often as e can afford it!
author: Eric D.

description: Awesome sandwiches. This place is a classic. It's been consistently good for years and years. All the ingredients are fresh and good including the "french fries". They're actually sliced potatoes but are goood. The french bread is fresh and they'll toast any sandwich on the menu.
author: Rich M.

description:
My boyfriend was craving sandwiches so we looked up restaurants in the neighborhood and stumbled upon The Yellow Submarine. 

We ordered the italian steak which was deeelicious! A large was big enough to split between two people and it came out to about $9.03. They take cash only! The steak was so juicy and almost melted in your mouth. Usually with shredded beef, I've noticed that it's rather dry but not here! We tried the hot sauce per the Yelp reviews and it added an extra kick. 

The restaurant is really clean and the service is friendly. I will come back again and try their sliced potato fries :)

PS. Call in and order ahead if you want to speed up the order!
author: Vikki K.

description: Delicious sandwiches and nice people! We love the corned beef with homemade hot sauce. Spicy and flavorful.
author: Tara C.

description:
BLESS THIS SUBMARINE SHOP! this place is my fav! absolutely delicious subs! i've been coming here all of my life, yes, 23/24 yrs! still have kept their quality! their subs are juicy and their fries are to die for! i love the mom that works there! she's the best and is always so nice to me! this is a family owned place and i have never had better sandwiches than this place! my personal fav is the Steak and cheese! yummy!
 

I LOVE YOU YELLOW SUBMARINE!
author: Morgan D.

description:
One of my favorite sandwich places in the city. The first time I came here, I got the Italian combo and it was sooo good, I havent gotten anything else since.  I'm the type to stick with whats good - and that's the Italian sammie here. Portions are huge. Be ready for food coma!

Their fries are also good. They are *actual* potato slices! Always fresh!
author: Rosie W.

description: I know a good sandwich when I have one and this is a damn good sandwhich. I get the turkey sub with everything on it. The portions are huge and one can save a few bucks if they order a large and split it with someone else. The staff is nice and I can tell they care about and love their business with all their hearts. Making good food is important to them, and that shows.
