The hot sauce is also amazing (if you like very spicy) on their fries!
author: Sav R.

description:
I got the hot pastrami here and was not really impressed.  I think AK subs has a better sandwich and its a bit cheaper.  I thought the bread was really good though.  

I guess I should try their Reuben sandwich...I hear that's what they're known for.
author: Raymond Z.

description: Best sandwiches in San Francisco. Period. Pepper steak delicious favorite. Lebanese hot sauce to stab for. Split a large and get the greasy miraculous fries. Best old hippy sign in the city.
author: stephan k.

description: Good, friendly service. Inexpensive basic sandwiches that are not very flavorful, unless you get the super-spicy homemade hot sauce.
author: Melissa H.

description:
Went cause of you yelpers and it is pretty good. Had the humongus tuna sammich wit da works....nice bread...soft and toasty. The tuna was okay not really tasty and they put mustard on the sandwich...I guess that is the works...Tuna and mustard not good would not recommend.

The fries are really interesting but so so...just a sliced potatoe deep fried...not crispy just sort of greasy.

The guys that work there and the owner  are pleasant and the service was quick. The place is very funky. I would go back but would try something else.

The place was pretty busy for mid afternoon.
author: David G.

description: Best sub place in my hood been going there for about 5-6 years and they never let me Down !! Love that place I give it
author: Louie H.

description:
I just had to review this place again.  I love Yellow Submarine.  In two days, I tried the Italian Combo, Chicken, and Tuna (it was supposed to be Turkey but they got the order wrong).  

The chicken was the best!!  With the homemade hot sauce it tasted AWESOME.  I absolutely love everything that they put in it.  Absolutely love the onions and the pickles.  I gotta say though.. they should probably leave the cheese out of the tuna sandwich.  My mom's tuna is the best, so I won't have that one again.  Half a medium fills me up until I can't eat anymore.

I usually don't like to eat sandwiches.. but I absolutely love Yellow Submarine.
author: Vivian H.

description: Love the sandwiches here. They kick Subway's ass any day. I like the cheesesteak. I think you have to ask for the cheese you want or they won't add it. Tried the potato salad. It's fine.
author: Denise C.

description:
One of my regular, and favorite, lunch spots when I lived in the Inner Sunset. Friendly, cheap, casual, and there's something magical (crack cocaine?) that they put in their sandwiches to make them oh so delicious. 

Get the cheesesteak or the pepper steak. Make sure you go for their special hot sauce. And get the fries, too! 

Then, once you're a true believer in their deliciousness, save their number in your phone so you can call ahead next time.
author: Harry G.

description:
This place is so gewd. I literally cried when I had my first bite of the pastrami. 

I was in San Francisco for the weekend and was looking for a good sandwich/sub/deli place and found this through Yelp. Good thing I went here! 

My only problem was the line but it was quick to dissipate. They're very quick and prompt with their orders, A+. The place is small and can get crowded quick. The bread is REALLY good also, wish I could purchase it alone.

Definitely can't wait to visit this place again.
author: Angela D.

description:
A good friend told us we HAD TO GO TO YELLOW SUBMARINE. He said he drives from SOMA to eat there every once in awhile. he couldn't stop talking about the fries and how much he loved them. 

Well, I have to say, I'm a fan and love it too. You can tell from the experience that the owners take pride in the quality and service they provide. I watched the woman behind the counter (I'm guessing she was the mother and the men were her children), as she surveyed the crowd that lined up to order and eat the food she was preparing. She had a pleasant and warming quality about her. She knew which sandwich and order went with what number and person holding that number. She is a smart business woman and its obvious why the Yellow Submarine is successful. 

The food was more than amazing. The price seemed inexpensive especially for the quantity and portions. The experience was priceless.
author: Jack M.

description: Love the sandwiches here! I think the chicken is the best. You can split the large between two people if you're not starving.
author: Nina M.

description: The Yellow Submarine is a pretty average sandwich place. I ordered the chicken with everything on it, and it was only ok. The chicken was strangely cut up into small bits and was just dripping in grease which didn't add to the experience. The home made fries were not good. They were really large and round and soggy. I probably wouldn't go back.
author: Maria J.

description: My husband and I stopped by this little mom and pop shop during our visit to San Fran about a month ago... We had the steak and cheese sub... The best sub I've ever had.. The bread had just the right amount of crunchiness on the edges and the inside was soft and delicious. The meat was so juicy it dripped down my hands and fingers.. Mhhhh!! I want to go back.
author: Brenda R.

description: Been coming here for many years now. Sandwiches always satisfies the cravings and the size of a large is large enough for another meal! :)  Love the italian steak and the rueban here!! Don't forget to order the fries too!
author: Chocolate P.

description:
My Mom and I came here with the thought that we were going to appease our sandwich craving. Unfortunately, it was just the opposite. When we had approached the entrance, the guy at the front counter said that he could tell that this was probably our first time. My mom had never been here after many years of working in the area, but I, on the other hand, was part of youth group back in the days and Father H. used to take us here whenever possible. I loved it back then. Unfortunately, can't say the same today. 

   I consider myself a foodie since I love food and try new places even when I've not previewed a restaurant before going there, but this really disappointed us being that it has been around for a while, and we thought that this would be a "for sure" fulfilling choice.

     So the guy didn't even give us a chance to just deliberate and decide what we wanted, and he told us which ones were the best. I do not like being rushed into ordering. And when my Mom is under pressure, she orders hastily without thought. Nobody should be rushed to make a hasty decision when it comes to food.  I usually order a  roast beef sandwich: light on the mayo, lettuce, tomato, onions( carmelized if offered,) and either swiss or provolone. Simple. That is an order that can hardly be messed up. I like to taste the essence of what I'm eating.

        So I had the roast beef sandwich. I liked that the bread was toasted, but not only did they skimp on the roast beef and it was tasteless, they tried to use lettuce  to fill in where they skimped on the meat, yet still not filling in between  the bread !!!!! WHERE'S THE BEEF??????????

      I guess my idea of a sandwich is one that is filled with not only the lettuce, tomato, and cheese, but stacked with what meat it proclaims to have. If you are not going to offer proper sandwiches, then you should offer a decent size that has a substantial amount of meat asides from the extras that should compliment the meat inside.  Make it  a righteous, good, and tasty meal like a sandwich should be. Thank goodness I only ordered the small sandwich, who knows if they'd have enough roast beef to put into it. 

     So, my mom had the pastrami sandwich and regretfully to say, she noticed that her sandwich too was skimped on and that it was equally tasteless. How is that? Pastrami usually adds more flavoring to a sandwich than roast beef, doesn't it? Well, so much for the suggestion that was forced upon my Mom. 
     
      With that being said, we also ordered the french fries which looked like thick-sliced potatoes. They were good and made up a little for our rather less than mediocre sandwiches. 

      I hate  paying for food that leaves my Mom and I  a feeling of dissatisfaction. Times are tough and we should be happy with the food that we choose to go out for.
author: Granolia G.

description:
Yellow sub is my favorite oven toasted subs in the bay area -with Sub Center in West Portal a close second. What sets them apart is that they cook the meat only after you order, (which makes it just a bit fresher), then they toast the meat with the bread in the oven. They also make great  'fries", although they aren't really french fries. They are thick slices of potatoes deep fried, which makes them a little crunchy and a little soft on the inside, just the way I like them. If you like ultra crispy fries, these aren't for you, unless you remember to ask them to make them extra crunchy.

I've tried the turkey, veggie and all the other permutations, but nothing taste like the steak and cheese so I would advise you stick with that.

One final tip - the old lady can be surly. My advice is just step up to the counter (near the oven/stove, not near the cash register) and wait. Don't order right away. I repeat, don't order right away. In a moment, when she is ready, she will ask you what you want. If you order before she is ready, she doesn't like it. If her boys ask for your order, then go ahead as usual.

Final note: Sandwiches are huge. I recommend two people sharing one large sandwich and one order of fries. Grab extra napkins. Enjoy.
author: Dom L.

description: Is it just me or have they decreased the amount of meat in the sandwiches? The last three sandwiches I ordered had nothing in it. I was like eating bread, onions and nothing else. Hopefully my meatless streak will end and I can give them 5 stars again.
author: Jonathan L.

description: I had high hopes of this place after hearing it's good from my friend, but my steak and cheese sandwich was just bland.  There are plenty of great sandwich spots in SF and sadly, this is not on my list as one of them.  Furthermore, they ran out of fries! WHO RUNS OUT OF FRIES?!?!?!
author: Alex G.

description: Great little family owned spot (same people since 1975).  The sandwiches are great (same sandwiches since 1975).  It's a delightful little piece of The Sunset.
author: Kjerstin G.

description:
How can you not like a place named The Yellow Submarine?  The subs are large and tasty.  Personally, I like their corned beef sandwich.  You can get a large sub for 50% or more of the original price, which is usually $6.  

Parking is tough on the street with meters, but the service is quick.  There is an area to sit down and eat if needed.
author: Jenny L.

description: This place had big shoes to fill.I've seen this place on tv and read lots of glowing reviews.It surpassed.Got the steak&cheese w/ works.Perfect, nothing overpowered anything else.Hot sauce is perfect balance of heat/flavor.Only bad thing was the 25min sardine packed Petri dish MUNI ride to get here.
author: C.M. S.

description: Great sandos, fresh, homemade fries, and homemade hot sauce. Most importantly, awesome and sweet staff.
author: Lauren C.

description:
This place gave me food poisoning. If u don't like clean and sanitary food handling don't go here. 

You're thinking who doesn't like cleanliness? You'd b surprised by how people can be turned-on by a grungy and grummy meal. 

I have to give this place 2 stars though because the sandwich was good at the time.
author: Christina C.

description:
I think this place is a fantastic, mom & pop sandwich shop. The bread is great, the turkey is awesome, they heat the sandwich and add hot sauce to it. I dont think its fair to discount them for bad parking.

It is cash only, as many places are in IS, so bring cash with you. Enjoy!
author: L. B.

description:
One of my favorite sandwich shops for the last 20 years. Just stopped in today for the first time in a few years and nothing has changed. Worth going out of your way for.

One of the best chicken sandwiches ever. The large is enough for two, but I usually eat thew whole thing.
author: Jay H.

description: One of the best mom & pop sandwich shops around!  My bf and I always get the hot pastrami which is soooo delicious!!  Their bread is always fresh and I love that they grill the meat right when you order!  The owners are always super friendly.  It's def a neighborhood gem!
author: Wendy H.

description: I have to say that this place has the best sandwich in town. Their avocado sandwich with everything is one of the best. Their freshly made French fries are unique in taste and texture. Although their sandwich are a little pricy comparing to subway sandwiches, however, their sandwich will give you a boost for the whole day!
author: Catherine L.

description: I wanted to try this place out after seeing how much my friend liked their sandwiches from the review she wrote. I ordered an avocado sandwich and it was pretty expensive -around $9? for a sandwich?? you got to be kidding me. And the customer service wasn't even good. My bread was a little burnt on one corner too. I thought the sandwich was very mediocre. The spicy sauce wasn't even good and the bread was too huge. Pass!
author: Carmen L.

description:
I was always curious about this place, and just recently had the pleasure to check it out. Wowsers, this place makes darn good subs!....I've been missing out here! I tried the hot pastrami (large). Very nice looking sub!...and the taste was right on the dot! The ingredients were nicely balanced, with the pastrami just about right with the saltiness (not too overpowering like some other sandwich places). I really liked the bread they used too! It's somewhat of a hoagie type. I like how it just absorbs the flavor and juices if you save the sandwich for later.

Give this place a try! I'll be back soon.

Paolo Says: Great pastrami.....a must try! Make sure you ask for their hot sauce... capiche?
author: Paolo V.

description:
The Yellow Submarine is one of the best sandwich places (if not the best sandwich place) in San Francisco. 

I have some pretty fond memories of this place. The first time I took the N Judah line home, I missed my stop and ended up stopping right in front of the Yellow Submarine. Blessed serendipity. 

The Yellow Submarine possesses many of the same classic qualities of famous sandwich spots on the East Coasts. This is a family owned restaurant that specializes in one thing and one thing only, making super delicious sandwiches.

You have two size options for your sandwich medium (approx 6 inches) and the large (approx 12 inches). All their sandwiches are huge and comes with a ton of toppings. I always go with the works. Plus all the sandwiches are served on perfectly toasted bread.

My favorite sandwich is by far the corned beef. I am talking about a meaty and flavorful sandwich that tingles the taste buds with each bite. The sandwich bread adds the perfect amount of crunch and texture. If you are a lover of all things meat, this is a great choice. Other delicious options are the steak and cheese and the meatball sandwich. Two other sandwiches worthy enough to be offered up to the meat gods.

Despite all the shortcomings of the N Judah bus line, one of its few redeeming qualities is that it stops right in front of this wonderful San Francisco sandwich institution. I am definitely on a personal quest to try all the (meat) sandwiches here.
author: Allan Y.

description:
When I came out of the car around the corner to Yellow Submarine, I can smell the very good aroma coming from the restaurant that is very good.

I had the Italian Steak sandwich and the fries which it's very good. 
The sandwich it self is good medium size portions but has a kick of flavor that felt like it's a very good homemade sandwich.

The fries is the best part that it's round, thick and less salt too.

The service is good, although it's cash only but good recommedation and good quality as well.

I'm so coming back again!
author: Cindy G.

description: The Yellow Submarine is not as cool as its namesake implies. It's actually kind of a shit hole; like a gas station restroom. A medium sized hot sub is about $6.50. The size of the sandwich was fine, but I thought they were skimping on the pastrami. We also ordered fries which came after we had finished our sandwiches and were not fries, more like greasy chips. It wasn't that great but for some reason there were a lot of people there ordering mediocre sandwiches.
author: Kristen F.

description: A very good option for any New England transplant craving a delicious deli sandwich. This definitely hit the spot. Will be returning.
author: Erik C.

description:
When I lived in London briefly, I used to go to the movies fairly often with my then boyrfriend.

The first movie we ever watched together was X-Men 2. (this was not my choice)

Being the classy people that we were - we made sure to bring our dinner with us.

We stopped at a small grocery store,  bought a baguette, a big tub of coleslaw, a package of sliced turkey some cheese and went on our way. (we'd later discover that we forgot a plastic knife)

Our then bagged ingredients, were shoved beneath his big green army coat ....and we awkardly hurried into the movie theater.

Covered in globs of cole-slaw, with brittle bread crumbs covering our pants - we walked out of the movie theater, dazed, content and full.

The movie wasn't  wowing - but our meal was. Of course.

****  

Yellow Submaine is ten times better than my London amateur sandwiches. 

And that is saying something.

With their HUGE warm and fresh subs, stuffed with plenty of fix-ins and turkey, topped with vinegar and oil - I can never get home fast enough to eat them.

My favorite part of coming to Yellow Submaine, is ordering a cup of coleslaw, which I spoon hungrily into my mouth as I watch the sandwich masters at work, eagerly awaiting the moment that I can whisk my sub back home for a marathon of Project Runway.
author: Jessica T.

description: 7/16/2013: Great pepper steak sandwich (Philly cheesesteak with provolone or American on white roll with steak, peppers and grilled onions). Tasty stuff even when we didn't get around to eating it until 2 hours later at a picnic at Stow Lake in nearby Golden Gate Park. The pastrami sandwich was boring. CASH ONLY! Tiny place, so step inside and quickly place your order and go (or grab one of their ~10 packed in little tables).
author: Heather M.

description:
The Yellow Submarine is a local mom and pop shop serving delicious sandwiches. A friend recommended this place, because of the sandwiches, but more so the fries and now I know why. They definitely have their regulars, and the brothers and mom are friendly to talk to when you're waiting for your food.

Grilled Chicken with onions was tender and juicy that hits the spot time to time again.

Italian Combo with its' meaty goodness paired with their hot sauce is heaven sent.

Fries are freshly sliced and fried. Be sure to separate or air them out individually to crispy even more on their own. 

I do my best to call ahead of time to avoid waiting in line because the wait can be long during peak hours. Seating can be scarce during these peak hours, so have someone on hand to grab a table if you're planning to eat there.
author: Casey L.

description:
Hey man, I was so looking forward to a Sixties acid trip with surreal, psychedelic colors, the smell of hash-hish and the sound of sitars reflecting the Beatles during their Maharishi Mahesh Yogi period. That would have been groovy...out of this world...blow my mind, man.

But when I came down from my head trip, man, all I saw was this sandwich shop. That's cool because the guys here make good sandwiches, toasted and with the works. I had the medium Italian combo which was stuffed high with salami, mortadella and provolone. Nothing outstanding but for $5.50, it was good value especially when you couple it with a $1.35 styrofoam cup of homemade potato salad.

The challenge here is the lengthy wait. The staff gets a bit flustered when the place gets crowded, and you may want to secure your table in the adjoining room where you can study on the wall a primitive cartoon menu circa 1977 (with the Carter-era prices whited out, of course). But it's right off the N-Judah, a convenient spot if you're heading out to Ocean Beach or Golden Gate Park.

So take a downer and chill, man...the Sixties will be back, man. Where's Jerry Garcia when you need him?

FOOD - 3.5 stars...a solid sandwich
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...a compact place for compact people
SERVICE - 3 stars...nice guys, attentive when you order...but ah, the wait
TOTAL - 3 stars...worth the stop if you're coming down from a head trip, man...stop the war!...impeach Nixon!
author: Ed U.

description: Food was great. Service was fast. Ordered the Steak and cheese with the works + the homemade hot sauce. The Fries are are must. Next on my list is the pastrami sandwhich. It looked equally amazing.
author: Big A.

description:
klink, klink, klink, klink, klink, klink, klink ...

That's the sound of metal spatula chopping away on a hot metal grill.  That plus some of the biggest, most delicious hot sandwiches await you at the Yellow Submarine.  This sandwich shop is small in size and very popular on weekends so you can almost always expect to wait as a line often goes out the front door and onto the sidewalk.  The sandwiches are made to order so expect to wait again once you've put in your order.  There are tons of sandwich options written big on one wall and you can choose between a medium sandwich and a large sandwich.  Either choice is quite inexpensive considering the portions you get.  If you're a big eater the large (really large!) is the way to go; for about two dollars more you get almost double everything on the medium.

They'll apply a mountain of hot-off-the-grill meat and cheese (American, Swiss or Provolone) if you desire onto a fresh sandwich roll and bake it in their huge pizza oven.  So far I've tried the Steak and Cheese, the Roast Beef and the Pepper Steak and Cheese and all of them have been fabulous.  You can have your sandwich with The Works, shredded lettuce, sliced ripe Roma tomatoes, onion, pickles, mayonnaise, mustard, hot sauce, vinegar and oil or any combination of those items.

The sandwich comes out super toasty.  The bread is hot and crumbly on the outside and soft and chewy on the inside.  The meat and cheese are hot and the fresh vegetables give your sandwich crispness.  If you are especially hungry order up a basket of their homemade french fries.  These are circular similar to potato chips, sliced not-too-thin and fried up to a crispy brown.  There is a large assortment of cold drinks available for purchase.  Eat in or take out, as there is a small seating area where you can sit down and enjoy your sandwich.  Friendly staff too!
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: Went here for a couple of large Sandwiches today.  We also ordered two fries.  The fries here are actually round chips.  They are absoluetly great!  Make sure to order them well done or crispy, unless you prefer them soggy.  We ordered them well done, but they were not cooked well done.  That was fine because the sandos were huge and amazing.  We got a large pastrami and a large cheese steak.  We split each and quickly finished the pastrami.  They make a huge sandwich here the same way they have been for at least thirty years.  This is a must visit sandwich landmark of San Francisco.  I thought I saw the so called "King of Pastrami" walk in.  It was not him.  He doesn't know any of the real places to go to get a great sandwich in the city....Yep.
author: D.c.g G.

description:
Good sandwiches and I like the french fries. I had the chicken cheese steak sandwich and the steak and cheese, and both were pretty good. It's more on the junk food side for me, so I will definitely get the subs when feeling the need for a splurge, but not  often. 

I do have to say that their french fries are very original and taste pretty good. :)
author: Magdalena Z.

description:
Came here on a Saturday afternoon and this place was pretty packed.  Luckily, we beat the rush and was able to snag a table for 5 in the back.  It's a sandwich spot, where you order in front, pay, get a number and save a table. They did not have a visible restroom, so I didn't have a place to wash my hands. 

The cashier recommended the hot pastrami sandwich and fresh cut potato fries.

The regular sandwich was $7-$8 and the large sandwich was $2 more.  I shared a large and was not able to finish my half of the sandwich.  I liked how the sandwich had grilled onions, but wish they had more meat in it.  I  take small bites, so it took forever to taste the inside of the sandwich cause the bread was too thick. The highlight of the sandwich was that it came out warm. 

My favorite was the fresh cut potato fries, when you separate them and let it cool down, it turns crispy on its own; just like potatoe chips. I also asked for a side of the special hot sauce that every one was yelping about.  The hot sauce just tasted like taco bell hot sauce, not good nor bad.  

I didn't notice anything special about this sandwich place for me to come back again. Just a normal local sandwich place in the neighborhood.
author: Chanel L.

description:
Yum.

This little sub shop was an ideal stop on our way to a sunny picnic in gg park yesterday.  We split a large avocado sub and fresh cut fries.  The sub was big and tasty.  No skimping on the avocado and mindful amounts of condiments.  Perfect amount of mayo, onion, and crisp shredded lettuce. They accomodated when we asked for pickles only on half.  The fries were awesome too.

Don't be discouraged if there is a line out the door.  The ordering area can only fit a couple people.  We got our order quickly even though it was pretty busy.  Call ahead if you can.
author: Demi T.

description:
I'd suggest the Pepper steak sandwich here. Their special house sauce is really spicy, so I wouldn't suggest it unless you love to add hot sauce to everything you eat.. in my opinion it overpowers the flavor of the sandwich. 

You can call ahead and order for pickup otherwise it takes roughly 5-10 minutes to get your sandwich.
author: Nancy L.

description: Maybe the best sandwich ever! Had the veal parm sandwich and it was an excellent combination of flavors. Bread was great,  just as expected from a SF restaurant. Way under priced for a sandwich of this quality. Line was long but worth the wait and the staff was kindly apologetic which I was appreciative of.  Good things come to those who wait. Don't expect fancy but expect fantastic. I wish they would open a place like this in Redondo beach. I will back!
author: M D.

description:
The best avocado/ veggie subs in the Yay-Area.

The thick cut fries? -- They'll annihilate any trace of the [d-i-e-t] word you ever thought existed in your life, and your life will be that much better because of it, promise.

They lost a star because one of the first times I went there I found a long silver-gray hair in my sub ='( (wahhhhh!!!) -- and, yes, that shock and ick-factor took a few months to wear off.. but goddamn those fries!

Oh, and if you have a relatively small appetite like I do -- share a large-sized sub -- they're HUMONGOUS.

Like, -whoa- and: -yum-...

-Whoa-Yum-
author: Anjali V.

description:
The Yellow Submarine is an unfeigned, genuine sandwich shop. Ate here today after our original plans to eat Malaysian food failed, that seems to happen to me too often. But it is okay because I always end up with delicious food anyways. 

This was the first time I have been back to The Yellow Submarine since I was in high school, before all the Ike's popped up everywhere. I am not execrating Ike's or the Ike's type sandwich in anyway. I love those sandwiches, but The Yellow Submarine has a different type of charm, one that is inimitable by the new sandwich shops. It has this old school, local charm. 

Sandwiches are cheap and offered in medium or large... The medium was more than enough for me, I had a hard time finishing a medium avocado sandwich + fries, well I didn't really finish everything. I almost wanted to stop halfway but since the bread is toasted, the sandwich taste best fresh. I was determined to finish. Felt like a fatty afterwards... but my stomach was happy.
author: Angela T.

description:
I ordered through the phone again. It was on a weekday around 1pm. I asked for avocado in my sandwich, but they told me the same thing as last time, "saving it." I asked for no onions on it as well. When I finally ate it later that day, I thought to myself "um. this tastes funny." I open it up and I find onion in my sandwich. I was pretty sad and disappointed. When you call in to order, they write down your order on the bag they put your sandwich in. So I look at my paper bag and there's my order, and it says NO ONION. But yet I find onion in my sandwich..It still tastes good, but I'm not a fan of onion so I wasn't completely happy.

2.5 STARS. A little difficult to find parking (residential).
author: Shirley L.

description: Delicious sandwiches. Fresh ingredients and traditional service. I highly recommend this place for anyone who loves a good sandwich.
author: Sherman T.

description:
Warm, juicy, and big, yellow submarine sub has all that it takes to make an excellent sandwich! Let me deconstruct the sub for you:

Bread: well-toasted french bread that's crunchy on the outside and edges and still chewy and soft on the inside. There's never that stale old bread texture when you bite into the bread, rather, it's always that just-baked and fresh-out-of-the-oven deliciousness!

Meat: doesn't matter what kind of meat you choose, they give you a LOT of meat for your sandwich. Hot gooey cheese (of your choice) melted on (or cooked into the meat) the juicy deli meat makes a perfect combination

Veggie: they pile on lots of shredded lettuce and tomatoes which gives the sub a refreshing taste and lifts up some of that heaviness from your meat and cheese.

Condiments: besides the regular mustard and mayo, you really should try their homemade "hot" hot sauce if you're into spicy food. It definitely wakes up your palette with a "heeellllooo" knock on the door!

So far I've tried their steak and cheese, pepper steak, and turkey subs, all of them have been excellent and tasty. I will definitely go back for more whenever I crave a good hot sandwich. To me, a simple and to-the- point sandwich hits the spot better than any other kind of fancy sandwich!
author: Joyce C.

description:
This place is a definite hole in the wall and a hidden treasure of the Sunset district. The reason I'm only giving it four stars is because, due to no fault of their own, the place is putting less meat and less veggies because groceries in general are just getting more expensive. 

But, the sandwiches are phenomenal regardless of the small changes they've gone through recently. They use fresh tomatoes and clean lettuce, a hard thing to find these days. The place has lots of options in hot sandwiches, my favorite being the pepper steak, a sandwich with grilled green peppers and lean steak. Another good option is the Reuben. These people do it the right way, with lots of good meat and topping it with Thousand Island dressing. They always ask if you want the works and don't charge extra for anything basic. The sandwiches come on fresh rolls and you have a choice of medium-sized and larger sized sandwiches, which are good for about two meals for some people.

This place seems family-owned and the workers are nice. The lines get pretty long sometimes during lunch hour with UCSF being so close. I'd suggest calling in your order after you find some parking and walking in so your sandwiches are ready.
author: Larry Y.

description: I decided to come with my roommate to this place b/c of all of the amazing yelp reviews.  Since it was my first time, the guy suggested a sandwich to me and I thought that it sounded relatively appetizing.  We ordered the french fries as suggested by yelp and those were okay. However, when it came to the sandwiches, the guys made it completely wrong.  I asked for no mayo, no mustard and no tomatoes and they totally did not pay attention to that and included those things.  The sandwich was also super soggy.  I won't be returning again.  I suggest to others to watch them and constantly remind them of what you do not want in your sandwich, otherwise yours will come out nasty too.
author: Carrine J.

description:
My all-time favorite lunch time spot on a beautiful day, or whenever I've had a long day of work. 

Fantastic warm Boston-style subs, great friendly family staff (2 brothers who own the place...I believe their mother also cooks sandwiches most days), and great hole-in-the-wall historic location.

Tips: Order the Pastrami or Ham sandwich. Larges are HUGE, so the regular is usually enough food for the average person. ONLY CASH, though they have an ATM outside and there's also a BofA and WF down on 9th and Irving.
author: Brendan L.

description: One of  my favorite sandwich shops in the City.  I have been going for over 8 years now and can't get enough of it.  Love Mama's special hot sauce.  Potato Salad is really good too.  Great family owned business.  Everyone is always police and the service is fast.
author: Ron V.

description:
We all live in the yellow submarine... the yellow submarine...

This was my favorite neighborhood joint when I lived out here.  Granted it's a total mom-and-pop sandwich shop, but you gotta love the sandwiches.

My favorite is the steak with grilled onions (imagine philly cheesesteak, but with sandwich goodies in it- lettuce, tomato, etc).  Their fries are more like a cross between fresh chips and fried potatoes.... mmm.

Best place to get a sandwich in the area!
author: Christine K.

description: Amazing sandwiches and french fries. The sandwiches are made on real sub bread and they toast it which makes it delicious. There is a wide selection of sandwiches, all worth trying. The people who work there are very friendly. This is a definite go to for delicious and filling submarine sandwiches
author: David W.

description:
I never really paid attention to Yellow Submarine until seeing it on Check Please Bay Area.  I was surprised that a sandwich place could have such an impact on someone.  I mean, here is your chance to showcase your favorite eatery, and you pick a sandwich shop?  At the same time, it really piqued my interest in trying it out. 

When we got a chance to go, my husband and I shared a medium Italian combo and fries.  The size was good, with plenty of meat.  Of course, I don't recommend sharing a medium size if you want a full meal and aren't just snacking like we were doing.  Bread didn't get soggy even after we took it home, which was great.  

What we really liked were the fries, which were essentially potato wedges (but thin slices).  Crispy and delicious!
author: Candice B.

description: Best Sandwiches in the city hands down, almost makes me wanna move back to the Sunset....almost
author: CeeLo L.

description:
We came here one sunny afternoon for a sandwich.  we had heard of this place from Check Please Bay Area.  I don't remember what I  ordered but I know for sure it is something different than what my husband ordered - just because we always like to try different things.  But when the 2 sandwiches came out - they tasted the same!!  Leads me to believe that their sandwiches are pretty much the same.  

The sandwich bun is nicely toasted (which is a plus) but the meat can use a little more salt.  Overall, it's not bad, but not superb either.  The good thing is that the Medium size sandwich is huge!!  They give you your moneys worth.  We also ordered a side of fries, which is basically slices of potatoes (flat) and fried.  I wasn't a fan of this ... the middle of the potatoes are so oily and limp.  I know that fries in general are oily, but to see it and to taste it is another thing!!
author: Jannie Q.

description:
today is my birthday and Yellow Submarine is my birthday lunch. Need I say more?

just in case I DO need to say more: reuben, everything, with extra hot sauce. split a large with the hubby and feeling like a birthday super star.
author: Jessa B.

description:
It's so hard to find a place that makes good deli / submarine sandwiches nowadays. I tried Yellow Submarine through the recommendation of my brother. The sandwiches come in two sizes: medium or large. As a person who doesn't eat very much to begin with, the medium is a bit large. However, I do think you get your money's worth. I usually just end up saving the other half for later. The best part is that the bread doesn't get soggy. Prior to making your sandwich, they'll toast the bread for you. Normally at other places, the bread will be soggy if it just sits there, but the bread here is still in "good condition". I've gotten their Pastrami which I thought I was a bit too salty. I've also gotten their turkey and I think it's really good..especially when you add in the hot sauce. Yum Yum! 

As their lines do get long, it's suggested to call ahead of time. Plus, the parking there is a nightmare.
author: Candice H.

description:
Holy Bananas I love their steak and cheese. I get double cheese, provolone and swiss and homemade hot sauce every time. The homemade sauce is a must! 

Great family run restaurant and perfect for hangovers. If you get a large sandwich and eat it all, clear a couple hours from your schedule because you will have food coma.
author: Mikhail K.

description:
I'm native to the city and usually hit an East Bay, moms n' pops hoagie shop, but wanted to try this place out since the Niners game was about to start and it's just a few blocks from where I live.  I ordered the Rueben with extra Provolone, and a side of potato salad (they were out of cole slaw).  The guy who took my order was really nice - I think he was the owner.  While I waited for my sub, I started with the potato salad, and must say, it was hella good! So good that I actually bought another one to go.  After getting my sandwich, I walked home and sat down to kill this thing while watching the Niners vs. GB game on TV.  But I have to say though: I was really disappointed with the sub. The sandwich was generously portioned, but after taking one bite, I tasted all of the condiments in the sandwich, EXCEPT for the meat and cheese (ordered extra)!  I put the sandwich down and opened it up to find that the sub was filled with mostly shredded lettuce, a couple of pickles, three small, roughly cut chucks (not slices) of tomatoes and sauces.  The small 1/2 inch cut pieces of meat that was there was mixed with mostly grilled onions.  

To pay $10 for Reuben and then get what looked and tasted more like a veggie sandwich was disappointing and ruined the game.  I gave two stars for their service and potato salad, but I'm sorry to say that I will not be a patron to this sub shop again.  This is why I drive to the East Bay and grab a hoagie sub from "Mills Hoagies".  Now THAT's a meat filled sub and it's worth the 30 minute drive!
author: D L.

description: I love this place. Best sandwiches, good prices, total dive atmosphere , which I love. Whenever I'm in the Bay Area, this is a must stop. The hot sauce on the sandwiches is the best.  We need more places like this.
author: Bill H.

description: awesome sub sandos in the area! bread is soft and there is the right amount of meat to veggies. the owner is very nice as well. definitely going again!
author: Vivian H.

description:
Meh.  Having recently moved from Boston, I was curious what these "Boston-style" subs were all about... and I have to say, most mom 'n pop grinder shops in Beantown are way ahead of this place.  My bf's steak and cheese was dry and lacking in the cheese department.  My avocado sandwich was served on burnt bread and was fairly bland.  The fries (thick-cut potato wedges, really) were limp and greasy.  They take cash only.  And to top it all off, on a cold day  -- the type of day when I LOVE a melty, toasty sub -- this sandwich shop feels approximately like the arctic tundra.  Brrrr.

Overall, not a huge fan.
author: Laura R.

description:
One word: Delicious!!! Love their steak and peppers sandwich. Don't forget to order a side of fries. 

You may want to call ahead and order or else be prepared to wait for a while. 

Also makes for great leftovers.
author: Michelle G.

description:
Yumm!!!

Great Sandwiches - when I went it was very busy but the wait not long.  Definitely recommended!
author: Julie B.

description: I have to let people know about my experience here, I ordered a sub and the woman while making my sub went into the back area. Before she reentered the front area I saw her reach down in her shoe to scratch the bottom of her foot. I saw her the entire time (there was someone with me and they saw the same thing) and she did Not wash her hands. We've coined this place "Yellow Fever Submarine" and have never returned.
author: Jeff M.

description:
Fast freshly made to order sandwiches! 

The bread was crunchy on the outside and a little soft on the inside, sandwich made with variety of meats and condiments. CHEAP and good if you're ever in the area!
author: Amy C.

description: One of the best sandwich I've had is SF in awhile.  Had the steak and cheese with French fries.  The sandwich had a little kick to it with there hot sauce and the ff were great.  Looks like its family owned witch I support ... I will be back for sure.
author: Scott G.

description: The sandwiches are OK and the fries can be a bit wilted, not too much meat in the sandwiches. Altogether, I think you can get a better value sandwich for the price.
author: Baviera K.

description:
HUUUUGE sandwiches and what a bargain. Great price for great portions.  My boyfriend and I got a large each last time, I think they were weirded out.  Now, we get 1 large to share (recommended).

They're not so fast but you can call ahead.  Definitely get the french fries.
author: Nami S.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE!
Fresh, made-to-order sandwiches.
Friendly service, family-run business, from what I can tell.
Reasonable prices.
NOT A CHAIN...support them!
author: Sharon J.

description: This is an old stand by for me.  I always enjoy the Salami sammy!!  And when I feel like being REALLY bad, I order the 'French Fries"...but they are not really fries, but rather rounds..... and I feel fat after I eat them... but I also feel satisfied! :)
author: Blake J.

description: The subs were ok. I liked their "potato chips". I thought the place was bigger inside but surprisingly no. It's pretty small! It's not bad... just not exciting and wow-y enough.
author: Stephen Y.

description:
This place is not much to look at. Tiny place for making their sandwiches but you get some seating right next door. 

Came here with my brother and my dad to order a few sandwiches for lunch and I was surprised when we got our order. 

We all ordered a medium sandwich while regretting a bit because we thought we wouldn't be full. Wow, after I received the bag, I was extremely excited to see how much you get for only $6. They were hot and ready to eat.

I unwrapped the butcher paper to reveal the warm veal parmesan. Two cuts of breaded veal topped with the works and carefully squished between two slices of toasted bread. I only needed one half to be full. The bread wasn't crunchy but wasn't insanely soft either. The veal reminded me of those old McDonald's chicken sandwiches; still very good. Had bits of parmesan and the lettuce/mustard added a refreshing taste to it.   

I would gladly come here again. The people were nice and the amount you get for the price is great. I'm gonna try their thin cut potatoes next time too.
author: robin w.

description:
One thing I hate is when I have a high expectation.
We were in SF after the Alice concert and we were hungry.
Since we didn't really know the area, we used mobile yelp to find "what's hot" in SF.
Great.  We found this place.
We headed over and it was an hour till closing.
The seating inside was already stacked on the tables and there was one person in front of us.  It was a tiny little joint, but really excited.
The guy was pretty nice, kinda rushed.
I asked him what was the most popular sandwich since he said the cheese steak, so of course, I ordered that one.
After a long wait, we got our sandwiches and my BF ordered the same thing as me, just no mustard.  When we got them, we ate in the car to discover the guy didn't put cheese in his.
I took a bite and all I could think of, where's the flavor?  It was so bland.  So boring.  Both my BF and I were really disappointed.  He even apologized b/c he chose the spot.  
I don't know what the hype is all about, but maybe their other sandwiches are better, but if he said this sandwich was the most popular, then i'm going to base all the sandwiches are bland and boring.  Sorry.
I really wanted to love this spot.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
So I came here with my friend today. This would be my second time eating here. The first time was when I was in 8th or 9th grade with my dad, and I remembered the food being pretty good. 

Anyways, today I ordered the Steak & Cheese sandwich. It was pretty good, but nothing really too special. I expected the steak to melt in my mouth, but instead it was a little chewy. My friend ordered the hot pastrami, and it basically tasted the same... I think the sauces they use overpowers the meat a little, giving almost every sandwich the same taste. The sandwich was pretty big too. We order medium. My friend and I only finished half our sandwiches, and traded our other halves so we could eat later.

We also ordered fries. The fries here are basically slice of potatoes, fried. It tasted like half chips, half fries. It wasn't too bad, but it wasn't that great to us. It was really oily.

The service is alright. It took a good while to get our food. The energy I got from the workers was more of a busy energy. They weren't rude, mean, or anything, they just seemed rushed.

Overall, this is an alright sandwich place. Nothing too special. I wouldn't be coming here anytime soon, but maybe later on when I'm near here, and hungry.
author: Derek T.

description:
I've been going here for quite some time now and is very easily one of the BEST sandwich places I have ever been to.

Although the parking can sometimes be rough (I suggest using the parking lot a couple of blocks down behind Jamba Juice -- it's basically an alley so keep your eyes peeled) the sandwiches here are more than worth it. There's never more than three people working there and at lunch time it can get crowded but the people working there are very friendly and try their best to get your food to you as quickly as possible. 

If you're in a huge rush I might not suggest it but for those trying to get a good bite to eat in the Sunset this is a wonderful place to do it. The portions are big (sizes are medium and large) and there's always room to sit inside. Just make sure you bring your appetite with you. 

Last but not least I suggest the reuben. It is probably one of the best sandwiches they make.
author: Sean B.

description: Yellow submarine is a little sandwich spot on Irving in the inner sunset. The ownership has been around forever and it shows!! These guys really know how to make a sand which the right way. They cook the meat right in front of you. The pastrami sandwich is to die for. Their interesting fries are also a trademark. I would really give these guys a try you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.
author: Bryan E.

description:
I really would love to give this more stars, since Tb and I went here for lunch today. The guy recommended the Steak and Cheese and it wasnt good. 

I was thinking it would at least taste something similar to the Cheesesteak by my house but it wasnt. 

Service was great though.
author: Malou C.

description: This place gets 5 stars because they have lasted 40 years serving great sandwiches.  I lived in SFO back in the 70s and this was a staple for a reasonable lunch and remains so.  The cheese combo and fries for 10 bucks is a bargin.  If you get a chance to stop by order your sub with the works you won't be disappointed.
author: Bob R.

description: The sandwiches are okay, but generic.  The fries are absolutely horrible, they only serve canned soda and its cash only.  Three strikes and you are out Yellow Submarine.
author: Andy Z.

description: I've had subs here many times. Each time I tell myself there won't be a next time because I feel ripped off. Reason being. There's hardly any meat on the subs. They put just enough to get by and say that it's a sandwich. The preparation is good. They have their own house made hot sauce. Honestly it tastes great, but they're a business and Skimp on meat portions. The flavor is good.
author: Robert P.

description: I got the steak sandwich and was AMAZING. After i ordered, didnt take that long for them to get my order ready. But next time ill ask not to add salt to it as im not used to the salty food outside. Also ill ask them if they can remove the extra bread inside the actual bread roll. I like thin layer of bread for sandwiches.
author: Kim K.

description: This is one of the best places on earth to eat a sub samdwhich in the beautiful area of San Francisco California. My Experience here was one of the best. Peper Steak And Cheese was the best is so is the turkey avacodo the whole menu is great even the fresh cut homemade french fries. So if you are heading in to the city this is the place to eat.
author: Mr F.

description: Great,great,great pastrami sandwich.  Nice counter folks.  I will stop by any chance I get.  Subway is hay in comparison to this place.
author: Fernando F.

description:
I am new to the hood and was very excited to find such a legit sandwich place close by. This place is family run and the staff is quick, polite no nonsense. 

MASSIVE portions - a large will feed two hungry adults. I ate a large and had food coma for dayzzz. 

So far I've tried the Chicken Melt and the Turkey..both were fantastic. I can't wait to go back.
author: Dustin E.

description:
Don't get me wrong - I enjoyed my sub/hoagie. Bread was toasty, everything was packed and tidy, and taste was good. I felt something was missing - HOT SAUCE. I think a good hot sauce will compliment nicely with the sandwich.

Fries was interesting, more like fried potato chips. Some of them were crispy, the other were moist and soft. I don't dislike it, but it's not a must-eat, in my opinion.  They were lightly salted, and again hot sauce would be great addition.

Even though I don't have this joint rated with 4 stars, I will definitely go back for a different sub next time.
author: Edmund L.

description: I love this place even though it gets some negative reviews. Hot pastrami and Swiss with grilled onions. Not a big fan of the homemade chips as they are often soggy but the sandwiches are good. Longtime family owned place. By my count the lady there has made me about 500 sandwiches in my life (which probably means I should have my cholesterol checked stat).
author: John K.

description:
This place is a good deli. 

Went with the sis, we ordered individual yet identical sandwiches. It was foolish - the 'wiches are 10 inches long - but smart because we had lunch for  the next day. 

The veggies were great, the toasted bread was perfection.
author: Em L.

description:
Don't know what's up with the low ratings this month- but I just came here today and it was great. The pepper steak and the italian sausage were both really, really good- I couldn't choose a favorite. The homemade hot sauce is super yummy and the potato chips are GREAT. This is really cheap for a HUGE sandwich- definitely enough for at least two meals. 

Just BTW, it's just a little order-at-the-counter place, not a great sit-down or anything. Good for lunch or casual dinner.
author: Janelle V.

description:
eh, if i lived here i would come. I wouldnt make a special trip out here though. 

I had the steak and cheese which tasted like the pepper steak w/o the pepper. It's good and generously portioned but i didnt think it was worth the hype. Maybe if I wasnt so excited for it (and hungry), I  wouldve enjoyed it more. It's like a sandwich version of a Harry Potter movie....you might be disappointed if youre too excited for it. 

The fries arent the typical fries you get which I was excited for but it wasnt as crispy as i thought it'd be...maybe thats how it is but i wouldve enjoyed a more crisp fry. especially since it was so thinly sliced. 

Hot sauce is good and you should put it on your sandwich. Adds a good kick.
author: Young L.

description:
Yellow Sub is still a boy hood favorite, but come on guys we gotta get competitive with the competition!

Another place I've been coming to since I was a youngster, this place still produces some great sandwiches with mom still behind the counter. Quality and quantity for the prices you pay has dipped but you still get a great sandwich and one of the only places on my sandwich list where you can get fries with your order! There whole slice fries are the best in the city, but they can be oily sometimes.
author: Rio A.

description:
Yellow sub is good. The sandwiches are very decent. Life changing? Not really. But if you are jonesing for a sandwich, YS should take care of it.

My roommates and I frequent this place, so I've had them at their best and their worst, and like I said, they are very decent, but not excellent.

Their fries are quite good, order them. If you are not a hot sauce fan, make sure you ask them to skip it.

I recommend calling an order in before picking it up, particularly if you are in walking distance.
author: Sara D.

description: This place will no disappoint you! Their subs are great, but I feel like this is a place where you have to know what's up there because not everything is on the menu. It's cash only and no parking. You'd be lucky to find a spot on the street.
author: Melissa G.

description:
food: 4/5
service: just cashier
decor/clean:4/5 (small dining area, mostly people buy to go)

Yellow submarine is a sandwich place that is located near UCSF and golden gate park. It is a small place that has a couple tables and chairs, nothing fancy. Most people get their good to go. Most sandwiches are about $7 and worth the money. They are pretty big and definitely fill you up. I usually end up throwing 1/4 of the bread away since I get so full. Plus the bread is kinda chewy so you have to work at it. I just give up and throw it away. If you like spicy, their spicy sauce is definitely hot. There are 3 levels of spiciness though.
author: Cecile S.

description:
One of the best sandwich places in San Francisco. This place has been here for a while because i remember as a kid i used to always pass by this place on my way to elementary school. Since its been here that long, they must have been doing something right. 

I have been looking for a place to get a quick bite before i hit the library at UCSF and I would say i did not make a bad decision. I've tried the hot pastrami and pepper steak, both were delicious, but i found the pepper steak to be more tasty because the meat was more heartier. 

If your going to compare this place to Little Lucca's in South San Francisco, then i would definitely pick Little Lucca's. Why? Well i like lots of meat in my sandwiches and Little Lucca's gives me that (boy do they). I'm not saying yellow submarine is cheap on the meat, because they give you a good portion, but i just would prefer more :). 

On the positive note, yellow submarine is very flavorful, with a mouthful of flavor with every bite. The bread is awesome. Its soft and perfectly toasted. I've never had bread like this from any other sandwich shop and its just perfect. I remember trying there fries a long time ago and i did not like it. They were not crunchy, but were just sliced potatoes (like potato chips) that tasted like they were cooked in oil. Like i said, its been a while so maybe a lot has changed and its crispy now.

Parking is an issue in this part of the sunset. I always end up circling the block a few times before finding parking.

The service is great. Employees always have a positive attitude and do there best to get your order as soon as possible. There is something i've been wondering after the few times i've been going and that is, are they twin brothers behind the counter? hehe. I swear the guy that takes the order and the guy that cooks, looks exactly alike. Eh, whatever :/.

Overall great sandwich spot. You won't regret coming to yellow submarine.
author: Harrison C.

description:
Haiku ode to turkey and cheese sando:

Morning adventure
Today, the Inner Sunset! 
Got kinda hungry...

Sandwich sounded good,
Turkey, swiss, yummy bread, and 
Lettuce, tomato.

3 stars for effort
Not the most amazing meal
But, satisfying!
author: Hannah L.

description:
There's things that push a place over the top.

It's not just the food.  (Yellow Sub knows how to build a sandwich).

It's not just the people (I watched the owner have a meaningful, personal conversation with every single customer that came in.  Even a panhandler who tried to buy a sandwich with half a joint).

It's not just the decor (vibrant window art slightly flaking, like a hallucinogenic 2nd grade classroom just due for some stimulus).

It's a lot of things coming together.  It's an attitude.  It's a confident humility in food lovingly prepared, generously priced, and cheerfully delivered.

I wrote a story in tribute, here: http://stretchyhead.com/the-yellow-submarine/
author: S H.

description:
I would make sweet sweet love down by the fire to these subs. 

We went a couple days ago. We walk in and the gentleman behind the counter greets us right away. He made suggestions and small talk and honestly started our experience off PERFECT. Great Customer service! We ordered the Steak and Cheese, the Chicken, and some of the 'Fries' per recommendation. 
The Subs were amazing, perfectly portioned parties in my mouth. Bread was toasted but lightly chewy and soft at the same time. All the ingredients were fresh and held together in the Sub without spilling out. Next time I will try the homemade hot sauce. i was afraid it would be too spicy, but I am willing to take the chance now.
Those 'Fries' are flipping amazing! That's all I have to say. GET THE FRIES!!! If you don't like them, someone should cut your taste buds out, cause you don't know how to use them.

.....After writing this review, I have to go back in again today to get a fix.
author: Jena D.

description:
This is one of the many great places that lines the streets of the 9th and Irving area. I myself am a fan of the salami sandwich, and the smallest size could still feed two people. 

However, the sandwiches are not the star of the Yellow Submarine. For me, it's allllll about the hand-cut potato fries. They are discs of oily, fried, starchy, salty gold. Again, an order of fries could easily feed two people. I would be willing to spend an entire day just slowly shoveling them into my face. Everything is made fresh! Which is great, but also cruel and unusual, as it keeps me from immediately devouring a basket of fries upon entry into the sub shop.

This place is cash only, but it's affordable. A definite neighborhood favorite.
author: Rachel A.

description:
Don't fall for the hype!

I saw this place on Check Please! Bay Area, so I decided to try this place myself to see what all of the hype and the long line is about...

Got the steak & cheese sandwich with fries on the side. The steak was pre-made (like quizno style deli meat + oven heated), which did not impress at all and the taste was not good at all. As for the fries, they were unique in a sense it was sliced one way only, instead of the typical cross-sliced fries (like ones from Mickey D's). The downside of cutting the fries the way they do is the oil condenses into a blob and it soaks through anything that is suppose to be crunchy. It was like drink a pint of oil. 2 stars for the creativity on the fries though!
author: Ming S.

description: I paid Mr. Yellow Submarine a visit late last year and the place has not changed one bit. It is the still same, adorably themed, clean and nice shop it has always been. Although the service could learn a thing or three about customer services, it's probably one of the top 10 places to grab a sandwich in San Francisco. Each one of their sandwiches are carefully assembled and toasted perfectly to a crisp. I really recommend upgrading your sandwich to the larger size because it really makes it a bang for your buck. The upgraded size coupled with an order of fries is really enough to feed two people with moderately appetites. I personally recommend the roast beef one or the philly cheese steak. BONAPETITE.
author: Sue T.

description:
This place makes a good sandwich Boston style (toasted bread and cheese in oven first). This place is a definite if you are in the area.  Sandwiches are HUGE.  Translation: Don't go for the large unless you want more food than a human can possible ingest. 

I am a creature of habit and I usually get the chicken sandwich that is handwritten onto the menu on the very top.  Sometimes I stray and get the steak/cheese.  

This place is run down, old and even might be mistaken for dirty.  But, please don't let appearances fool you.  This place has good sandwiches.   It is a greasy spoon--nothing more.

And to the Yelp reviewers who are saying that Subway /Quiznos better needs to seriously evaluate why they like pressed meats over the real thing.
author: Katharine A.

description: This place is amazing; I need to get a sandwich from here at least once a week! Not only are the sandwiches made to order in a special way, they make French fries that are to die for! They slice the potatoes in thin circles and fry em up to a golden deliciousness! The sandwiches are so big but you can't waste a bite! The deli setting is cute and old school, very small and unique, the wall in the eating area is painted with all different kinds of sandwich making items and has all the old prices posted! The way the sandwiches are made is too good, toasted and melted cheese with a sauce they make there, writing about them makes me want to eat one right now!
author: Katie ..

description: I got the veal parm while my wife ordered the cheese steak. Veal parm was okay. Seasoned, breaded, massive amount of food, toasted bread. Cheese steak however was disappointing.  Kind of bland, like the meat wasn't marinated.  Would've given three stars however have to dock them for not having a bathroom. If you have a sit down area you should have a place to do your biz too. Luckily we stopped by Jamba juice before we had lunch. Anyway if you can drive another 10 to 15 min I'd rather go to the cheese steak shop on filmore for cheese steak (greasier, dirtier, and way delicious) or to the submarine center in west portal for subs in general. Parking is a beeyotch no matter where you go so you might as well eat well when you get there.
author: Danny L.

description:
Let me just start off by saying that I never thought that I'd write a review on Yelp. I used to sit in bed on boring nights and read people's reviews as a cheap source of entertainment - entertainment meaning laughing at people who actually think others really want to read their restaurant reviews. But here I am, writing a review, and it's because I would be doing the food gods a disservice to not give The Yellow Submarine 5 stars after eating there. Come along on an adventure with me.

I just moved into my new place in San Francisco a week ago and needed a quick bite to eat. I asked my roommates for some good places and they suggested TYS (is it ok to call it that?). So I went and got the hot pastrami sandwich with everything on it. I heart hot pastrami subs. So when I got mine, I was clearly ecstatic. Only one thing; I forgot to ask for the sandwich to come without mustard. I despise mustard. It was honestly my biggest fear for years. My friends threatened me with mustard to get me to do things. And it worked. Normally, I'd take the sandwich back and kindly ask for a new one, or, at the very least, a new bun. But I didn't want my first encounter with the lovely folks at TYS to end with them labeling me as a "no sandwich for you" guy, so I decided to stick it out and put my brave kid hat on. I took a bite, expecting the worst... But it was the complete opposite. All the flavors - the pastrami, the crisp lettuce, the fantastically grilled onions, the hot sauce (!!!), and the mustard (???) - blended perfectly to bring me the closest I've ever gotten to a food-induced schwing!!! moment. (A quick note on the hot sauce. Purely brilliant. Not crazy spicy but adds a fantastic kick to an already delicious sub.) Now, the next day I got a sandwich for lunch at work - not from TYS. And I specifically asked for mustard on it. 

I'll sum it up for you. Not only did TYS delivery a completely delicious sandwich that far exceeded the great expectations I had from the rave reviews from my roommates, but it completely changed my views on my most hated food in the world. If you go to (or live in) San Francisco and don't go to tYS, let me know so I can fight you.
author: Kevin G.

description:
Absolutely awesome sandwiches ... You'll never want to eat at another commercial chain sandwich shop again.

Get it with "The Works" ... There is major chemistry at work here, and the result is the tastiest sub around.
author: Doug L.

description: I go here twice a week but unfortunately I'm losing faith. The sandwiches are great the prices are just getting out of hand for what you get. Everytime I go I feel like I'm getting less steak in my steak and cheese sandwich.
author: Nathan D.

description: The bread is soft, but crunchy on the outside.  The sandwiches are delicious and I highly recommend getting the "fries" (or as I like to call them, "potato discs"). I'm definitely a fan of this place!  I didn't have a chance to try the hot sauce but my bf loved it.
author: Nic E.

description:
We split a large Italian combo and potato salad.  We were going for a hike so french fries seemed like a bad idea.  While the bread was really tasty even a couple of hours later, the sandwich was only ok.  Italian combo to me implied more than one kind of meat but I was wrong.  Guess I should have asked.  The potato salad tasted like the pre-packaged kind from Safeway so never again for that.

I'd be willing to try another sandwich sometime though.
author: Seong P.

description:
I like this place.  My boyfriend on the other hand LOVES this place.  Sometimes I ask him, "babe, if you had to choose between me and yellow sub, who would it be?".  And he laughs and says, "of course I'd choose you.".  

Lies. All lies. 

But I digress. The sandwiches are always delicious, and the house hot sauce makes me sweat.  But really, it's the fries that keep me coming back.  

Yellow Submarine is truly a gem.
author: Nina B.

description: 4.5 stars, I love this place.  If you're in a rush, call ahead for your order as the weekend lines can be a little long and everything is made to order.  Definitely try the turkey sandwich or the Italian pepper steak.  Fries are a must!  Seating isn't spacious or really clean, but it's not bad.
author: Kash S.

description: Tried the rueben sandwich and really enjoyed it. The meat and cheese and cooked up on a grill while the bread gets lightly toasted in an oven. The sandwich was served up hot and was more than I could eat for lunch. They do not carry any gluten free bread, but willingly made a rueben sandwich with a gluten free french roll that I brought with me. Great staff that bend over backwards to please their customers.
author: Jim H.

description:
I LOVE this place.  Best sandwich shop in the neighborhood, and one of the better ones in the city.  Friends of mine always go here when visiting my wonderful inner sunset neighborhood.  I usually get the steak and cheese sandwich and some fries (which are really homemade thick-cut chips with a good helping of salt and grease), but I have ventured off to other sandwiches and had great luck with all of them so far.

A word of advice: ALWAYS get the homemade hot sauce.
author: Shane C.

description: Decent food, would have given it 4 stars had there been a few less cockroaches on the wall while I places my order. Oh yeah don't take a small child that likes to run, there are no baby chair.
author: Ben S.

description: These subs were amazing!!!! My boyfriend and I took 2 subs to golden gate park for a picnic, I got the roast beef with the works, no vinegar, light mayo, provolone cheese and my boyfriend got the hot pastrami with the works, no hot sauce, swiss cheese. Both subs were amazing, best I have ever had especially for the amount of sub you get for the price (we got large subs ^.^). When ever I visit San Francisco again I will defiantly come back here for one of these sandwiches.
author: Melinda F.

description: The cheese'n'steak sandwich was out of this world! Perfect combination of meat and pickles with sauce wrapped in crusty french bread.
author: Alex B.

description:
Most fantastic sandwiches I've ever eaten. Whenever I go I always order a large pepper steak and split it with whoever happens to be with me. And plus the halves are pretty much the same size as a medium for practically half the price.

There was the one time I broke my nose though and I ate an entire large by myself out of sheer depression. Ah....good times.

And the fries! THE FRIES! These are possibly the best fries in the universe. I literally feel like I eat two whole potatoes deliciously prepared for my pleasure. And for only two bucks too!

Parkings a bitch but normally whenever I go I get lucky, so woot woot!
author: Veronica D.

description: Best subs in San Francisco. They also have awesome fresh cut circular fries. Awesome taste.
author: Myles F.

description:
This place seems like it's been around forever. I would consistently see lines out the door, but never went in to try this place. Well, over 20 years later I went in to give it a try yesterday for lunch.

It's a rather small hole in the wall restaraunt. The walls are covered in a pale yellow pain with a board with drawn pictures of their sandwich and menu from back in the days.

The sandwiches are large portioned but I think it's a better deal to split a large between 2 people. I ordered the steak and cheese with a side of french fries.

The sandwiches are decent for the price. All of them come with the usual works - mayo, mustard, lettuce, onion, tomatoes, pickels and hot sauce. The hot sauce is not too spicy but adds a nice kick to the sandwich.

The fries are cut like thick potato chips. They look quite appetizing but the taste is just ok. The edges are usually cispy and the inside of the chip is soggy or soft. They should just keep all the chips small so they all end up crispy.

I don't mean to be a snob, but this seems like typical food for college students. The sandwiches remind me of I.B. Hoagies in Berkeley when I used to go to CAL. My taste buds and palette  have expanded  much since then. 

Bottom line is the food is greasy, filling, and cheap. Sorry, not really worth a repeat unless you're in the mood for greasy food or on a budget..
author: Daniel L.

description:
HOAGIES!! 

I'm beginning to think that the only reason why I love Yellow Submarine is because it's 2 blocks away from my house. It is a great sandwich, don't get me wrong, but I've had better. I usually opt for the chicken sando with green peppers. It's good, and it will cure even the worst of hangovers (hot sauce is a huge plus). Fries are a big deal to me, and I just can't do their fries. They are so greasy!!!
author: Aviana B.

description: i love this place been coming here since i could barley look over the counter and now i have to drive six hours to get my favorite pastrami. the same great people are still serving the same great food i have never been disappointed here and hope you won't either.
author: Steve M.

description: Pretty great sandwiches. You can get a decent sized sub with the works for under $6. I tried the meatball sub with provolone. Fantastic! And they portions are humongous. I couldn't even eat half of mine. Consider sharing if you don't have a massive appetite.
author: Teresa G.

description: Great veal parm sub!  It's like I died and went back to Long Island!  Ask for the "special" hot sauce, so flavorful
author: Sean S.

description:
Hands down my favorite pastrami sandwich anywhere. 

I've had pastrami from various deli's in New York as well as many other places around the country and the the pastrami from Yellow Submarine beats all of them easily. It used to be I looked forward to heading to Togo's for my regular pastrami fix, but no longer. 

What makes the sandwiches here so great is the combination of grilling the meat and onions, toasting both on the bread, and then adding top quality toppings, especially their awesome home made hot sauce. Add in the killer hand cut potatoes that are fried while you wait and the result is phenomenal. A recipe for a heart attack for sure, but I may as well enjoy life while I can. 

The other sandwich I eat regularly is the pepper steak, which is great for all the same reasons as the pastrami. 

To add on top of the great sandwiches, I have to agree with the other yelp'ers that the service is super friendly and the prices are pretty darn good. 

My one suggestion would be to call in your order ahead of time as it does take 10 or more minutes for them to make your sandwich when they're busy at lunch time.
author: Chris S.

description: LOVE this place!! I wonder how they came up with such delicious ingredients! Get the chicken sandwich and you won't stop coming back.
author: Caitlin S.

description: Pretty good sandwich shop. I had the pepper steak sandwich and my girlfriend had the cheese steak. Both were pretty good. Make sure to get the homemade hot sauce as it makes a big difference. Fries were just okay and we're a little underdone. Overall very good quality meal
author: Matthew R.

description:
The Yellow Submarine is the place to go for anyone conflicted over what to eat while traversing through the Sunset.  At around $8 a sandwich, this is not what you would deem a bargain, but after having a sandwich with freshly prepared ingredients on perfectly toasted bread, the price will be a distant memory.

Standing and waiting while your sandwich ingredients are being prepared lets you soak in the divine aromas that you will yearn for later in the day.  My go-to sandwiches are the Steak & Cheese and Reuben.
author: Andrew M.

description: I got the steak and cheese with the home made potatoes. They are quite huge. I ate them while I was at home, which was a good thing since it was messy. Good and messy!
author: Mandy D.

description: Being a Philly native, I look for cheesesteak places. This is not a cheesesteak spot. But it's the closest thing that I've been able to find to an authentic cheesesteak taste. It's absolutely delicious. I'm NEVER disappointed here.
author: Veronica F.

description:
I'm not sure why I didn't have the greatest experience here. It might have been because the people who made the sandwiches didn't exactly give off a friendly feeling/care. (I came when it was about 30 min to closing and they were already giving a feeling of irritation as if they wanted to close early)

The sandwich was good I guess, but I feel like I've had better.

I ordered the Corned Beef sandwich and it was interesting to see that they grilled it with the onions and then put it on the toasted bread. 

Overall I've eaten at better places that take more love and care to making your sandwich, but it's still good compared to buying the sandwiches at some grocery place or something...
author: Michelle L.

description: The nicest family owned and operated business and they consistently turn out the most delicious sandwiches. You have to try the Italian combo with extra hot- hot sauce, you'll be hooked. I get an undeniable craving at least once a week. One more thing,their potato fries are yummy and always piping hot. Great service, great consistent food, need I say more!
author: Monica W.

description:
This has been one of the oldest sandwich shops in the Sunset, I've lived here for 28 years.  They make a really good Italian combo and a pastrami with grilled onions.

The secret to the sandwiches is to ask to have the house made hot sauce added in.

It's a nice place to get food to go, the one star missing is because it's not the cleanest place to eat at inside. =(

The workers are very nice and friendly.
author: Corbett L.

description:
I have had the Turkey Sandwich and the Pepper Steak Sandwich and I love them both. I love the "hole in the wall" atmosphere.
 If you happen to be in the area I recommend you stop by this joint.
 Prices: Excellent!
author: Luis C.

description:
I think I'm going to replace West Portal with The Yellow Submarine as my favorite sub shop.  Don't get me wrong, I still love my guys at West Portal Sub, but here are the reasons Yellow Sub is better:

- The bread is excellent
- The service is phenomenal 
- The sandwich has a better overall taste
- The cheese steak is done the true Philly way (sans the cheese wiz which is actually better)

My hats off to Yellow Submarine!
author: Kool B.

description:
Good bang for the buck. 

I like the turkey and the steak sandwiches. Good size, and price, convenient, and open late. 

For a neighborhood blue collar sandwich shop this is as good as it gets.
author: m c.

description:
I stumbled upon this gem post public transit venture on a beautiful afternoon. This is the epitome of your local sandwich shop, brimming with die-hard local customers around the clock. I must say I tried to tone-down the fact that I was an "outsider" and quietly joined the lengthy line as if I belonged.

The subway sandwiches are on massive French rolls and are loaded-up with subway sandwich goodness. They put hot sauce on the sandwiches as a standard condiment--- I was new to this but have to admit I've added Tapatio to my homemade sandwiches since my inaugural visit. 

The place is constantly crowded so I suggest stealing away with just a select friend for a sandwich rendezvous. Hire your friend to stake-out a table as there are limited seats in the place. Hang in there-- the food is well worth the battle.

Potatoes are my weakness and boy, this place saves the day! They have these french fry/potato chip hybrid bits of deliciousness that NEED to be included in your order. They are perfectly cooked (although I have never had them before, so what do I know?) and compliment the massive and satisfying deli sandwiches. 

It's a lather, rinse, and repeat sort of place. You will go there, enjoy it, and continue going there until you blend in with the rest of the masses.
author: Monique V.

description:
Ahh yes, The Yellow Submarine is yet another gem right in the heart of the Inner Sunset. These are some really great sandwiches.

I have their phone number saved in my phone so I can call in my orders and skip on over. 

I would always pass by the sandwich shop on the corner with curiosity until one day some friends introduced to some seriously savory sandwiches. I've been here twice since.
