The Salami is to die for and the Pastrami is just mouthwatering. The sandwiches are HUGE and are so cheap! Oh, and the fries. You can't skip on the fries, trust me.
The place is tiny, you may have to wait a little while because they're usually pretty busy but it's worth it. I also love the two older women that run the joint every once in a while; they've got it under control.

Try it!
author: Denise S.

description: Great sandwich shop. nothing too fancy, just simple sandwiches done well.. will definitely be going back!
author: Jesi G.

description:
I'm always torn between steak & cheese sandwich or the avocado one (which always has generous amounts of amazingly perfectly sliced & ripe avocados). 

They're great for catering for large groups- followed the requests for individually wrap half-sandwiches.
author: steph c.

description:
This is a Boston style sub place in the Inner Sunset.  Don't go here looking for veggies.  Don't ask for avocado on your sub (do avocados grow on the east coast? no.)   Questions you should ask yourself:  Steak and Cheese -- what kind of cheese?  Corned beef sub -- do you want the home made hot sauce?  Would you like fries with your sandwich?

Generally go for the medium sandwich as it's perfectly big enough.  Try the home made hot sauce if you get a chance.  That's it!
author: Mister G.

description: First and last time for me to order sandwiches here. I ordered a medium pastrami and 2 large turkey sandwiches to go. So disappointed with the nonexistent meat. I even told them it was my first time trying them, you would think they would want a return customer, guess not!  I should have went to Roxie's only a few blocks away who never disappoint.
author: Regina G.

description: The sandwiches are good, but take some time to cook up. The guy who takes your order can be a little pushy. He tried to get me and my friend to order the "chips", which weren't chips so much as round french fries? Thick, soggy, greasy, and not that flavorful. The sandwiches are still good though, so i don't have many complaints. We usually just grab and go to a bar. Pepper steak sandwich + a cold beer? It's on.
author: Phuong M.

description:
After the gym and dropping off my car for an oil change, my homie and I needed some lunch. We first decided on Ikes but it was getting late and it would probably be super crowded so we went to a more local spot. I mentioned the Submarine Sandwich shop but he brought me to the Yellow Submarine sandwich shop. I was referring to the one on Ulloa.

Anyways, the sandwich I had was the Italian Steak Sub. It was alright for a last minute change of plans. we also ordered the fries which were cool. its basically a fresh potato chip. We came right before the lunch rush so we got our sandwiches relatively quick. other than that, its really nothing to write home about. I still think Freddy's Sandwiches in North Beach has the best sandwiches in SF and The Marina Sub Shop for submarine sandwiches.
author: Gordon L.

description: Just went here once. Super impressed. They were out of the meatball but the gentleman who helped me was quick to offer his recommendations. I got the Ruben and I'm so glad I listened to him! Absolutely wonderful sandwich. I highly recommend checking this place out.
author: Kayla D.

description:
The place looks pretty big from the outside but I guess most of the space went to the kitchen.

The sandwich was alright, I had the pastrami and I cant really say much about it. It had all the qualities of a normal toasted sandwich. I didnt get that feeling of wanting to devour it fast...it was just like munch munch munch. 

When I actually think about it overall, this place is a 2.5 but i'll give them the extra half..maybe next time it will taste better.
author: phillip w.

description: These classic sandwiches are absolutely delicious! I always phone order a Hot Pastrami with the works while downtown waiting for the N-Judah, and by the time I hop off at 7th & Irving it's warm and ready to eat.
author: Duane S.

description:
San Fran has its fair share of excellent sandwich shops (Ike's Place is still tops for me). And while Yellow Sub might be up there in some cities, I'm afraid it's not up to SF standards. 

I ordered a large Hot Pastrami. It was definitely large, but the quality was lacking. The meat seemed cheap, and had that iridescent sheen to it that to me indicates low-quality beef. The toppings and bread were decent--a but not much better than Quiznos or Subway.

It satisfies your appetite but not much more. 

Cash only!
author: David Z.

description:
This place is great.  As far from Subway as you can get and these guys were toasting sandwiches long before Quizno's was in the game.

The large is HUGE and I generally am quite satisfied with a half-size along with a side of those fantastic fries/chips.  One of the few places that I know of whose fries are sliced potato "chips" sent through the fryer.  It's refreshing to have these instead of the same old fry.

The guys here are always super nice and they are very attentive to your sandwich topping requests...unlike the dorks working at Subway who are only thinking about what time there shift ends.  Seriously how many times do you have to watch-dog those "Sandwich Artists" with your toppings.  ADD in effect.

If you like a good sub, go here.  If you don't well then suck it.
author: Josh L.

description: Pepper steak with lettuce and avocado very good. Large size is huge. "Fries" were ok and different.
author: Duke A.

description:
This is my favorite sub place in the city. Screw the long line and expensive sandwich at Ike's Place! That place is crap compared to yellow submarine!  Yellow sub has friendly employees, a big selections of subs that are inexpensive.
If you go here be sure to order the Italian sausage sub with everything on it. AND don't forget the french fries. 
If you order a large be sure to share it with someone.
author: Vespa Fox C.

description: Best sandwiches in town. It's very small so it gets backed and busy fast.   Get there early..  order by phone for pick up it's your best bet.
author: Randy T.

description:
its a nice little sandwich shop with the regular sandwiches. 
so far i tried their turkey sandwich and their steak and cheese sandwich they were both very good but really nothing special. 

if you are hungry you will get stuffed because their sandwiches are HUGE!!  the large sandwich is actually big enough to split between two people. 

i tried their sliced fried potatoes which were pretty bomb but i wouldn't recommend taking them to go because they get soggy and stick together, so enjoy them when they are fresh and crispy. 

the guys who make your food seem very friendly but the guy at the register (most likely the owner) is not very friendly and has no manners what so ever! every time i've been here he's always taking my order and never really looks at me. he is always eyeing others in line or looking everywhere else. i think thats super rude.
author: Diana s.

description: I wish there were more veggie options, but I do love the avocado sandwich. The bread is warm and toasty and I love the hot sauce. best to call in your order because it's a neighborhood favorite and busy
author: Sky B.

description:
I gave this place another chance and ordered the avocado sandwich with homemade hot sauce (recommended by a friend). It was really really good for a vegetarian sandwich. Next time, I'm going to get the cheese steak with homemade hot sauce. It's all about the sauce, so true. 

But I still think the bread is just too big.
author: Xiaoyin W.

description:
So, this place was described to me as one of the best subs in the area. Little did I know there was a Pluto's right down the way.

This place is alright. But not anything to freak out about. Go to Pluto's down the street. You will enjoy it better.
author: Jason C.

description: I moved away years ago, but still go back whenever I can. My regular...a large cheese combo with hot sauce and fries (added avocado if I really want to go all out). Their sandwiches are unreal and I love the woman who's worked there forever. I really can't think of a comparable sandwich shop. Anyone who thinks the staff here can be rude is just ridiculous. Be nice to them and you'll get a great sandwich. Be impatient with them and you'll still get a great sandwich, but you'll just look like a jerk.
author: Jeff G.

description:
These sandwiches are very yummy! They're not cheap (about 8$ for a large pastrami), but they're big. If you don't eat a ton Yellow Submarine is great if you want to share a half with a friend (which is more than enough for one person), but a little expensive if you're alone. Then again if you dig leftovers this could be great. 

My personal favorite is the pastrami, but the steak with cheese and peppers isn't half bad either. Also try their potato fries!

It's cash only, and I never seem to have cash, which is the only reason why I gave it four stars instead of five.
author: Ash S.

description: As far as Sandwiches under $10 go, this is one of my all-time favorites. They are consistently good and filling. Don't even think of getting a large, unless you plan to keep the 2nd half for later. This place is always full of blue collar guys with work boots, dust or paint on their clothes, and maybe a hard hat or two. I overheard 3 of them saying they shouldn't have ordered so much!  They took the bag of chips to go. I always get the Cheese and Avocado with no mayo, extra hot sauce. Agree with others that the homemade hot sauce isn't going to knock your socks off hot, but it's packed full of flavor in a vinegar? base.  The fries are different, and not what I like. After all with a sub full of veggies and cheese, I don't need them anyway. Good call if you want a quick non-burrito bite on this side of town.
author: Kat T.

description:
Solid sandwiches have become perennial favorites over the years. An order of the too die for whole-sliced fries are a must plus you gotta love The Beatles theme. 

Italian combo or meatball sub with everything on it and you can't go wrong.
author: Matt P.

description:
Fantastic huge subs for cheap. Very simple, but tasty flavor.  Meat is fresh off the grill. Their fries are really good with big thick potato cuts; that actually look like from a potato.

As a guy. This was a very filling meal for $8.
author: Roger Z.

description:
The Yellow Submarine is the perfect place to grab a huge sandwich that can fill you and your significant other up for $8. Order a sandwich then just walk over to eat at GG park! The Inner Sunset, specifically around the 9th and Irving area doesn't really have great places to grab sandwiches, so this place is awesome for that reason. 

I wouldn't recommend eating there, unless you can get past the smell of bleach while you eat. Each time I've walked in to order a sandwich I've noticed the strongest stench of bleach lurking. Just the other day I looked around a bit and noticed they keep a bucket of water with bleach right next to the register to clean the tables I'm guessing. That explains it! 

I recommend getting "the works" on your sandwiches. Their homemade hot sauce adds a nice hint of spice to any sandwich. The potatoes are quite oily and can get soggy fast, so either don't order them or just make sure to eat them right away!
author: Junia I.

description: I tried the pastrami sandwich and it was pretty avg at best.  The fries were good though as it is freshly cut and fried.  Guess i came with too high expectations from other reviews but they cant beat submarine center or other sandwich spots in the city.
author: Hugh L.

description:
Good neighborhood sandwich shop. Considering most eateries in Inner Sunset suck (except Sandy's on 9th!), this place is great if you're in the mood for a sandwich.

In some ways, it's like a simplified version of Ike's Place without the stupidly long lines and bewilderingly long menu. What you see up on the menu board is what you get. I like that keep-it-simple approach.

It helps that their sandwiches are satisfying. I enjoy their corned beef or pastrami sandwiches, and sometimes their Reuben if I ever feel the need to medicate myself with a calorie bomb.

The fried potato can be good, when it's fried properly. Unfortunately, it can be inconsistent, resulting in soggy, oily chips or even worse, overcooked, brown and bitter. If they can get their act together on their deep fryer, their chips would rule.
author: Bono B.

description: The definition of hole in the wall. But was very impressed. I have eaten at pretty much every sandwich place in SF and Yellow Sub is top 5. Great quality to price ratio.
author: Matt Z.

description: Best sub sandwich place in the city.  My favorite sandwich is the avocado sandwich.  Their sandwiches are huge and I can rarely finish the medium sized one but I have seen people take down the larges without a problem.   I also enjoy their fries (more like potato slices) from time to time.  They are really good and you get a good amount so you can definitely get one to share if you're there with someone else.
author: Annabelle K.

description: I try the tuna sandwich . It was delicious ! I love the bread, served  warm, great size for a good price. Clean place, friendly service.
author: Karen P.

description:
I've been coming to this place since i was  wet behind the ears.  Hands down this is the best place for a pepper steak sandwich. I have yet to find a place to prove me wrong. And the natural cut fries, how can you go wrong.

The only thing that sucks, no bathroom.
author: Ness C.

description: I went in there with a friend today. He ordered the pastrami, I ordered the avocado. Boy were they good. We ate half of it there and ate the other half for dinner, and that was a medium size. Something about the sauce they put on the sandwich. Wow! I can't wait to go back.
author: Clare H.

description:
Hot!!!  Fresh Breads!!! Great hot sauce!!! Easy to get to!!!

DA BOMB!!!!!
author: Wayne B.

description: THE PASTRAMI!!!!!!!!! SWEET LORD!!!!! All of the sandwiches are absolutely SPECTACULAR!!!!! so enough gushing. In all seriousness, and I take the craft of sandwich making very seriously, this place makes a great sandwich. A very simple menu of hot sandwiches, covering all the major sellers. The pastrami and the pepper steak are both very good. They also make a very good house hot sauce which is wonderfully flavorful, as well as being quite hot. A must for sandwich lovers.
author: Thomas E.

description:
Mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm

I saw this place on Check Please! Bay Area and I've always kind of wanted to try it...so I did! With my friend. It's so unsuspecting too. A little tiny corner to order, and some places to sit, but MASSIVE AMOUNTS OF FOOD. No really, for the price you pay, and the amount you get is so much. I mean, I normally finish all of my food, and today I was starving after having walked around the Cal-Acad (not to mention the waiting in line) for over 2 hours - and I still couldn't finish the sandwich. 

And will someone please tell me where you can find a potato that size? Mutant potatoes up in here...shit...
author: Dustin H.

description:
Stay hungry. Stay foolish. Try every sandwich you can.

At the very least, you must try the fries. They are like a softer, fleshier version of potato chips. Very fresh, very mushy and very good with ketchup. I recommend sharing an order with a friend or two, because they give you a LOT of these encapsulated heart attacks.

I had the medium cheese combo with avocado, which is enough food to either keep you very fat or feed you for two days. I chose the latter, because apparently I don't need the extra help when it comes to conserving flesh.

My jaw still aches from chewing the bread. Seriously. That is one thick, chewy roll. I had to take a few jaw massage breaks just to make it through half the sandwich. In fact, I googled "self-massage jaw techniques" BECAUSE of this sandwich.

The sammich was good, but it didn't quite hit the spot. I did appreciate the generous portions of avocado (so I didn't feel shafted for paying extra), the hole-in-the-wall air and the Rico Suave cashier who affirmed all of my sandwich choices with a "Very good!" However, my search for the perfect sub continues.

Stimulating the economy, one sandwich at a time.
author: J P.

description: Wow dynamite sandwich!!! If you're in the neighborhood, you can't go wrong with this sandwich spot.  After finishing I was licking my fingers trying to get every little bit of the dressing sauce (vinegar, mustard, hot sauce mixture...mmm).  I wish this place was in the Mission, as I'd be there every weekend (feedback to owners: open a spot in the Mission, it'll be a winner).  If not, I guess I'll be putting miles on my car to pick up a sandwich.  Nice jobs guys, great sandwiches!!!
author: Bhavesh M.

description: This place is a staple for me, been coming here with my Dad since I was six.  Always soft and crunchy and best if eaten right away.  Great people running this place for years, all is good.
author: Chuck L.

description:
Good God do I love this place!  Its been a favorite for years so its about time I wrote a review.  The service is good, the same people are working everyday so you always see a familiar face.  But honestly, the service is not why I'm writing this review....

The subs are out of this world.  If you want a complicated fancy sandwich, just go somewhere else because this is not what Yellow Submarine is about.  The Yellow Submarine does a simple sandwich right.  All of the food they use is of good quality and you can taste it from the first bite.  The sandwiches aren't sloppily thrown together, but made with care by serious sub professionals. Really, this is the way a sandwich was supposed to taste before Subway came along and ruined the simple sub's reputation.  Every bite of Yellow Submarine is a fantastic experience.  I really just cannot talk it up enough.  Just go try it.  

Heads up: seriously, no matter how hungry you are, do NOT get a large.  Their regular size is actually enormous.  I don't know anyone who could eat even a whole regular size.  Also, just get the works... don't complicate it.  Its just perfect as it was intended.  (Although I do ask for it without hot sauce at times, if you're a noob, just get the works).       

Vegetarians, order the Avocado Sub.  Its a sandwich wet-dream come true.
author: Justine K.

description:
I know The Yellow Submarine has probably been around for a long time, but I just recently saw it on Check, Please! and decided to try it out. I really do love a good sandwich. Even though I try to make them at home, it's just never the same. 

So Eugy and I came here and got some sandwiches to take with us to sneak into the Sundance Kabuki. I opted for the meatball sub with extra cheese and onions. Eugy had the hot pastrami with everything on it and the extra spicy sauce. 

My meatball sub was mediocre at best. The sauce had NO FLAVOR at all and was in desperate need of salt. The meatballs were ok, but nothing to get excited over. Eugy said his pastrami was ok, but again, nothing to get really excited over. 

Pop's Sandwich shop still has the best meatball grinder in my opinion. And Sub Center has the best subs. Especially the turkey. Yum!
author: Jen D.

description:
Yellow Submarine's sandwiches are like crack--they are that AMAZING! I haven't tried anything else except the steak and cheese because seriously, that sandwich is literally made to perfection. *drools* I usually order a medium because that is enough for my stomach. The large is HUGE! I always split the large amount of fries, which are greasy slices of potatoes, with someone. Definitely one of my favorite spots to go to!

The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because they need to expand the dining area! There are only a handful of tables and the room is literally the size of my living room. The last time I was there, I felt like I had to whisper to my boyfriend. I didn't want other people to "ear-hustle" on my conversations!
author: Rosanne C.

description:
I go here from time to time because it's a short walk from work.  I used to pass by this place often but never ate here until maybe college.  Since then, it's been one of my closeby lunch options when I wake up late and there's no food at home.

I've come to realize that the only sandwich I really like here is the pastrami.  The last couple of times here I tried the pepper steak and the roast beef.  They were both okay.  I think there's a little too much bread and not enough meat compared to other sandwich places.  But really, you can't go wrong with pastrami.  I just think with a little more meat the sandwiches would be better (more meat does not always mean better).  Even though the bread can be too thick, they're nicely toasted most of the time.  I haven't tried the other options, so maybe there's something else on the menu I would like as well.  

I seem to always get the 'fries'.  Really.  Almost always.  I go in there thinking,"Okay, I'm just going to get a sandwich.  No fries"
...
"Hi, what would you like?"
"I'll have a regular pastrami, everything but onions."
"Okay...would you like fries with that?
"Yes, and an Orangina/Orange n' Cream, please."

Argh no willpower whatsoever.  Not even a pause.

They're not actually fries, but more like fried thick potato slices.  But the people there call it fries.  I like them, but one order to me is too much for just myself.  There are well over 15 large slices in an order.  By the time I'm halfway through, it's kind of a chore to finish.  I think sharing it with another would be perfect though.

If I'm craving for a sandwich during a lunch break, this is the place for me.  And I will be there with my pastrami sandwich, drink, and an order of fries.
author: Oliver C.

description:
So I've only been here once, but it's enough to not go back.  After ordering, I watched the elderly woman construct my sandwich.  Here's the part that earns them 1 star.  

The woman is about the apply something from a squirt bottle to the sandwich but there's that crusty part on the tip that blocks the squirt.  So the lady wipes the crusty cap, like the dried up ketchup on the tip, on my bread.  ON MY BREAD!!!  So I get a sandwich with what looks like a dried up belly button that just fell off a newborn smeared on my sandwich.  If they do this in front of customers, what do they do when we're not looking?
author: Bruce B.

description:
Sub sandwiches are quick to make, tasty, and filling.  All of which make sandwiches almost ideal for someone on the go.  But what makes a  sub "boston-style"??  

Answer:  I'm not entirely sure...but after eating at this sandwich spot, they must taste very good and be verrrryyy filling.

I had the chance to stop by for lunch today and was not disappointed in ANY way.  I ordered a medium steak and cheese with fries on the side.  What came out of their kitchen was what seemed like an everest of meat and cheese all over toasted french bread stuffed with "the works", all of their default add-ons, and on the side was a heaping basket of fried potato slices.  Long story short:  the food was really good.  The quality and serving size seemed more than reasonable for the ~$9 I spent.  I will definitely be back for more of the menu in the near future.

It's better than subway!.... (might be exagerating on some levels; I mean, $5 subs are really good deals...)
author: Julian A.

description:
So when I watch football with "the guys" I am pretty much forced to get Yellow Sub for lunch, unless I want to be "that girl" who comes to football with "the guys" and can't hang with their "man food". I'll admit, I am not a big sandwich person. 

So I tried the steak and cheese one. The steak isn't "steak" it's more like ground beef with tons of onion/peppers in it. No thank you. 

Medium (aka "regular") is a filling size for a girl. The large is a super filling size for a man. 

The works has all kinds of man things on it, like mustard and peppercinis and pickles and hot sauce and oil and vinegar. 

Their fries are actually homemade chips. They are good but sometimes too soggy. 

I HIGHLY recommend calling ahead and then just picking up. They have a full menu online and be ready to spit out your order quick and with the proper lingo. (i.e. I'd like a regular turkey with lettuce, tomato, cheese ONLY, a large italian with the works, and 2 orders of fries.)

Somehow asking for a large Italian with the works, is fun. 

ps- There is only one kind of bread. 
pps- If I was a man, this would be a 5 star review. But these subs are just too macho for this girl.
author: Ali R.

description:
This is probably the only thing I miss about living in the Inner Sunset. Fortunately, it's only a short N-Judah ride away from downtown (at least in theory. It is the Muni afterall...).

Their sandwiches are made with so much love and care. It's almost painful to eat them since they're such beautiful works of art!

Anyway, one of my favorite sandwich shops I've ever been to. Definite mom and pop feel to it.
author: Dave S.

description:
Recipe for a lazy Sunday afternoon (preferably a sunny one): stuff a bottle of wine into your backpack, pick up a large Italian Combo at Yellow Submarine, walk over to the arboretum, lay out a blanket on the meadow, eat, drink, peruse the pink Datebook to keep up the facade that *next* weekend you'll actually go do something exciting, then give in to the inevitable temptation for a nap.

Really, I don't know how you could stay awake if you ate the large sandwich by yourself.  And that pillowy bread it comes on: easy to bite through, thus reducing messiness, and practically melts in your mouth...makes me realize that in my fanaticism for Dutch Crunch I've been missing out on the full spectrum of sandwich vessels.  Now if only they had dyed it yellow.
author: Wes M.

description:
In my active pursuit to re-embrace my amazing city and try out new places in my 'hood, I decided that today was the perfect day to hit up The Yellow Submarine, seeing as though I've heard nothing but fantastic things from several loyal patrons AND it just so happened that on this particular day, I was craving a freshly made sammich.

Mmmm... my sammie did not disappoint.  I opted for a Medium Turkey and Provolone and as for the fixins, I got the works -- sans the hot sauce -- and it was delightfully delicious.

I'm definitely coming back, though next time, I'm getting the hot sauce.
author: Katie C.

description:
So I finally tried this place after a friend declared it her favorite place in SF! Not being a big fan of sandwiches it wouldn't have been my first choice of cuisine. But it would be fair to say I'm now a fan of Yellow Subs. 

I had the steak and cheese which was very good. The bread is toasted but still remains soft in the center. The meat and onions are grilled to order. It was very tasty. I especially liked how  the used jus the right amount of oil and vinegar. 

Unfortunately, at the time I went the were changing the oil and could make the fries. I would definitely go back to try the chicken and fries.
author: Marissa P.

description: First introduced to these sandwhiches when I was probably like...what? 7? Love at first bite. Eating these sandwhiches are a treat for me since only my dad knows where this place is since I'm too lazy to go drive around looking for it. But yah, never lets me down.
author: Tina T.

description:
Yellow Subs is one of the spots on Irving I've been meaning to try for the past couple of months.

Today was the day.

I had an Italian Combo sub and an order of fries. It was all tasty, hot and fresh, but for whatever reasons my socks are still on.

I might go back, but with so many other Yelpable options within Yelping distance, it may be a while before I do.
author: Jason R.

description: No frills, a line _and_ still 5 stars? Yeah, it  is that good. Best subs in SF by a mile. Call ahead and it can be fast.
author: Bob R.

description:
for years i've been a subway lover. it always smells so good and inviting in a subway and you certainly know exactly what you're getting into.  The addition of both the $2.99 6inch daily specials and the $5 footlong only sweetened my love affair with the 'way....that is, until I was introduced to the yellow submarine.

a couple friends and i had quite the saturday last weekend....it was gorgeous out and we decided to make a stop for a sammy and froyo(review coming later) on our way to ocean beach.  My roommate had heard about the yellow sub so we decided to try it.  As we rolled up the first thing i noticed was the LOOOOONG LINE! Holy moly.  Good thing it went fast and i was ordering subs in about 7 minutes.  I got the small (seriously the thing was huge, i only could eat half) with turkey, lettuce, swiss, mayo(i'm not very creative with the subs, i'll admit it) and also ordered a large steak and cheese with everything plus hot sauce, hold the pickles for my friend.  I think the total came to 16$ or so? pretty reasonable if you ask me, especially if i had known i'd get two meals out of the small sandwich!

after getting our numbers we headed down to the wishbone to get some throwback candy and thank you cards.

about fifteen minutes later we got two piping hot sammys and were ready to chow.  HOLY MOLY are they good! the bread is fantastic, perfectly toasted and just a little salty/oily on the top.  they load them sandwiches up with meats and condiments and, as mentioned heartily, you certainly get a bang for your buck here!

it's a nice walk or a short N-judah ride from my apartment to
author: Brooke M.

description:
As a former East Coaster, it seems as if I am on a never-ending quest to find a sandwich better than the ones that I used to eat regularly.  Sadly, I have yet to complete my search, but this place does come very close.
This is a very old sandwich place in the Inner Sunset, which has very good sandwiches.  Anytime I go a place that has great reviews, I either get the Reuben or the Cheesesteak.  The Reuben here was very, very good.  Probably the best I have had in the City.  The turkey is also well made and they don't put so much mayo and mustard on it you lose the taste of turkey.  I like that.
I have not ordered the Cheesesteak because I hate eating them when they are not properly made.  People think I am weird, but you can't have any cheese other than Cheese-Whiz on them; it's just wrong.  Unfortunately, no one here on the West Coast follows that ideology.  Hopefully, I can begin to convert others to follow the true way and have an actual Philly Cheesesteak.
In the meantime, I will be more than happy to "settle" for this place's fantastic Reubens.  If I have to settle for those, then I'm doing all right.
author: Shawn B.

description:
This place is so yummy i love the bread and everything else in between in the bread. I had the pastrami sandwich and it was (in the words of rachel ray, Yummo) hehehe I just wished that they put a little more meat . Love the fried potato slices too even though it was very greasy it was great!
The young man that took my order is very nice and the old lady was very cute.
Can't wait to go back. hummm maybe tomorrow.
author: zoey x.

description: Are you kidding me, yelpers? This is a classic sub shop delivering tasty and large subs. Make sure to get something hot, like the pastrami with peppers. An excellent hangover meal. However, parking is tough and there is usually a wait :(
author: Edmund C.

description: I was craving a sandwich & after reading great Yelp reviews I headed to Yellow Submarine. I chose 2 different subs to split with a friend so that we could try 2. :) The guy at the counter was very helpful and directed me towards their most popular options. I left with the pastrami, Philly cheese steak and an order of their deep fried potatoes. Yum! The pastrami was my favorite while the Philly didn't seem to have enough cheese for my liking. However, both were very flavorful! The potatoes were crispy and greasy deep fried goodness. Not something you could eat everyday but oh so good!! I will definitely return! :)
author: Angie D.

description:
Since, I've been wanting to try this place out for awhile, I was ready to eat, so I went with two subs!  And based on the Yelp reviews, I was confident I wouldn't get screwed over.  I already knew I wanted the hot pastrami.  For the second sub I was considering the steak and cheese.  But a couple of people ahead of me ordered the pepper steak, so I went with that.

You can tell them to make it the works and they'll throw everything into those bad boys.  You get a choice from one of the three cheeses; cheddar, swiss and provolone. And to top it off, you can have them put hot sauce.  I wasn't feeling the hot sauce at the time, so I decided not to go with that.  Hmm, a mistake?  Man, these are some solid, good tasting subs.

The pepper steak was pretty tasty. It had a good amount of meat, but I was hoping for a little more flavor.  Maybe I should of went with the hot sauce!

The pastrami on the other hand was delicous.  Yes, the pastrami is shredded just the way I like it.  It's heavy on black pepper which was nice.  My only gripe was that they didn't throw more pastrami into my sub.  So, this pastrami sammy is just a notch below Submarine Center's sub.

The best part of Yellow Submarine's sandwiches is that they gave me an option to include sauteed onions with my subs.  Heck Yes...  Those onions really made the pastrami that much more flavorful.

Solid 4 stars.
author: Sam T.

description:
Yellow Sub has been an Inner Sunset fixture for as long as I can remember. Delicious! They grill your meat and onions up and put it on a delicious, freshly toasted bun of goodness! The chips are amazing. Don't forget the vinegar!

The ladies are not even close to friendly. They glare at you as if they wish they could attack you with their spatula if you don't hurry up. Be very deliberate and precise with your order and you will fare better. 

Fuck Quiznos and their hot water dipped meat! Viva La Yellow Submarine!
author: Chris E.

description:
Family-run business with friendly guys, sweet old ladies and kick ass homemade spicy chili sauce.  Seriously, it's tasty, but not as flaming hot as the lady tries to warn you.

They do the Boston-style subs, which I guess just means that they toast the bread and cheese in the oven first (which is a definite feature).  I think it is the best place in the I.S. hood to get a sub (or hoagie or grinder or hero sandwich if you prefer), and all of the ingredients seem fresh and clean.

They have good combo deals to add a soda and a bag of chips or potato salad, and their fries are fresh, crisp and hot.  I wish we could all live in a Yellow Submarine.  Shit, that was a cheesy closing.
author: Quinn S.

description: SO GOOD. I would eat the chicken and cheese sandwich every day- if I had the metabolism of a humming bird. It's amazing. that's pretty much all I have to say. However, it's a sandwich shop, not a french fry shop. Skip the fries they are kinda bland.
author: Ruairí W.

description:
It's shocking how good this place is.  Although it has the look of a building that should have collapsed in '89, and the ceiling is a little claustrophobic  they serve up some freshly made, warm, full of love sandos.

It does take a little longer than your standard sandwich but that's because they're adding the love and melting that delicious cheese all over your sourdough.  

Last time I was in, I got the impression this place is owned and run by a family, as I watched some older woman yelling at some cook/cashier.  

Do your taste buds a favor, never eat at subway again, also visit the Yellow Submarine.
author: jack p.

description:
You won't be disappointed by any of the sandwiches here! (I would def recommend the pastrami)

Get the "fries" which are medium to thick sliced potatoes... mmmmm. 

There's not a ton of room to sit inside, but the park is just down the street, so you can always get it to go. You can also call ahead of time to order your sandwich... which might be a good idea around lunch time. 

You walk in and order your sandwich straight away, then you can take a seat or just lean and wait (if there's not a line). They're totally cool there. 

There's plenty to do right around there on Irving, so take a stroll around too, it's a fun neighborhood.
author: Christina T.

description:
Scratch that, this place is disgusting. I stopped in last week and was absolutely HORRIFIED at the conditions. They used the same knife to cut my avocados and another person's turkey, then shoved that same knife through both sandwiches without washing it once. They did everything by hand, without gloves or even a rinse in the nonexistent sink. They toasted my sandwich in a grimy oven on a tray that was encrusted in baked-on, unidentifiable _crap_.

I wound up just leaving my seven-dollar grimewich sitting on a trash can. I think it felt at home there.
author: Liz A.

description:
Guys, you eat enough of these Nautilus, sized sandwiches and you ain't gonna be able to see your periscope any more.

Man the torpedoes though, they make some hulla good heroes here.
author: GIR ..

description: huge portion, delicious food. i always get the italian steak and its good every time! only complaint: cash only...
author: Louis O.

description:
Not the best but pretty damn good. I ate lunch here after my comics run from Amazing Fantasy and devoured myself a Large Italian Combo which consisted of tons of ham and salami with everything on it. Meaty, heavy and satisfying. 

A nice alternative to Crepevine, Pluto's and Naan & Curry and not nearly as crowded.
author: Jordan A.

description: This place is AWESOME!! I've tried their pepper steak, reuben, pastrami, and tuna sandwiches.  The bread is toasted -- warm and crunchy.  All the sandwiches are prepared to order and are huge & filling.  You can watch them throw the pepper steak on the grill... The meat is yummy.  Tuna is decent and doesn't have much mayonnaise at all.  Their fries are shaped like potato chips, soo tasty and addicting! Family owned place, the staff is friendly here!  Cute little dining area, with old prices and menus painted on the wall!
author: Tramy V.

description:
Not great for vegetarians. I had a sandwhich without the avocado because it makes my mouth itchy and it was basically a bun, mayo, a slice of american cheese, and lettuce. I could have made that at home. I also felt sick after.

BUT that is only for vegetarians- I'm sure the others are AMAZING. Sigh.
author: J P.

description:
This place only gets 4 stars because I really like the subs. They are baked in a real oven, not some "easy bake" variety that Quiznos uses. My sub was toasty and everything was nicely melted. Just thinking about it makes me want to take a stroll down there.

Ok, the down side. The store is pretty bad. The ordering/pickup counter area leaves you about a 3x3' area to stand. It's like being in a small shower and if there is a line it's a mess. I wasn't sure if I should go outside and I hope to hear when my order was ready, or to go into the crazy, fly infested "dining room".

So, when I go back I hope there won't be a crowd and I will always be getting the subs to go.
author: Andrew M.

description:
My favorite sandwiches in town. Great homemade hot sauce, fresh bread and hearty portions. I love how they don't cut the bread roll completely so the contents don't fall out as the sandwich is being eaten. They're thoughtful like that. 

Their fries are phenomenal. 

This place is also great for feeding large groups. I needed to feed a group of 35 and was able to put in the order the day before around 5p. The next day, I had to add 20 extra last minute sandwiches and changed up an order or two to account for allergies. Jack was very accommodating and flexible with my order changes and at a very reasonable price! Thanks guys. You're the best!

*cash only, FYI
author: Frances R.

description:
In my 30 some years of sandwich (hoagie) eating I do not think I have ever ordered a whole (large) sandwich. We decided, in our state of unemployment, to share a Yellow Submarine and asked them to cut it in 4 so we could nosh while relaxing in GG Park. Man, what a sandwich! We had turkey and swiss with all the toppings, perfect meld of condiments and amazing tomatoes! 
The cashier is really friendly and good at the upsell, there is also an older lady that has apparently been working the magic in the kitchen for decades! 
Make sure to get the house made hot sauce...mmmm!
author: Colleen B.

description: all i can say is get the pepper steak sandwich! that's what i order every time i go there. If you like it spicy ask for the homemade hot sauce and you will not be disappointed. Definitely my go to sandwich shop :)
author: Faten M.

description: this place is awesome love it steak sandwich and fries are crazy good. perfect in every way. its a cool sandwich shop.
author: Robert C.

description:
this place is quite good for a quick sit-down sandwich. i'd recommend the steak and cheese. i tried the pepper steak which is quite similar but the former is def better! staff is pretty nice and price is reasonable. 
just a 5 min walk from ucsf campus, which is convenient.
author: Joyce B.

description: Some amazing subs on their menu. The meatballs are made in house everyday. Order the medium sandwich, the thing's HUGE!
author: Mark S.

description: I'm a sandwich fiend, so when I went in for the first time I was so happy. It's not your upscale sandwich spot but if you want legit subs and the best fries (cut like chips) of your life then you need to make it out to this place.
author: Vic R.

description:
They have the best subs I've ever had. End of story.

Quizno's can't even hold their bread.

Nothing more needs to be said.
author: Patrick N.

description:
Yellow Subs + French Fries = Crazy Delicious!

I'm sorry but everyone who gave this place a rating less than 3 stars - is just plain wrong.  Normally I'd argue that everyone is entitled to their own opinion, but this ceases to be true when I disagree with said opinion strongly enough like I do in this case.

The American Combo sub + avocado with a side of fries is ridiculously awesome.  Eating one of these delicious subs is an emotional, psychological experience.  After just one bit I can see flavors and taste colors, my clouded brain spins in my skull trying to recall what my life was like only moments before.  Dust bunnies grow legs and sing and dance before my eyes.  The first-person mantra of "There are two colors in my head" is repeated ghost like in my head until the line between reality and make believe is thoroughly erased.  The experience and emotions tied to eating at Yellow Sub are like witnessing the stillborn birth of a child while simultaneously having the opportunity to see her play in the afterlife on Imax.  

Honestly, I didn't mean any of that - I just wanted to experiment with plagiarizing hyperbole.  However, if you do decide to try Yellow Sub be nice to the kind people who work here and be sure to remember that it is cash only.
author: Matthew H.

description: This place has the best vegetarian sandwich I've ever had--the Avocado sub with all the fixings. Awww man, it's fresh and amazingly good. The portions here are massive--getting a whole sub means you have extra to share or enjoy later.  The fries are delicious as well.  To top it all off, the prices are great and service is friendly and accommodating. A must-visit spot.
author: Tameka W.

description:
A friend just moved out to the Sunset and while helping them move some boxes I needed some lunch while waiting for the rest of the moving caravan.  

(Side story: A long time ago I got braces at UCSF and always saw this place while driving down Irving to get home.  In 8th grade I finally made the connection to Yellow Submarine, hey, like the Beatles, oh, like a sandwich.  I never did stop by so I figured I now had the chance to go satisfy this one bit of my childhood curiosity.) 

I had no idea this was a cheese steak type place but was happy to find this out.  I stuck to the basics ordering a basic steak and cheese and figured a medium would be enough.  I get my order and whoa, a medium is definitely enough, for $6.50 it's huge!!  It's also tasty, a nicely toasted roll and the meat/onions are just greasy enough.  There's a little hot sauce as well that gives a nice kick.

Parking around here is tough so it's hard to make a trip out here just for a sandwich, but if I'm around I'll stop by again.
author: Jared W.

description: It's true...THIS PLACE IS THAT GOOD! Had the steak and cheese sandwich and it was tasty! Hubby had the dry salami and he was well pleased. Bummer that parking sucks around this area but eating a sandwich here is worth the trouble!
author: Ang P.

description:
Only one choice of bread (and its not whole grain either)
Veggies= lettuce, tomato, onion, avocado, and pickles (NO SPROUTS!!!!!!!)
hot sauce is extremely mild and I could barely taste it

Yes the sub is toasted, and the cheese is melted...but my turkey with everything except onions was rather tasteless. 

I am one who likes options outside of red meat (seriously, yellow submarine has too long a list of red meat choices, not enough non-red meat choices) and I like flavor!

Don't get me wrong- it's better then subway, but its not worth a special trip

Never again will I cheat on Ike's when in SF
author: Deirdre P.

description:
My favorite sub spot in SF . Huge subs, even for big appetites. I always end up taking half for later. That's because you gotta save room for the best potato chips ever. They are thick like fries, but cut like chips. 

All the sandwiches are spectacular, you're good ordering any of them. Do have your order ready to go, the counter doesn't have any patience. I love all the old artwork too, place is a little rundown, but that will never stop me from going there. I hope this place is around forever.
author: Raf Z.

description:
For the most part I've heard about this place countless times from friends who live in the inner sunset and I have always felt intrigued by what this place had to offer. Once i arrived I found the place on the corner and was kind of surprised how small it was overall. Ordering was easy since the line was never too long and very straight forward as they made everything fresh.

Now I've experienced places like Gene's on Taraval and the Sub Center at West Portal and can say that this place compares with the other places. I ordered a Pastrami sandwich and it was solid. The bread was crisp and the ingredients were very fresh. The only thing that I could say that I wish was improved on was the taste of the pastrami. After trying so many places in my life I felt that the meat could have been a little more tasty to say the least. But if your on a budget it's nice to know that they offer different sizes to fit your wallet so that's never a bad thing. Solid place to come to if your looking for a good lunch.
author: Jason Y.

description:
I just found out that this sandwich shop has been around for 33 years. And the menu has remained the same from day one. They must be doing something right. 

I'm crazy about Philly cheese steak. It is the only thing I order from Safeway's deli counter. So, I decided to try their steak and cheese sub. It's supposed to be the most popular item on the menu. 

The bread was just the right size and perfectly toasted. The steak was tender and delicately flavored, with a hint of spice from the homemade hot sauce they added to my sandwich. The veggies were fresh and crisp. Overall, I was happy with my choice. For $5.85, it's a great deal.

I guess after being in business for three decades, they've mastered the art of making a perfect subway sandwich. The portions are just enough for each ingredient that your tongue may end up dancing to the tune of the famous 60's Beattles song once the flavors of the ingredients settle in. 

It's a good old fashioned sandwich shop that's reliable, consistent and fast at an affordable price.
author: Carol G.

description: Hands down my favorite sub shop in the city. I could literally eat here every day. The portions are big and the staff is always nice. If anything, grab some of the thick cut fries when you stop by.
author: D A.

description:
Been on an eating out kick lately though my restaurant choices have definitely been reflecting the economic squeeze.  I'm making most dining decisions based on whether I can get in/get fed/get out for under 15$.  
So sorry Gary Danko. 
Too bad Michael Mina.
It's been swell Slanted Door.
See you around French Laundry. 
My new budget is all about the cheap eats.  And The Yellow Submarine on 6th definitely fits the bill.  They've got good, cheap sandwiches that are so big, I can spread a medium out over two meals.  

Guys at the counter were amazingly kind and helpful. 

The hot sauce is delicious, but I wasn't expecting it to come by default.  Warning for those with weak tolerance for the spicy stuff, make a note when you're ordering.
author: Melissa Y.

description: HUGE sandwiches for a pretty decent price. tried the steak and cheese sandwich and for my level of hunger at the time it really hit the spot. I live just a few blocks away and like having this type of place in the neighborhood for an occasional sandwich. probably not somewhere I'd take a friend visiting SF for the first time but a decent place to stop in on a day when you might not feel like cooking or spending lots on a fancier lunch.
author: Georgia W.

description: Tasty Italian sub toasted perfectly with lettuce, tomato, onion, mayo, mustard, oil, vinegar (why may and oil?  WHY THE HELL NOT!), hot sauce.  It's just simple goodness on a hoagie roll.  Do it.  Visit this place for lunch if you're in the 'hood.  Add soda and chips and just over 10 bucks.  A little more than I'd like to pay, so I docked 'em a star.  I will totally be back regardless.
author: Jeremy B.

description: best darn sub sarnies in the city. I get the straight ahead sub with no frills. magic!!!!!!
author: Nigel F.

description: The subs are classic, the service is old school, the location in the Inner Sunset is perfect.  I like the philly cheese steak, with provolone, tomato sauce and hot peppers....
author: Naeem N.

description:
Excellent sandwiches.  They won't be like your preconception, especially if you're expecting a New York deli sandwich or a Philly thing or a Boston thing.  Yellow Sub sandwiches are what they are.  The Reuben, though not much like a classic Reuben, is superb.  As is the steak and cheese and the pepper steak.  The ones I like a bit less are most like ordinary heroes at other places: Italian combo and meatball.  Both quite good, but not really special.

The bread here is for me the big winner.  I tried Sub Center on a friend's suggestion and the difference in the taste is really hard to believe.  I'd almost prefer a Yellow Sub bread sandwich (just the bread) to anything at Sub Center.  I've yet to try their homemade hot sauce, though almost all suggestions from the nice people here turn out great.
author: Richard R.

description: Classic sub, friendly joint in the hood. I had pepper steak and fries. Sandwich was huge, good for two meals. Next time, I'll ask for extra hot sauce. Enjoyed the old sub shop aesthetic. It's on the frequent list.
author: Jacob P.

description:
Ditto Ari G!  -- Steak and Cheese, Pepper Steak & Avocado sandwiches are my favorite.  I haven't gone for two years (b/c I had braces.  :P)...but recently went...and man...was it GOOD!  I kept thinking about having another for lunch the next few days!!!

They toast the bread and grill your steak and onions...  YUM!!!
author: Lise T.

description:
Yellow disappointment..."

We we're the first people in the door, and first to place our order, a large Italian with "The works."  We were excited to try this place, as it boasts "Boston style" sub sandwiches. Nothing could be farther from the truth.

After placing our to-go order of 1 large sandwich we retired out front to make room for the over 1/2 dozen other folks who came in minutes behind us. To our horror, the cooks make 8-12 sandwiches, all out of order from when we placed our order. It seems that "sandwiches made to order" is not high on their list of customer service philosophies. My best guess is they make all the sandwiches with the most orders placed, which put our order dead last, as many we're steak&cheese or Phillys.
At least eight people were served before us, which was 30 minutes after we arrived to an empty restaurant, first in line. Service is horrible, and that's being kind.

On to the "Boston Style" Italian sub sandwich. There we're a total of 6 thin slices of meat inside, 4 slices of poor grade mortadella, and 2 small slices of what looked like pepperoni. None of the meats we're classic Italian, and we're basic cold cuts. The "Works" ended up being lettuce, 2 thin tomatoes, 1 single pickle, no peppers, no onions, no oil, no vinegar, no pepper, no salt, and no hot sauce. These ingredients are listed for every sandwich on the wall menu, but not to be seen in the actual sandwich.
At last, it was toasted, which in itself is not a bad thing, but being a Boston native, I never saw a toasted submarine sandwich in the entire Tri-State area of New England.

Don't waste your time, this place is the pits, a waste of money, and time. You can get a better sandwich at the Safeway Deli, or if you are in the Sunset area, try Handy Deli, or Toasties.
author: Enoch K.

description: This is the way sandwiches are supposed to be.  Bread is crusty, but not too crunchy.  Filling is tasty and savory.  Juicy, but not sloppy.  Friendly...AND they have Orangina.
author: Jeff C.

description:
We were on the prowl for a post-hike meal after hiking around Sutro/Twin Peaks. This place definitely satisfied. Massive sandwiches (Med - $6) and fried potatoes (basket - $2) made for a great meal. I ordered the chicken sando with their home-made hot sauce and my lips were tingling for a while after. The GF ordered the Turkey, which was also pretty good. So two medium sando's, basket of fries and a snapple came in at just over $15. 

Cash only and no restrooms knocked them down to four stars.
author: B B.

description:
Well, I'll keep it short and sweet.  
This place is great.  Albeit, it is a little pricey for a sandwich, it is well worth every penny you spend.  The ingredients are top notch, and service is friendly and great (always a plus!).  
Everything from their basic roast beef sandwich to their steak & pepper sandwich is freaking awesome.
Also, you can always stop by after shopping on Irving for a nice meal!
author: Anthony L.

description:
I must have wrote my previous review a long time ago... before I was capable of appreciating how good this place really is.  Forget what I said about those sliced potato fries.  I LOVE them.  Thinly-cut pastrami? Hot Sauce? Toasted bread?  Orangina? I'm ALL in...

It's also cool that the guys in there recognize my face now too.
author: Chris C.

description:
Large meatball sub is HUGE! Especially when they fix it up with "The works!" I couldn't even finish it. Meatballs are a bit...mushy though, didn't really have a firm bite consistency to it like I expected. The bread is awesome though! It's almost a hybrid of sourdough crust with french bread interior. Crispy, crunchy, and chewy. 

They put a lot of meat in their sandwiches so even if you're paying close to 9 dollars, it's still almost 2 meals. 

Fries are different, they're potatoes sliced chip-style and then deep fried. Can be a bit soggy and from the look of them, they should change their oil soon.
author: Derrick L.

description: Love this place! When you are really hungry and need a fill-me-up super delicious sandwich, this is the place to go. Tip: If you need to save some time, call ahead and order. Cash Only!
author: Jennifer F.

description: Family that runs/owns this place went to St. Anne's, my alma matter.  I highly recommend the Hot Pastrami, the Meatball Sandwich, and their fries.  I have not had any of the other sandwiches.  These two are too good.
author: Brian C.

description:
These guys are great and friendly. I work down the street at the bank and the owners are always coming in for change. Their sandwiches are pretty good. They hook it up with discounts and the sizes of the sandwiches are filling. Their steak and cheese sub is very popular. I recommend it! 

It's a nice place to grab lunch. Its hard to find a decent sub store in san francisco and I'm really picky about my sandwiches. Its not the best but its not bad either. If you can't make it to little lucca then yellow sub would make a nice alternative.
author: Jenny K.

description: This place is good for the price you pay, but maybe my expectations were too high b/c I don't think anything amazing of it.  I do like the huge authetic potato sliced fries though.  I feel that my steak/cheese sub was missing cheese or mine had very little?  I think I need to go back and see if it always tastes like that or if it was a mistake.
author: Derrick C.

description:
"we all live in the yellow submarine.... yellow submarine.... " 
I think this place has the best sub sandwiches in town. I never finish a whole sandwich though, it's way to big for me. You can dine in and look at the mural they have on the wall while you eat.
author: Dhoris P.

description:
I like this place... a lot. I have been here 3 times. The first time I ordered the philly cheese steak and the second and third time, I smartened up and went with the ruben. Simply scrumptious! Nice, hot toasted sandwich with a generous amount of ingredients always satisfies the craving. Sometimes the wait can be a bit long but what can you expect from a $12 lunch? *grin*

Tip: 1 large sandwich equals 2 medium sandwiches so it's a bargain if there's 2 of you ordering the same thing.
author: Vitamin C.

description: Probably 3.5.  Big sub is big.  But more bread than meet.  Nothing spectacular.  Deli board, Ikes etc. are superior to this place.  Fries looked amazing.  I still need to try them.
author: Mike I.

description:
Best sandwiches in SF.  

I say this for a couple of reasons.  First, the sandwiches are great.  They don't skimp on ingredients and the sandwiches are all toasted (this is something they did pre-Quiznos, mind you) just enough to get things warm without making the bread too hard or crusty.

Second, the owners of this place actually work there every day, including two sons and their mom.  All of them are happy to be there (seem so, anyway) and are more than willing to have a chat about whatever's on your mind.  It's one thing to have empty conversation with a minimum wage employee in some chain store, but these folks really seem to give a damn about folks that roll in.  I'm there about once a week, and they always remember me and have something really genuinely nice to say when I stop in for a bite.
author: Patrick B.

description: I'll admit it; I'm a sandwich freak.  I try the local sandwiches in nearly every city I travel to.  The Yellow Submarine ranks in my top five, which is saying a lot.  I particularly like the Italian combo, and make sure not to miss the potato slices.  They're better than fries!
author: William P.

description:
I rolled out of bed this afternoon, leisurly dressed, left the house, and got on a random bus.  Followed by a random Muni line.

I ended up on Irving and Ninth, always a good choice for window shopping and good eats.  As I was walking I realized it was five thirty in the P.M., and that I was ready to eat my own hand off the bone.

I quickly scanned the food options in the immediate area and nothing really sounded new.  Then I walked by Yellow Submarine, and realized that yes, I WAS in the market for a delicious sandwich. 

My veggie sub was excellent - ahhh that toasted French bread, the malleable Swiss cheese, the simple yet classic add-ons.  Their 'fries' are the best aesthetic thing on the menu, as they are circular.

I'm not going to give five stars because it was really cold inside, but I don't blame em.  I know what it's like to be stuck by machinery that pump continuous hot air on your back, and ontop of that to have the heater on.

Thumbs WAY down to the douchebag who sat next to me and talked about teabagging his roommate.  I'm eatin' here!
author: Lily E.

description: This is a reasonably cheap sandwich joint.  They have a lot of meat choices.  It's reasonably no frills, but I'd say better quality than subway.  Preparation time was slower than subways, but for the price and the quantity of food I'd say its worth the extra 5 minutes or so.
author: Jason C.

description: This place has character. Not to mention their sandwiches are incredibly good. It's a cute place to get a nice big old school sandwich with fries and a drink on a nice afternoon.
author: Johanna P.

description: Four of us enjoyed the best steak and cheese subs we've ever had.   The small size sub is plenty big, rolls are fresh and toasted just right, and good to the last bite.  The fries are also quite good. Oh, and the prices are very reasonable.   This place is within walking distance of the deYoung Museum.  Seating is limited but we didn't have any trouble getting a table on a Thursday during the lunch hour.
author: Lorraine M.

description:
We all live on a yelllow submarine yellow submarine...... - I wonder if they stole the name from the Beatles song, so what if they did! It beats any lame chain sub shop  (quizno's sucks major ass and is a rip off for the record) and most other local ones.

Family run since around 1970, the fries are amazing - who cares that they're greasy and oily (deep fried round slices!) just be careful because they are really hot for a few minutes. I think the Mom (the sweet old lady) stopped working there recently. The 2 brothers almost look like twins.

But even without the spectacular hospitaility, the food is great, and by great I mean messy enough when you eat it. I ain't going to a sub shop to have a clean sandwich.

Don't forget to look at the old menu in the seating area while you wait for your sub to be made - the drawings are classic! Sure there ain't much seating - but the park is just a block away.

I make sure to eat here at least once a month ( I am on a tight budget).
I was there just this past weekend - just as good as it always is!

be warned - lunch time during the week it gets packed with folks in scrubs from UCSF - but seriously it's worth the wait.
author: Emmet M.

description:
Awesome hot sandwiches.  They bake the bread in their oven with cheese for your sandwich.  The chicken is my favorite.  It is all chopped up.  I have yet to figure out the marinade, but it is soo tasty!  YUM!  The staff is very friendly.  They always say hi and remember my order.  The sandwiches are big and filling.

The line can be a little confusing, but it is worth the wait (if there is one).
author: Corrie F.

description: The cashier wasnt friend, i order 2 large subs & in the subs there wasnt no tomato/pickles r enough beef.  The bread was overcooked too.  The taste was dry no oil-vinegar r sauce (which was supposed to include).  I wouldnt reccommend the place at all its a rip off & service sucks!:(
author: Thai C.

description:
When a place is named the Yellow Submarine, you just have to try it.  The bread was toasted perfectly and is the best I've had in the City (even more than Ike's, Dirty sauce aside).  The ratio of bread and meat is perfect.  So far, I've had the tuna and steak/cheese sandwich with the later being my fave and seems to be their most popular.  The painted pictures of their sandwiches in the dining room is fun, and the guys that run the place are always super friendly.

5-7 minutes wait time for a sandwich after ordering, cash only.
Service is great.
Parking here is hard to find and meter fed.
author: John D.

description:
This place is the best sub-shop ever to bear the Beatles-inspired moniker.  This place puts the Subway-Quiznos chow lines to SHAME... hot grilled with fresh oven-baked bread this place would make the toughest guy cry for momma.  

I won't recommend any particular this or that because this ain't that kind of place.  Just suck it up and go see for yourself, then afterwards maybe head over to the Fireplace, or better yet Yancy's Saloon to catch a game.
author: Jim W.

description: Exactly what is a Boston-style sub sandwich? I asked friends from Boston and they had no idea. Oh well, maybe it's fictional like global warming. The sandwiches here are hugemongous! Actually, it's more like the bread is big. The meat is pretty average, but the combination of everything makes for a really good sandwich. Their philly steak is good, and another thing that they have here that I've not had anywhere else is the 'fries'. They're deep fried potato slices. If you've had the mojo potatoes from Shakey's in SoCal, then that's the idea. The potatoes here are better, though. Parking around here kinda sucks, so I recommend ordering ahead and picking up, or just send your assistant to go get it for you. You have an assistant right?
author: Saunders C.

description:
i never had an avocado sandwich.  just an avocado sandwich.  that alone is worthy of a review.  but the fact that i actually enjoyed it more than some other deli-meat sandwiches i've had is what earns the yellow submarine four stars.

i don't think the avocado sandwich is one of the main attractions at the yellow submarine.  i think they're mostly known for their cheesesteaks and hot sandwiches.  but it was a rare 90* day in the city and i really wasn't feeling anything greasy or fried, so the avocado sandwich it was.  i actually didn't expect much, but they didn't skimp on the ingredients.  it was loaded with avocado and all the trimmings, and the toasted bread tied everything together perfectly.  it seemed like they put just as much care and thought into this sandwich as all their others, which was appreciated.

even though the yellow submarine might not be known for their avocado sandwich, i'd happily go back just for that.
author: stefanie h.

description:
Here's an important rule of thumb kids:  NEVER eat anything bigger than your head.

I have a big head (7 1/2) and there have been times where I felt I might break the rule if I ate a whole Yellow Submarine sandwich in the same sitting.  

Someone got peyoteed up and painted a bunch of stuff from the Yellow Submarine Beatles movie on the walls in this place a long time ago.  If you're the white gloves type, this is not your spot. It's kinda divey in the dining area, but it's fine.

On the other hand, the sandwiches are GREAT.  They take your order and then melt the cheese and meat onto the bun.  Then all of the veggies and all that go on.   Is that called Boston style?  I don't even know.  It is good.  

The two times I have dragged others into this place, they were skeptical at first, but were soon won over by the food.   The two women who work behind the counter here have been doing so for years.  I can't say I've ever had a meaningful conversation with either of them, but we have exchanged some meaningful smiles over the years.  Most of the meaning has been about the good food coming over the counter and making its way into my tummy.

Mmmmm-MMMMM!!!
author: Nelson W.

description:
I used to go here often when I worked next door at Crossroads. The only reason it was often instead of, say, every day, was because the salary I was paid by Crossroads was pitiful. What are you gonna do? It's ancient history. But this joint still very much has a place in my heart.

This was back in my meat-eating days, so I can attest to the deliciousness of the turkey sandwich. Really, any place that toasts a sandwich up like they do here is a godsend. Why haven't more places jumped on the toasted sandwich bandwagon? I don't want a cold sandwich, okay? I want it hot and delectable. Yellow Sub delivers, and how. The finished product is HUGE, and oh so satisfying. I always ended up saving the second half, and it was always good later.

I also like the nice family who runs the place. They manage to be no-nonsense and friendly at the same time. It seems like a contradiction but it works. I haven't been there in a while so I'm not sure if it's still cash-only, but at least they have an ATM on the premises. 

I wish I could give this place 4.5 stars instead of only stars. Consider this a 4.5 star place. If I haven't already made it clear, I've got some serious love for the Yellow Submarine. The only reason I deduct .5 of a star is because, now that I've stopped eating animals, my sandwich options are somewhat limited. This is par for the course in most sandwich joints--if you're a vegetarian you get a vegetable sandwich with avo--but there is more that could be done if they so chose (see Ike's.) I get that YS is more of an old-school establishment, so I'm not expecting them to change it up and add veggie turkey to the menu. But man, if they did, this would be a 10 star review.
author: Taylor M.

description:
The Yellow Submarine is literally right next door to one of my friend's places. She just moved into the  neighborhood and today was the first place I got to eat at the sub shop with the heavenly smells emanating from it. 

The first thing that drew me to this place (besides its obvious location) was the smell of grilled onions. I'm a sucker for anything grilled but onions especially and had to peek inside. 

OK, the sandwiches at this place are HUGE. Come hungry. I first thought they were toasting baguettes in their oven but no, those are just the large sandwiches. I decided to go for the medium because I already had to poop and didn't want to think about what a sandwich the size of my forearm would do to my already taxed digestive track. Thanks but I don't need my shit to have corners.

Mmm, I couldn't wait for those onions on my sandwich. I got the steak and cheese because it seemed appropriate at a sub shop. My friend got a pastrami and we split a basket of fries which I will get to a bit later. The service itself is so-so. It takes a while to grill the onions with the meat, toast the bread and put the fixin's on. I wouldn't stop in if you're in a rush or need to catch the Muni which stops right outside. 

Once your meat is in the bread, you get a choice of a bunch of fixin's. This place gets extra props for offering hot sauce on their sandwiches which I capitalized on. The fries themselves are not your average thin sticks of greasy goodness. You get huge freakin slices of a potato cut in half! I'd never seen fries like it and man were they good. I could feel my arteries screaming with each delicious morsel. 

So a big sandwich, half-moon fries and a bottle of water didn't run over 10 bucks and kept me full for most of the day. If you've got some time and are a hunga munga, stop in and treat yourself.
author: Mark B.

description:
Best hot sandwich I have had in years.  The Steak & Cheese is outstanding and the fries are literally potato slices that have been turned into a most blissful meal.

The medium is large enough for almost anyone, and the large is HUGE!
author: David H.

description: This place is conveniently (unfortunately for my waist size and wallet) down the street from campus. The sandwiches are unbelievably good. I'm usually your straight laced, turkey on wheat bread, no steak, no salami , no ham, no pastrami kinda girl. But at the Yellow Submarine, it's the pepper steak sandwich all the way for me. Imagine a Philly cheesesteak sandwich but with lettuce and tomatoes. Delicious. The splash of hot vinegar gives it a extra little kick too. Also if you like things spicy, go with the homemade hot sauce, my male classmates go crazy over it. And remember always always order a side of 'fries', not your typical freedom fries but more so of a thick cut potato chip. It's crispy on the outside, soft and chewy on the inside. Now here's the best part guys, after consuming all that artery clogging goodness if you don't feel to good, ucsf's emergency room is just up the street!!! Woot!
author: Ha N.

description:
The sandwiches are generous in size and really tasty, especially the avocado.

I'd suggest calling in and picking up a sandwich because it's not that great of a place to sit down.
author: adrian b.

description:
You know how there are some places that just do it right.
Well this is one of those places.  They make sandwiches, just like thousands of of other places in the city, but these are just a little different.

Toasted Subs, just perfect.  The bread is great, they are piled high with meet, cheese and lots of fixings.  

Maybe it is the oven, maybe it is graffiti on the wall, maybe it is just that they do it right.
author: David R.

description:
I've had two of their sandwiches - the roast beef and the avocado. The french roll they use are good however it's thick that it dominates the ingredients in between. Not a good choice if you're trying to limit your carb intake. I like the avocado more than the roast beef (the roast beef wasn't anything special). Good portions of avocado - however, I needed to sprinkle salt and pepper to add flavor. 

Also, it doesn't accept debit/credit cards, so you better have cash ready; otherwise you can get cash out of the ATM just outside the sandwich shop (with the $1.75 fee of course). 

Great service - attentive - and I like being addressed as the old fashioned, "maam."
author: Audrey L.

description:
They say Boston Style....  not quite but it was still tasty.

The bread was toasted just right.
The cheese steak isn't cooked with the cheese.  They place it on the bread where it didn't really melt.
It was fresh and they were extremely friendly.
Next time I go I won't be getting the cheese steak.
author: Po L.

description:
I love this place.  These are the best sandwiches ever and we come here probably twice a week.  Yum Yum.  

Sometimes the place gets a little busy, and things slow down quite a bit when it does.  Also, they occasionally run out of the french fries, which is  a big disappointment  when it happens because they have the best french fries on earth!
author: Joseph H.

description: So I finally got the opportunity to try this place again, but I still wasn't very impressed.  However, it was better than last time.  Once again, the bread was the best part.  I think their ingredients are good separately, but when mixed together it just doesn't work for me.  I WISH i got some more hot sauce because the little I had did add some much needed flavor.  Overall, I would come here again if I was in the area, but there are SOO many great sandwich joints in SF that I wouldn't go out of my way to get one of their sandwiches.
author: Alannah N.

description: I ate here twice, once my half sister and once with my hubby. The sandwiches are not bad at all, not the best I've had but certainly not the worst. I always have turkey and they do stuff it. The crispy waffle fries are good, though last time I was there they were a bit soggy. Their a small family opened sandwich shop and their not too expensive for a quick bite. However, parking can be difficult to find in this area.
author: Petra S.

description:
When I lived in SF, I'd tell people to try this place and they'd say, "Jay's Cheesesteaks are way better Philly Cheesesteaks!"

Yellow Sub is a Boston style Steak & Cheese shop.  Not a Philly style Cheesesteak shop.  There is a difference.  That said, they do an awesome Steak & Cheese here.  Everytime I come home for a visit, we stop here for lunch.  Can't beat it, and the subs are so big, they're good for two meals.
author: Layla B.

description:
We all live in a yellow submarine,
yellow submarine, yellow submarine.......

I hope you know how to spell yummy because this is the place for a sandwich if you're in the sunset. 

This submarine will beat your Subway!! 
forrealZ though! Forget quiznos, subway, some cafe with a $10 not so good sandwich. 

I think this is a great choice if you are a sandwich lover and wanna grab some lunch somewhere. I've only ventured here once, but I can't wait to eventually go back! I had a hot pastrami sandwich, and the sandwiches are pretty big too. I had a side of potato salad to go with it, so i pretty much pigged out. 

Service: The people were friendly and the service was quick enough. I have no complaints what so ever. I had take out, so I can't really comment on dining in, but I glanced and it doesnt look that bad. 

The customers coming in and out were pretty friendly as well. I like the neighborhood and sandwich joint...so I will definitely return one day!
author: Catherine O.

description:
Review for steak sandwiches only.  Very Tasty!  

I'm a Philly guy when it comes to steak sandwiches, but in a pinch, these sandwiches will do you well.  AND, for the lack of Philly goodness, they do make up for it in size.  One large could fill up yourself and buddy, given a side of fries (which are actually like home made, thick cut potato chips).

Also nice is the large-ish seating area.  :)
author: Dan M.

description:
Lines around the corner usually reflect a great place. I was very satisfied with the cheese steak and the turkey sub. These subs are HUGE Boston Stylee. Filler up! 

The art work also rocks. There's a sausage face guy representing the Italian Sausage sub. That rules.
author: Peter N.

description:
Great...I had "we all live in a yellow submarine..." playing in my head ALL day after eating here.

Sandwiches come in medium (about $5.50)  and large ($7.55 - large being almost a full 12 inches), are toasted and come with the works (mayo, pickles, hot sauce, onions, lettuce, cheese, tomatoes, oil & vinegar).

There were two guys making them, both nice and pretty quick.  I had the Italian combo, and although it wasn't mind blowing, it was good.  They also have chips, potato salad, coleslaw and french fries (which are cut in rounds and are mostly dripping in oil & soggy - I advise people to stay away from those).

All in all pretty good (minus having the song stuck in my head all day)!!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Giant sandwiches, definitely try the steak sandwich, it's what they're famous for!

I'm a big fan of sandwiches, and this is definitely one of the places that I'll go for a pretty filling one. I also recommend eating their fried potato slices, those really complete the whole meal.
author: pauline joy r.

description:
Okay. So I also reviewed The Cheesesteak Shop, in which I slammed it down (not too badly.. 3 stars) because of it's inauthentic philly style cheesesteak. But I love the yellow submarine, because it's a Boston style sub... that is actually authentic.

Let me explain.

I am from Philly originally... but I lived in Boston for 6 years. For the longest time in Boston, I refused to call what Bostonians call a "Steak and Cheese" a "Steak and Cheese" ...because I thought they were just kidding themselves.. thinking a "Steak and Cheese" is just a glorified Philly Cheesesteak. I'd always order "Cheesesteak" even though it says "Steak and Cheese" on the menu board. 

Since moving to san francisco, going to the Yellow Submarine gave me a nostalgia that led me to finally accept the Steak and Cheese for what it is... a good sandwich in its own right. The two are different... and shouldn't be mixed up.
author: Bonnie H.

description: Came by for lunch. Had the medium steak and cheese which ran for $6.50 after tax. It is whole lot bigger with more filling than cheese steak shop on divisadero, and less grease.
author: Robin L.

description: Since moving back to the Bay from SD I've been looking for this sandwich place.
