Not literally, I mean I see it on my way home on Irving, but like figuratively, I wanted to find a sandwich place comparable to 4.0 in SD. This place is great, hot sandwiches with tasty fillings and a sneaky hot sauce. Great prices too, a large can definitely feed two and it's like 8 bucks: win. Cash only, the fries look interesting but I've not tried them yet.
author: Christopher V.

description:
The Medium sandwiches are huge and are only $5.95.  The Large is about $2 more and is enormous.  Don't expect a fancy decor, the place was built in the '70's and shows it.  Check out the cartoonish wall menu in the dining room.  They blocked out the old prices but you can still see them, $1.50 for a sandwich and 30 cents for a drink!

The service is somewhat slow and the waiting area is TINY.
author: GRACE M.

description: Its a small place so we always order ours to go.  Calling ahead helps a lot.  Tried the Steak & Cheese, Italian Combo and Avocado.  All very yummy.  Im looking forward to trying the Reuben, Meatball and Corned Beef next.  Love the fried potato chips.  The sandwiches are a good size for the price.
author: she q.

description:
If you are anything like me, you've walked by this place a million times and kept saying 'I'll try that place sometime." I'm telling you now...stop, check it out, you won't be disappointed. The bread has a nice thin crispy crust to it. I went with a medium pepper steak sammich with everything but vinegar and mayo. They default with "the works" but seem to ask everyone if they want the works and have listed whats in it very prominently. I asked for mine with the meat a little less cooked then normal, they happily obliged. 

I've only got two suggestions if you are dining here:
- If you like hot sauce, request the home made stuff, it is very tasty.
- Put a couple napkins in your basket while you are eating the first half of your sandwich. Mine was quite juicy and ended up pooling a lot of juice and making the bottom half of my second sammy soggy.

I'd go back, in a heart beat...and might choose it over Ike's, and not just because there is rarely if ever a wait at this joint.
author: H B.

description:
I saw this place on bay area check please and thought I'd give it whirl since the woman who suggested it was so enthused about it. Lets just say I wasn't as  enthusiastic. 
I decided to try their pastrami, as sort of a last meal since I was getting laid off that very Friday.  It left a lot to be desired.  It was dry and not very tasty. I was smart enough to ask for their home made hot sauce which is delicious and redeemed the visit overall enough to make me comeback and try again. Although the small was filling I didn't have enough cash in my pocket for fries or a drink. Eight bucks felt a little steep for a sandwich, but like I said it was filling.
I went back with a couple of friends for lunch and this time took the advice I ignored from the guy at the counter and tried the classic steak.  Definitely an improvement but I won't write home about it! I say go and make up your own mind and try it for your self.

Pros
Original fries, potatoes sliced thin and fried(not as crispy as I like but different enough to try once)
Home made hot sauce is delicious 
Big Portions
Family Run

Cons
$$ but what isn't in SF nowadays.
Family run, matriarc is getting on in years and hard of hearing careful what you ask for, you might get accused of attitude.
CASH  ONLY, I understand why, but this sucks when ya got nothin but plastic and a growling gut.
author: Carlos S.

description: Was just in yesterday for some more sandwiches....  Ordered an Italian Combo for myself and a Large Tuna for the bf.  The Large sandwich was enormous and he was unable to finish it.  As always, the food and service were great with reasonable prices.
author: Dominique K.

description:
I discovered this place years ago on the way back in the early 80s on the way to the zoo. I have been a fan ever since...I almost always get the Italian combo or the pepper steak. I have never liked anything else there. The "chips" are too soggy and I don't think they make their own potato salad. 
A SF tradition for me is to go there after a long weekend walk in The Arboretum.
author: William L.

description: When I first moved into SF, I probably would have gone to bed hungry one too many nights if it werent for this place. The yummy smells oozing out the door of this hole in the wall sandwich stop are enough to make anyone intrigued. They truly have something for everyone- from your standard turkey to dangerous veal to healthful veggie. The bread is warm and toasty and the special hot sauce they put on each sando is deeeelish. Ask for extra! Sometimes the wait can be a bit long when the line is out the door, but to that dilemma I say just be patient and watch the sandwich queen on the grill do her thing! She's amazing. I recommend trying the fries, even though they're more like fried potato pancakes and could be a little crispier. The inside decor is definitely outdated but the cartoon pictures on the wall are charming. I'll always have a special place in my heart for this simple sandwich shop. No matter how cold and foggy the sunset can be, a sandwich from this place is sure to warm your tummy.
author: Kara L.

description:
Toasting of a sandwich makes all the difference in the world.  Owner is from somewhere back east, super nice.  I had the Italian, ham and the turkey.  Order it will all the fixings and make sure to have cheese on it as the melting part is excellent.

Very bargain basement
author: Nicole F.

description:
Grand sammies. Good fries, friendly service. 
I used to eat here to kill time while doing laundy. 
Eating to kill time.....not good
author: Lauren T.

description:
Since my only option really is chicken, I got the chicken sub with everything but onions (lettuce, tomato, oil, vinegar, mustard,  mayo, some hot sauce) and a side of their "fries".  

The fries were interesting, because they were like thinly sliced pieces of potato that were of course, deep fried.  It was a bit oily yes, but still nice.  Not really salty like at a fast food place, which made it more "natural" I suppose.  

The sandwich was good, granted the liquid dripped out all over the place making it slightly messy but no matter.  Good combination for a hungry girl after work.  

And considering I had always wondered how the food was at this place, I'd probably go again.  The people are definitely efficient in making your meal, and friendly too - always a plus in my book!
author: Yosie G.

description: I wanted to try this because i heard the steak sandwich with hot sauce was pretty good. The sandwich overall wasn't bad, but i didn't think it was as good as some people say. The meat was dry and pretty flavorless without the hot sauce. I wouldn't come back unless i really needed to have a sandwich and this was the only place around. I think the problem with most sandwich shops is that they don't take the time to make things right and don't use good quality meats. I can easily make a sandwich on my own, so when i go out to buy one, i want it to be worth the trip. For those of you who aren't quite as discerning and just need a sandwich fix, you can give it a try and make your own judgments.
author: Iknowasianfood C.

description: it was , ok. It is heated up, which is a big plus for a sandwich in San Francisco. other then that, not much to write home about.....
author: A. B.

description: Best sandwich shop in town, hands down.  Plus their fries are delicious golden frisbees.
author: Crystal W.

description: All these bad reviews?!? I don't know what people are talking about, I have been eating here for years and it's always good. I always get the turkey whick has been good for the past 2-3 years.
author: Captain Muffin D.

description:
Summary: Boston is know for good subs?!?

Disclaimer: As a native New Yorker, I grew up with subs and sandwiches where you can actually taste the meat and not just the bread.  It doesn't have to be a Dagwood-sized thing, but...(as the commercial said)..."where's the beef".

Aside...I've always been curious where "Boston Style Subs" comes from...I lived in Beantown for a couple years and don't remember anything special about their sandwiches...but anyway...

Their sandwiches are just OK.  Skimpy on ingredients though.  Ingredients are fresh and tasty (what of it is there, that is).  The turkey/roast beef combo I've had a few times was especially scrawny and disappointing; the normal turkey is a bit better.  The cheese steak was recommended by a few friends but I found it bland and scrawny as well.

I've had mixed experiences with the staff...at first I thought they were kinda rude, but over time just think they're brisk and business-ey (vs "warm and fuzzy").  Not complaining, just an observation.

All that said I eat here 3-4 times a year.  I'm still searching for a good New York style sub in SF and while you certainly won't find one here, I've had worse.  Oh, and as others have posted, call in to avoid the wait around lunchtime.
author: Steve E.

description:
Dish: Pepper Steak Sandwich
Quantity: Good sized sandwich for how much you're paying
Quality: Excellent. 
Service: Fair.

Misc: It's mighty hard to walk past here and not smell the food cooking or see either the line of people outside or the sardine can of people trying to order inside. I was initially thrown off by how much the sammies cost but when I saw the size of a regular sandwich I understood why. The sandwich was delicious and we ordered the home made "fries" (they look like chips). I recommend eating them as soon as you get them. I'll definitely come back again to try some of their other sandwiches. 

Downside: it's cash only. Something that many people don't realize when they walk in. However there is a citibank, BofA and Wells Fargo a few blocks down. Considering what you're about to consume, walking a few blocks before eating might be a good idea.
author: Scott K.

description: Had a delicious Hot Pastrami Sandwich that was enough to fill me up and have for leftovers. Awesome.
author: William S.

description:
Its hard to go to a specialty sandwich shop without comparing it to that shop with the 3 hour lines and recently got evicted. However, this place has a couple of things in its favor. The wait is definitely much shorter and for me its an elevator ride and a couple of blocks away.
     The sandwiches aren't bad either. The bread is fresh baked, slightly crunchy on the outside, and soft on the inside. Unfortunately you aren't left with much choice when it comes to the bread. I can't help to think that these sandwiches would be better with my favorite...dutch crunch.
The meat is good quality. The pastrami had good thickness and was well seasoned. The lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles, mustard, vinegar, and mayo all brought out the flavor of the meat. The hot sauce....WEAK. Man...this weak sauce barely even registers when you take a bite.
     Overall, the sandwiches ARE really good. But I can't help but think how big of a difference a few minor adjustments could make. The portion sizes are a plus. Even for a manly man, (like me) a large sandwich will knock you out!
     Oh yeah...I DO like the mutant hybrid chip/fries! (probably the result of some UCSF experiment) Especially the ones that are cut unevenly. The thin side was crunchy (like a chip) while the thick side was crispy yet soft (like a fry).
author: Siao W.

description:
so i've been looking for a good sub shop for sometime now. back east, the lettuce is shredded, lots of flavor, soft untoasted bread. 
i got a large italian combo. no description for the sandwiches, which would have been nice. huge for the price! full of meats, bread was slightly toasted, but still soft. the works- minus hot sauce, just because i've never really seen that option before. overall- good sub. 
reuben. i'm horribly picky when it comes to these guys. i should have know better when he asked, med or large. well, actually there shouldn't be a choice. it should be on rye bread, with some corned beef, swiss, sauerkraut , thousand island dressing, and grilled. that's it! what i got was a corned beef (meat was delicious!) sandwich with the works (minus hot sauce) and i think he added some thousand island dressing. it was good, but it WASN'T a reuben. lame. overall- good corned beef sandwich. also threw in an order of fries, which were awesome. loved that were different from the regular ol' stick shaped. 
cash only.
author: Abigail W.

description: This place is pretty good! Got a regular turkey and avocado sandwich. It came out nice and warm and the bread was perfectly toasted so that was a plus. Normal size sandwiches. You can eat it there, but also great on the go. The staff were friendly and nice and made my sandwich just the way I like it. It came out pretty quick; & I didn't have to wait it line. It's not as cheap as Subways or Quiznos but that's because their quality of sandwiches are way better; I felt like I was being pretty healthy! I didn't try their fries, but I hear it's pretty good. I'd definitely go back! (:
author: Chrisy Y.

description:
You walk in, and what does it smell like? LOVE! Who doesn't love an older Asian woman, making you a good old American sub? 

This place is old as hell. It's been around forever, and the owners probably have too. Take that into consideration. Think of the experience they've gathered. There is an art to making a great sub. I'm sure you comprehend.

The interior probably hasn't changed since they first opened, and neither have the subs. 

The bread could be better, but I've had WAY worse. Don't forget the hot sauce. I believe they even make the hot sauce themselves. 

This place is an SF institution! 

Negative one star, for not offering more vegetarian friendly options. I can't really blame them though, this place was probably built, before the vegetarianism became popular (in the States).

They have a hot sauce, that is homemade. Ask for it! It's DELICIOUS!!

Support a local Mom & Pop shop!
author: Charles K.

description:
Tucked into a dense area packed with mediocre shops and restaurants, Yellow Submarine's kitschy, Beatles-derived sign was a turn-off for me initially.  However, once I bit into the tender, savory pepper steak sandwich I was pleasantly surprised.  The Submarine is definitely a hole-in-the-wall type sandwich shop which to my standards is the best kind.  

The medium sub was more than enough, especially when paired with the delicious round cut potatoes, (I can hardly call them fries they are so big) and a cold beverage.  

This is now one of my area favorites.
author: Rion S.

description:
Been going here for over 10 years now, my boyfriend for even longer!  I highly recommend the pepper steak sandwich, so yummy!  They are usually pretty busy, especially during lunch time, so if you don't want to wait around, call in your order.  

What I like most about this place is that the two brothers who run it are really nice.  They usually look pretty harried, since I usually go there when it's busy, but they are really accomodating.  For example, my cousin thought she ordered a potato salad (she didn't, I was there when she placed the order) but they gave her one anyways, for free!

One warning, the large is pretty large, it's enough to feed both my boyfriend and I!
author: Melissa A.

description:
I had a steak and cheese; it was great. The "medium" was already almost too big for me; typical American over-sizedness.

The fries were not bad, but not great. They are just potatos chopped into medallion shapes. So minus one star.

I do miss my Boston steak and egg subs, and they didn't have that on the menu :(.
author: Rob T.

description:
Large pepper steak sandwich with extra hot sauce please!!!

Oh how I love their pepper steak sandwiches.  The bread, meat, veggies, and secret hot sauce go so well together.

I used to live down the street from this sandwich shop and I regret taking their sandwiches for granted.  I make it a priority to stop by anytime I am in the city. 

 I love their pepper steak sandwiches so much that I am known to drive the 1 1/2 hour round trip just to satisfy my cravings.  I normally order 2 sandwiches when I make the trip... one for there and one for the house.
author: Martin G.

description: Dropped in around 2:30 in the afternoon when it wasn't very busy.  Ordered a medium meatball sandwich with everything except mayo and cheese.  It was HUGE; could easily have taken half home for dinner but it was sooooo good I ate the whole thing.  One of the best sandwiches I've had; the bread was toasted perfectly, the meatballs were very tasty and the fixings were great complements.  Was not hungry enough to try the potatoes, but I'll definitely be returning to try some of the other sandwiches and perhaps the spuds.  I dined there and found the atmosphere unremarkable, but clean and well-lit.  The service was very friendly and competent.  This is a terrific neighborhood spot, but not a destination.  It does what it does very well; it's not trying to win a James Beard award or attract hordes of foodies but it serves better than decent food at fair prices.
author: Barbara B.

description: I've been going here for years, great sando.  I ussually get the cheese streak with the works, good stuff.
author: Mike C.

description: If you are in the inner sunset district and hungry for a sandwich, stop by here and you will not be disappointed. All around good sub sandwich that delivers on portions, taste, and quality. One of the few places that adds hot sauce to sandwiches. But their hot sauce is not over powering, it blends well with all their sandwiches.
author: Nick C.

description:
I had a medium hot pastrami w/ the works - $6ish

It's a fair-sized sandwich so I munched on half for lunch and the rest for the ride home after work. 

Big, warm, and greasy. Fortunately, the bread was good and maintained structural integrity. The pastrami itself was alright, though I faintly was reminded of philly cheesesteak for some reason. Although the extra toppings were bland and characterless, it was all and all a decent sandwich.

Service tho polite, was a tad perfunctory, but hey they keep the line moving and my sub came out pretty quick and  smartly wrapped so no complaints

I work nearby so I can see myself going again, probably to check out the fries. But otherwise, I wouldn't go out of my way to find the place when there are other delis that are on par elsewhere.
author: R L.

description: Sandwich was just so-so.  It was more bread than anything else which is probably why I don't remember what kind of filling I ordered.  Bread was fresh and crisp though.
author: Elsie D.

description: This is one of my favorite places ever!  The best Steak and Cheese!!!  Mmmmmmm.... So good.  You can call in or just walk in.  It's cash only, but there is an ATM right outside if you forgot to get some.  Super nice staff too!
author: Kimberly R.

description: Yellow Submarine has really good Pepper Steak Sandwiches though it's somewhat messy to eat but it's delicious.  Their chicken is pretty good.  They may be busy at times, being close by UCSF.  You might want to place your order by phone 20-30 minutes ahead before coming by to pickup your order.
author: George L.

description: Talk about old school goodness. I used to come here as a kid. Hasn't changed in thirty five years. Sandwiches are fresh and toasted perfectly. The hot pastrami is my favorite. They even make real artery clogging chips right there. Can't go wrong when grandma makes the sandwich.
author: Gary W.

description: AMAZING subs....the steak and cheese with homemade hot sauce is the way to go...one of the best in the city.
author: Beth G.

description: Had a fantastic turkey sandwich here last night.  The medium was more than enough food, and a pretty good bargain.  I'll be more than happy to swing by here the next time I'm in the InSet and jonesing for a good sandwich.
author: Joshua W.

description: I didn't expect a whole lot from here.  Sandwiches were OK.  Not a big wow factor.  Ike's Sandwiches is by far the best I've ever had.
author: Kit L.

description:
We all eat at the Yellow Submarine
The Yellow Submarine
The Yellow Submarine
...
Great quick grinder/sub/hoagie (just depends on where in the country you're from... up there with pop/soda/coke) place, and just a few blocks from my place. Thank goodness too... we made an emergency run over there yesterday before a party... just to make sure we had food in our stomachs (when did we get old and semi responsible).

One of their old menus is up on the wall as artwork... which is pretty damned cool.

Get the grilled pastrami and onions sandwich with the works... just go for it... either that or one of the steak and cheese sandwiches... and add hot sauce... mm mmm good
author: Jordan Y.

description:
My 2 cents, quickly:

Middle of the road sandwich shop with good portions. Prices are reasonable - 6 dollars for a medium sandwich, which is filling, and 8 dollars for a large, which none of my friends could finish. Plenty of options on the menu. So far I've tried the steak & cheese (pretty good) and the meatball (sauce a disappointment). Nothing to get excited about.

Crash Dive!
author: Jackson G.

description:
Who doesn't like a good a sandwich? I tried out the Yellow Submarine after hearing about it on a local TV show. I also heard that their sandwiches were paired with great fries so it was a must for me to visit. 
I ordered a Italian special and it was goood. I ate the medium size sandwich which was BIG, I could of ate only half and been good to go...but I didn't and just ate the whole thing cause it was damn good.  I don't even know what kind of people could eat a large size, it is definitely a sandwich that would need to be shared. The fries came out in "chip" or flat style, and they were really good. I immediately had to take a picture so I could show my friends later. A couple of these fries were about the same size as my Coke can! Some of the chips were crunchy and others were crunchy on the outside but soft on the inside. I didn't mind because I like the change up. But when I go in next time, I will probably ask for the fries well done, or crispy. I just hope it doesn't dry them out. 
This was my first time there, but I will definitely go back. I will leave them with 4 stars for now and hopefully be able to bring my rating to excellent after a couple more visits. I would definitely recommend the Yellow Submarine. 

EDIT: I have been there 6 times now, and I have figured out that I love the Italian combo, and really don't care to try anything else. I have tried the Steak and cheese sandwich and wasn't really impressed. 

Remember they take CASH ONLY but if you forget there are a couple of banks just down Irving Street.
author: John S.

description:
Not bad...I've only tried the Steak & cheese but perhaps I'll try some other things too.

They grill the breads in an oven that is hard to describe...It's a cross between a clay oven and something from Subways.

Pretty average quality bread but the toasting does make a difference.

Ingredients seem to be decent although this isn't exactly niman ranch steak or carne asada, per se.

Homemade hot sauce is pretty good.

The home fries they make could be better, IMHO...They come off a bit oily as others have mentioned and generally undercooked.

It's a reliable neighborhood sandwich shop when the mood strikes but nothing amazing.
author: Barca F.

description: With sandwiches in this city, yellow sub is at the top as far as I am concerned. Their Steak and Cheese is my personal favorite, but in all honesty they're all great. I had been Living in San Francisco for about 2 years before I discovered this place but now I get weekly cravings for it at least. The only reason I don't eat here more is because its cash only. 'Cash Only' is my pet peeve as I rarely carry more than a buck or two with me. But i guess its good they don't take Cards otherwise i would be in here every day and even more broke than I already am.
author: Josh B.

description:
Yellow Submarine definitely has great sandwiches, but it just didn't live up to the hype.

It's a nice little hole-in-the-wall place with good cheap sandwiches. The food will definitely satisfy you, but I wouldn't say it would "Wow" you. I got the steak sandwich and it was very tasty and a good size. It seems like a small, family owned place, and the people are really nice - I was even a little short on my bill because I didn't bring enough cash and the cashier said "don't worry about it."

If you're looking for a quick, tasty sandwich, this is a great place. If you're looking for the best sandwich in San Francisco, I'd say keep looking.

Next time I'd like to try some more of their sandwiches, and maybe get it to go and eat it in the park. I'd definitely go back for the prices, quick and friendly service, and yummy food.
author: Jacob and Brianne H.

description: This place is cheap for the amount you get. i'd get a sandwich here if I hadn't eaten all day and needed to feed a village in Cambodia. Some of the sandwiches can get greasy gross. This place isn't bad, but I think they could make the menu more interesting and change up the ingredients. To be quite honest, I think the name of this joint is more interesting than their sandwiches and that's the lure..Is it weird that each time I get a sandwich here I feel like it's missing something...
author: Justine C.

description: I love this place. The sandwiches are straight forward and delicious. I've never had a bad experience here!
author: Amy A.

description: Top notch pastrami in the UCSF/inner sunset neighborhood. Great munch for sitting on a stairway after a great night of drinking. Pastrami was moist, bread was flaky. What more do you want from a sandwich?
author: Phil C.

description: LOVE this place.   Sandwiches are the best.  Service is good.  The home made fries rock.   Italian Steak with the sauce-  out of this world.    Order the regular unless you are eating for three- then go for the large-  thing is mammoth.
author: D N.

description:
big sandwich 7.95 or 8.95.  why would you order the one for 7.95?  because you're delusional and think it might help you lose weight...i don't know.

always buy the larger one its one dollar more.  

they toast the bread and i like extra onions.
what to get?  anything is good but their pepper steak is fresh and very good.  its very healthy and tasty.  

parking is a pain but if you know the area its easy...um, i might have to keep my parking a secret but the place is VERY GOOD.  I especially like to get the pepper steak and also purchase a cole slaw to put on top of the sandwich for added veggies.
author: Bing D.

description:
Best sandwich shop on the west coast.
I only wish they had one in the Marina.
The pepper steak sandwich is my favorite 
Along with there homemade potato chip fries
That are so amazing.
Go yellow sub !!
author: Jane f.

description: I've been to this place twice and the last time I went, I got the corned beef. Very good sandwich. My friend got the pastrami which was delicious as well. Pretty messy sandwich place, but their hot sauce is really good. I can eat spicy food so next time I'm definitely going to ask for more.
author: Patrick P.

description: HUGE subs filled with great veggies and tasty meat or tuna. The price is a steal if you consider that each sub is easily two meals. The wrapping paper requires advanced technique to remove it and not throw anything of your sub!
author: Javi V.

description:
This review is over 20 years in the making, as a small child I used to come here with my parents... now as an adult living on my own back in the city, I still come here. 

I sometimes wish they weren't cash only but other than that I have no complaints. 

If you want a tasty (and rather large) sandwich, go here.
author: Genevieve P.

description: One of my absolute favorite places to go to for a great sandwich, made to order. Very simple sandwiches which taste phenomenal. They have the classics such as salami and what not. The bread was great, without being too soft or too hard. I also love the Beatles theme they incorporated into their restaurant. Overall, I think you should definitely check out Yellow Submarine for a great sandwich.
author: Alex L.

description:
I can't comment on 95% of the sandwich choices on the menu but, the steak and cheese sandwichs are the BEST.  Pair one with the thick fresh fried potato chips and my belly is soooo happy!  Ask for extra hot/spicy on the sandwiches...  yummy.
Who cares what "style" they are or what they are called ?  It's a sandwich.  What's up with all the Subway talk?!
author: Big B. W.

description:
It is a dirty place.  The service is bad but the sandwiches are great!
It is huge, hot and yummy.  They are like 3 X as big as your Subway and with whole lot more flavor.  It is the best sandwich is town.  MY favorite is the pastrami and Pepper Cheese Steak.  Very filling and juicy.   Skip the greasey and lifeless fries take the sandwiches out to enjoy them because you feel like you don't want to put your food on the table.  I haven't get sick from it so whatever bugs are in the food is not worse then most places.
author: Mar H.

description:
They have pretty good subs here... I have only gotten the cheese combo and the turkey so far. Its nice that when you ask to add avocado they actually put enough instead of just a slice or two.
I wasn't that in to the fries though, they weren't as crispy as I would have liked.
author: Jackie O.

description:
The steak and cheese sandwich that is offered here is the only sandwich I have ever eaten that has needed no fix-ups whatsoever. It tastes delicious straight from their hands to your tummy.

The family that owns The Yellow Submarine is quite friendly, and even though the place feels a bit run down, it never feels uninviting. Be sure to take a look at the old menu painted on the wall in seating area.

note: Order to the cook, and step aside
author: Laura L.

description: The sandwiches here come out warm and huge!  Menu is very simple. The best thing is that you don't have to starve waiting in a super long line.  Good price for a toasted sandwich.  Seating is not the best, but will do.
author: Fotos C.

description: What a pleasant surprise. Stopped by to grab a quick lunch and it was one of the best sandwiches I've had for a long time!!! I had the steak and cheese sandwich with fries. The value was excellent, juicy, great taste and very nice people serving..
author: wesam s.

description: Because this place was featured on "Check Please Bay Area" the other night, my boyfriend has a huge urge to try it. He was looking for something that's comparable to Hoagie Haven in Princeton, NJ. This place failed miserably. I should have not had high expectation, I tried not to, it still failed me. He togo-ed Italian Combo, Chicken, Steak, Pastrami w/ the works + special sauce, and a sides of potato fries. The portion is huger, but other than that the sandwich was tasteless. I wouldn't return here. Seriously. I rather have a Subway than here. At least they have a variety choices of bread. Anyways, the best sandwich I've ever had is in South San Francisco call Little Lucca. Try that, and you'll know what I am talking about.
author: MT D.

description: I got the steak and cheese w/o mustard, oil, pickles. Nice portion sizes and a great feel when your sitting inside. I came here before the lunch hour and still had to wait 10 minutes. I love the toasted bread and grilled onions.
author: Jason B.

description: This use to be so good but now it's very lackluster due to the competition it's got now. Picked up a Philly steak and cheese and it was good but it wasn't knock out great. Meat seemed a bit skimped. I gotta say $8 for the large can feed 2, but with it's competition packing in more meat, it's now only a 3 star.
author: Allan T.

description:
I visited for the first time today on the recommendation of a San Francisco native.  Being from the east coast, I was encouraged by seeing "Boston Style" on the signage outside.  We had to get there early, my friend said, before the lunch rush, so it was about 11:30.  We got there just before the line started forming. Though the true east coast test for me, a New Jersey native, would be to order an Italian "submarine" sandwich (ham, capicola, salami, provolone, with shredded lettuce, tomatoes, oil and vinegar), I wanted something HOT since I had skipped breakfast.   I ordered the medium meatball sandwich.   The question I got from the man behind the counter made me seriously doubt the east coast authenticity:  "Do you want everything on that?"  Inwardly I cringed.   This has happened to me at several other old time supposedly east coast style sandwich shops in California up and down the west coast.    Listen west coast people,  a hot sandwich--whether it is meatball, or chicken parmesan, or Italian sausage and pepper--should NOT be covered with cold lettuce, tomatoes, mayo mustard and unmelted cheese.  Kind of defeats the purpose of ordering hot food when you have cold food piled on top.   Don't get that? Then you must be from CA, but that's O.K.   Not to worry.  I just declined the long "everything" list to limit my order to be a hot meatball sandwich (no cold mustard salad on top). The order took a little longer than I expected, but when it arrived...!!!
The bread was lightly toasted to perfection, soft and warm, with a generous portion of meat filling.   This was the best meatball sandwich I have ever had on the west coast.  I will come back, for sure, and if their cold cuts impress me as much as this hot item did, then I will  add another star.        Bravo!   Or Brava, to the lady who made the sandwich.
author: Philip R.

description: we came on a sunday around noon time and managed to beat the rush. i got the veggie and the bf got the pastrami. the guy who took our order told us about their two hot sauces, the regular and the really hot house special. being the daredevils that we are ordered the latter on our sandwiches, and man were we disappointed. not only was it not really spicy, it was non spicy. all i tasted was saltiness. our sandwiches were otherwise solid though. the bread tasted great with a chewy texture. but i mean if you're gonna hype something up it should meet the expectations that come with it. just sayin.
author: Melissa Y.

description:
A few friends and I were sitting at Fireside Bar a block away watching Game 5 of the World Series. We started to get hungry, so my friend phoned in an order to Yellow Sub for a few sandwiches for pickup.

I rarely eat a hot toasted sandwich and I was not disappointed with my medium size hot pastrami. Furthermore, it went perfect with a glass of Guinness. If I'm ever in the area again, I am definitely coming back to try the other selections.

If you get the sliced potatoes, make sure you eat those immediately when they're hot. The potatoes get hard, and dry once they cool down.
author: G L.

description:
Atmosphere: Typical sandwich shop. Not so crowded with a couple of tables. Clean. Recycles!

Service: Asked for extra crispy potato fries. Got extra crispy. What more could I ask for?

Food: Steak & Cheese. Yum! Hot pastrami. Not bad.

Overall: Good, in the neighborhood, sandwich shop for a good price.
author: Jimmy N.

description: Very small place, so good for take-out and a quick 5 min walk to GG Park to enjoy.  Medium sandwich was huge & only $6!!  Super yummy subs that are all served toasted.  I get mine with the works and try to eat it all.
author: Autumn C.

description:
Best Boston Style subs I have ever had. My favorite sub, and I have tried their other sandwiches, for my money nothing beats their Italian Steak with everything on it. But I can never really finish an order of fries.

Gotta support the old mom & pop restaurants of the city.
author: Eric T.

description:
Subs are really good - I love the hot sauce. 

Be prepared for the incredibly grumpy old lady behind the counter. She seems to hate it when your order extras (avocado) or a second sub.
author: sunshine c.

description:
Yes I've come to love a cally sandwich with avocado, aoli, sprouts, and fancy cheese all on wheat bread.  But I am from the east coast, so, sometimes I need a real sandwich.  A Sub.  This place makes them just right.  The only problemo is that they have a tiny front area and zero organization skills.  You have to stand huddled in a group of people all confused and hungry wondering about when you're going to get wrung-up and when you're going to be able to tell someone wether you want pickles or not.  And it doesn't get easier the more you've been there, it's always an ordering, paying, stating mustard toss up.  It's irritating to say the least.  I recommend you call ahead. But, in the end these subs will melt your irritation away with deliciousness anyhow.  And get the fries, you'll die of happiness.

Conclusion: If you are from the east coast, you will be in heaven here. You like to be irritated and then soothed, it's in your blood.  If you are not, you probably don't see what all the hub-bub is about.
author: Leonardo P.

description: I've been eating here since 1987, and I still find their subs to be the best by far in all of San Francisco.  They've clearly been family owned this entire time, and the place has a unique charm all its own, especially the yellow submarine murals which have been there as long as I can remember.  All their sandwiches are done 'Boston style' so they're oven baked and crispy with cheese and with many optional toppings.  They also are the only place I've ever seen that makes fries the way they do, cutting potatoes into whole slices--watch out, they're addictive.  Oh, and the customer service is always quite friendly, and you can call ahead for pickup to avoid the line which is usually there (cuz the food is so good, of course).
author: Jason F.

description: The food here is amazing.  Best sub place in the city.  I especially love their avocado and their roast beef.  I have cravings for this place sometimes.  I dream about these subs.  I always get them with the works with provolone.  The only reason I gave them four stars instead of five stars is because they don't have a bathroom from what I understand and sometimes that can be an issue.
author: Heather K.

description: Yellow Submarine is indeed a good sandwich. I had the ham and it was delicious, and it was a good size sandwich for the price. The only thing stopping me from giving this place 5 stars is that I wish they had a little more variety as far as cheese, bread, and vegetables. It was all very basic, but nonetheless very tasty.
author: Katie S.

description: I got this place is authentic w/ decent history. Should be respectful to the owners. But, to be candid w/ taste, I think it's overrated.
author: Woosung A.

description:
The Yellow Submarine definitely hits the spot! Out of all the times I've been here, I have never been disappointed. The medium sized sandwich is more than enough to fill my appetite... and I like to eat a lot. One of these days I'm gunna have to try and open the flood gates to a large, lol.

Anyway, my personal fave and recommendation is the steak & cheese w/provolone, potato slices, and an ice cold Diet Coke. Just make sure to eat the potato slices right away since they turn soggy after a while.
author: Dette S.

description: this is my ideal kind of sandwich place, except that there's not really a great option for my vegetarian husband. i had the italian combo and one bite was enough to have me salivating for this place whenever i'm in the neighborhood. i love the whole dive-y feel of the place. staff were super nice, happy to make suggestions and expedient with the crowds. i think the sliced fried potatoes are crave-able and would highly recommend this place to any sandwich lover.
author: May-Ling G.

description:
I'm not sure why people like this place. The sub I had was dry and overcooked - the bread was also pretty stale. I felt like I was eating in my high school cafeteria again. 

I'll come one more time in the future - I study a lot at tart, so its conveniently close - and review it again.
author: Josh M.

description: Good sized subs at an awesome price. Yummo.
author: Tyrone L.

description: Stopped by after work to order their Reuben sandwich, and wow, that really filled me up.  Ordered the medium and it was $6.46 w/tax, but half of the medium sandwich was enough for one sitting.  The bread is what sets this place apart from a place like Subway, and so does the hot sauce.  While I was there, some little too friendly Costa Rican dude who slightly resembled a petite Spanish version of Daniel Farraday from LOST who was waiting in line next to me started asking me questions about my nationality and out of nowhere gave me a hug. . . An interesting time waiting for my sandwich at The Yellow Submarine. . . Will go to this place again and try some more of their other sandwiches, but hopefully Costa Rican dude and I will not cross paths.
author: Kahanalei M.

description: Went in today for the first time because a friend suggested it.  I ordered a medium avocado with no cheese, and my fiance ordered a steak and cheese.  I'm not a vegetarian, so I tried his steak and cheese --- YUM!!!  They put the beef and onions on the grill fresh, and chopped them all up together and it was soooo good.  Like a party in my mouth -- but I still thought the avo without cheese was excellent.  Since they put so much other yummy stuff on it, it doesn't even need the cheese.  And the fried potato slices were delicious too.    All in all an excellent Sunday afternoon lunch.
author: Ashley S.

description: I have not been here since the 70's and not sure of when in that decade is gradually coming back to me was a little fuzzy. All kidding aside had a hot Boston sub for 5.95 a medium hot pastrami on a nicely toasted roll and it was as though I was reliving some of my youth. It was great everyone in my group was happy. It probably has changed hands a lot since then don't know. They kept the same hippie sort of decor. We went in early just before lunch and by the time we left the line was forming out the door is a small door.
author: William S.

description: Had the steak and cheese and pastrami. Subs were great and people were super nice. Would like more meat though.
author: Joshua K.

description: Decent subs, generous portions, no frills, didn't live up to the hype.   If  bread, meat and cheese is all you're looking for, then this is it.  But you'll find more variety at a Subway or the deli counter of Safeway.
author: Chad M.

description:
If you've ever been to The Freshly Baked Eatery in Downtown San Jose, The Yellow Submarine is pretty much on par with that.

The Medium size was good enough to fill me up. I finished my first half and I was so into it I was like "Oh please let me just have some more sandwich to eat..."  all the while not even REALIZING that no more than 2 inches to my right lay an equally hearty and delicious half of my turkey sub. Sort of embarrassing, but what a relief eh?

As far as the potatoes go, kind of a cross between potato chips and fries. They're just alright. Not worth 2 bucks.
author: Cole S.

description: I was in a foul mood after not being served at the Hugo Cafe'.  So I went here and they took care of business promptly with a sandwich that was warm and tasty on nice bread.  This is how one stays in business.  Thanks Yellow Submarine!
author: Scott A.

description:
Best sandwiches in the city!!! The bread is crunchy, but warm and soft at the same time!!! :) There are two different hot sauce choices... I would suggest a mixture of them both... it really does the sandwich wonders! The service is amazing because the guy taking orders is always cheerful and inviting. 

The one complaint I  have is that they run out of avocados too often.
author: Nicole C.

description: Ummmmm this place was pretty damn good, ordered the pepper steak sandwich and it was almost as good as sex. If you are looking for a great sandwich spot in the city, this is the place. I also have to recommend the fries, they are a little strange looking but equally delicious!
author: Louie T.

description: One of the best values. Enormous whole sandwiches, filling halves. The best part is the toasted bun and individualized orders. I had a to-go order to be consumed hours later; they wrapped the lettuce and tom separately! Cash only, ATM next door. Sandwich and a forty is the perfect recession picnic in GGP.
author: YearOf M.

description:
If you are vegan, vegetarian, or have a place in your heart for baby cows, I suggest you stop reading...

VEAL PARMESAN.

Holy beachfront property, Batman, it's sandwich-craft Forget the pyramids, Washington Monument, the Louvre, the Taj Mahal, and all of the half finished buildings in Dubai. This is one of the best, if not the best (hu)man-made creation. The bread soaks up some of the marinara, and the breaded veal with the parmesan. I can barely organize coherent thoughts thinking about this.

I'll go through the ritual: I've been sitting at my computer for the day, doing inane internet work, and this epiphany dawns on me "Yellow submarine, Veal parm...NOW" so I put on whatever clothing I can find, a dapper ensemble consisting of stained pants and a faded shirt, accompanied by holy(!) socks and one of 9 pairs of black chucks. I sprint to my poorly designed, soon to be ignored American vehicle, and start on the 15 minute drive to get there. I calculate the creation time and call when I'm at 19th and Holloway. Phone answers "Yellow submarine." Me: "Large veal parm with everything" "You got it", "I'll be there in ten". DONE. I find a suspicious parking spot just a few inches shorter than my car and I sprint in. I drop a ten-spot with the biggest grin on my face since the Red Flyer days of my youth, see he agrees with my sentiment and hear "That's a helluva sandwich" and I respond with a hearty "Damn right!" and I sprint to my car. 

To make a long story short it goes like this: speed home, sit, remove excess clothing that inhibits arm and mandible movement, open the paper, consume the sandwich stem to stern and basically spend 20 minutes in a haze of splendor, whose magnitude I can barely put into words. 

Go there. Eat. Sit in a wobbly chair. Read the wall 23 times. Cry at the fact that you can't always be eating a large veal parm with everything, and then sleep outside so you can go back for dinner.

Oh yea, everything else there is amazing too. But you're reading this, and not calling in your order. Shame.
author: Jeremy B.

description:
I had long heard hype about this place, so I was quite happy when it came time for my turn to try it.

I looked through the sandwich selection, and was most impressed.....there were so many things I wanted to try. 

I finally decided upon a Meatball sub, as that was one of the main things I had heard about...how they heated the meat up fresh and pressed it flat onto the bun...it sounded good. I had also heard that the large was a bit too large, so to go for the medium.

Well, here came my first disappointments. The "meatballs" were waiting in a pan with sauce sitting on the grill top staying warm, and the medium was much smaller than i expected, in fact, i was still really hungry afterward. 

The sandwich was OK at best, but what really turned me off was that I was certain that i tasted ketchup in the sauce, and to me that is just a COMPLETE TURN-OFF! I DO NOT like it when a company goes cheap and uses ketchup instead of tomato sauce.

Needless to say, while I may return to try some of the other selections(and that big selection is what gives it three stars), i was not really pleased as the place did NOT live up to the rep it had been given.
author: Ruben S.

description:
I have been going to this place for almost 20 years and have found that the quality of sandwiches and customer service is consistent (i.e. superb).

The prices have also remained very reasonable over the years.
author: Javi L.

description: Pretty good sandwiches. The homemade fries need to be cooked a little longer. The bread is good, just wish there were more options. Small dine in area, but golden gate park is right down the street so get it to go
author: Andrew M.

description: Sandwiches are ok.  The bread was toasted just right but I felt the meat:bread ratio was a bit low....too little meat too much bread.  I ordered the italian combo large and shared it with the bf and we both agree that it is nothing spectacular to make our taste buds jump.   I would come here if I were in the area but probably not to just buy a submarine sandwich.
author: judy l.

description:
Yellow Submarine is my favorite sub sandwich shop period. 
As a San Francisco native, I've been eating here since I was 4 years old (I'm 26) and I've never been disappointed.

Family owned, they will make your sandwich the way you want it. They are fast and reasonably priced. A large sandwich is just that.

My favorite sandwiches are the Steak and cheese, Turkey, and American combo.
author: Crow T.

description: Sandwiches are pretty big. I usually get the steak sandwich with their potato sliced fries. Fries are a bit greasy, but who cares... eat first! :) Best to order by phone and go pick it up since parking might be a little hard on Irving St.
author: Nancy N.

description: This is the homiest little sandwich place tucked away in the inner Sunset. I'm guessing that it is family owned since I always see the familiar faces of an old lady and her son every time I stop by. They are very friendly and will make your sandwich to your exact specifications. I also try to eat here whenever I visit home. Their subs are amazingly good and are made to order. You can never go wrong with steak and cheese with the works (minus the mayo for me). The pepper steak and cheese is also very good. They give you plenty of meat and the size of the sandwich is bigger than it looks. Go for a medium and you will be pretty full. Opt for the large as I always do and you're probably overdoing it. The most unique thing about this place? I think it's their potato fries/chips. They are not your usual steak fries or shoestring fries. They are round cut and are the perfect thickness. They are lightly salted and a perfect side to go with your delicious sandwich. They have little squeeze bottles of ketchup and if you look around you, you will see people dressing their fries in many different ways. Since they have such a fat cut, you will see kids drawing happy faces on them and ketchup lovers building a mountain before eating them. For me, I swirl my ketchup on my fry.
author: Bailey Z.

description: Growing up in NJ a good sub was a treat that I always looked forward to. Yellow Sub lives up that to that same feeling from years ago. Definitely worth a try. (Steak & Cheese w/a dab of homemade hot sauce)
author: surya y.

description: Their meatball sub is one helluva two-fisted sandwich! Eat one these and I'm not hungry again for days!
author: Stephen K.

description:
Best sandwich I've EVER had. God. So good.

The "fries" are almost as good. Ask for extra crispy if you like that that way, other wise you'll only get maybe half the batch coming out crispy.

Great service from old-school staff who take their sweet time (in a good way) crafting your sandwich. This isn't Subway, you will have to wait a few. 

But it is so worth it. I hope this place never closes. Man, I'm going there right now . . .
author: Pink F.

description:
Inner Sunset's version of the famous Submarine Center in West Portal, my favorite sandwich shop in the area.  They make the same kind of toasted bread, hot sub sandwiches with great toppings.  Even the menu board looks like the same font, perhaps done by the same person generations ago.

A few notable differences:  
- Larger seating area.  It has all of the charm of a church rec-room (no frills), but at least it's not crowded.  When I went, it was occupied by men in their late 30's/early 40's only.  Like the mafia-esque Men's Clubs that are all over Hoboken NJ (think Sopranos)
- Two sizes of sandwiches, instead of 3.  Medium and Large.  Large is HUGE.  For $7.25 for a large, enough to feed two people, that's quite a bargain.
- No jalapenos.  I panicked as my husband must have these on his cheese steak, and it's my job to make sure they're on there.  No worries!  They have a great home-made hot sauce  which is delicious and offers a very satisfying kick.
- More chewy less crusty bread.  I actually liked the bread better than at the Submarine Shop, because the toasty bits didn't threaten to rip up my mouth at all.
- They offer a Reuben, but without Thousand Island dressing.  To me, this means, they DON'T offer a Reuben.  A corned beef or pastrami sandwich?  Sure.
- Fries.  I've read that they are good.  The fryer wasn't on (it was 4pm, so only me and the sandwich junkies were out getting sandwiches anyway).  I'll try these next time, and if they're good, I'll consider rounding up to 5 stars.
- ATM at the entrance, right by the front door.  If you are like me and constantly cash-less, this is a very nice convenience.

I highly recommend:  Cheese Steak with everything + hot sauce, Italian Combo with everything.

I do not recommend: the Veal Parmesan.  Blah.  Stick to the sliced meat sandwiches.

Service was East-Coast-style friendly.  Meaning, it was factual and to the point while we negotiated what they had vs. what I wanted.  Then, when business was concluded, we had a nice chat.  They greeted some customers by name, which I liked a lot.  

There is a big public parking lot up the street on 6th, which is extremely convenient as I've left this neighborhood more than once for lack of parking.

Nothing tastes better on a rainy and cold day than a warm, well-made, sandwich, esp when you are a bit *ahem* hung over from a fabulous party the night before (or so I HEAR ;) ).  Yellow Submarine will definitely be on my list for sought-after comfort foods on such days, and I am sure many others.
author: Liz S.

description: No pun intended, but Yellow Submarine is a bit of a dive. I lied . . . pun intended, but it's warranted. This is one of those places that isn't noticeably dirty but still doesn't feel quite clean. As for the food, call them what you will, but a hero, sub, grinder, and hoagie are pretty much the same, the name based more on geography than style. That they toast their bread once gave them distinction, but Subway is doing that now, and I'm a little less leery about eating there, although I would sneak in here for an order of the popular fries, which earns them an extra star.
author: Gourmet G.

description:
My friend took me here last week. Oh. My. Gosh. 
I can't believe I've lived in The City for 5 years without knowing about this place.
I got the smaller size Ruben sandwich.  When it came up, I thought they had accidentally given me the big one... nope, it was the small one!  Half of it, and I wasn't hungry for the rest of the day.  Plus, it was Delicious with a capital D. 
I'm definitely going back!
author: Laurel K.

description: ~We all  live in a yellow submarine~  The food here is simple and in large serving.  Although to me, the large and regular size look about the same.  I had the bell pepper steak and its basically philly cheesesteak with bell peppers and onions.  The cheese is slightly lacking, but since I am slightly lactose intolerant anyway, its good for me.  I like the mural in the eating room, although it does amuse me on how much the price of the sandwich increase since the shop started.  Next time I will try the Italian steak, I heard its even better.  (I was slightly amused by the bottled water though, apparently they received a defected batch, thus we can't drink it sports bottle style and thus have to drink it by pour it in a cup.)
author: Jim H.

description: I've had better but these sands are nothing to scoff at. the size of them, geez louise ! the supersized one feeds me for 2 lunches and a dinner. I love their salami and avocado, what a masterpiece ! if you have them hold the mayo you can reheat as often as you'd like and the bread will be toasty perfect. remember people, this is a sandwich and not a gourmet dish. judge accordingly
author: Prima D.

description: corner sandwich shop distinguished by bright yellow...immediate order counter upon entrance to right...place an order and wait an eternity...watching yellow walls and car illegally parked...waiting and noticing a car about to pull out...driving car over to park legally now...listening to music and loitering on corner sidewalk...peeking in through outside window...watching which sandwich is under construction now...stroll inside to observe the inside dinning area to the left...patrons working on mouthing the enormous fat sandwiches...waiting and waiting, and nothing else to do, but wait...truly an eternal wait for sandwich and fries...steak & cheese sandwich in large size ordered...mildly seasoned slivers of steaks piled on high between toasty bread...a simple good sandwich, but the novelty of a "big" yellow submarine...a large sandwich enough to feed two men or maybe three girls...a bag of fries round, soft, limp and poor...wouldn't recommend unless liking soft fries...
author: Hen A.

description:
Now take into account i have only lived in SF for 1 year and a half, but i know my sandwiches... Don't question that. I believe a truly great sandwich is hard to find, but The Yellow Submarine  left me speechless.

Originally i was angry because they didn't carry bacon... What kind of sandwich shop doesn't have BACON????!!!! But my girlfriend ordered me the Italian steak sub and i can tell you right now it is as of yesterday the best sandwich that has ever touched my lips in the 415... So far...
author: Joe W.

description:
These guys would get five stars if they: 1. could tell me why the subs are called "boston style" (I'm from Boston and have no idea.  To be honest, they did tell me why, and it was because the original owner was from Boston) and 2: didn't try to offer me "everything" on my meatball sub.  Big mistake.

Those issues notwithstanding, the food here is awesome.  The first thing I noticed was the bread.  Most sub places (at least in Boston!) give you mediocre bread that you would never eat by itself.  Not the case here.  The bread makes the sub, and Yellow Submarine's bread is crusty and toasty and just delicious.  The meatball sub was good overall (it would have been a lot better if I had eaten it before it got to room temperature, but that was my fault).

I got an order of fries, which is a great deal for less than two dollars.  I really liked them, but I have strange taste in fries.  They're like thick cut potato chips.  They come out pretty soggy, but I like them that way.

Thanks Yellow Submarine!
author: Molly C.

description: I've always passed by the place, but never been to it until maybe a year ago. The sandwich was decent, no lies, but the lady who made my sandwich did not wash her hands after dealing with my money. It was sickening to watch her make my sandwich with dirty hands. Pretty gross if you ask me... I give this place 2 stars for having a DECENT sandwich, but other than that, it is plain gross to make a sandwich after dealing with money or anything.
author: Edgar G.

description: Oh em gee. This place is god send. Giant sandwiches for an excellent price! They only come in Medium or Large, no Small. A Large is $8. My friend and I are complete fat asses and we were both able to get full off of splitting a large pastrami sandwich and a basket of fresh cut fries. If you like potatoes as much as I do, you will love these fries. It's a giant hot steaming potato chip, always made fresh. Everytime I come here even at odd hours, there is at least a small line. $15 for a large sandwich, potatoes, and 2 sodas for 2 people. Parking is not too bad. You might not find something on the same block but there are spaces scattered here and there.
author: Mei C.

description: I've been coming here for years.  The pepper steak with an order of fries is awesome.  The roll is toasted in the oven with cheese melted on it.  Then it's loaded with steak and bell peppers cooked on the griddle along with all of the fixings.  I noticed that the bread is sometimes different, but it's great either way.  The fries are literally a whole potato sliced just right and deep fried to get a little crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside.  I usually just phone in and pick up.  It is still great to-go.  It's a shame there isn't more than one location.
author: K L.

description:
Stopped by for lunch since I happened to miss my stop on the MUNI.
Ordered the steak and cheese (large, $8).  The sucker was HUGE. So lets get on to the eats:
BREAD: nicely toasted, soft on inside, but they don't offer a selection.
Steak and cheese: quite good
Next time I will ask for their special sauce.
author: Nane K.

description: I absolutely adore Yellow Submarine.  Besides being the tastiest sub sandwich I have have ever eaten, that fact that it is Beatles inspired is just an added bonus.  The bread melts in your mouth, and the potato salad I always get on the side is de-li-cious! I love chatting with the owners and have always left there with a satisfied smile.  Tell a friend.
author: Dianna I.

description: This ain't no crappy Subway sammich.  Best bread hands down, consistently good no matter if you get the Italian or the Steak and Cheese.  A medium is definitely a lot of food, but why not just get the large and see if you can finish it.  I used to live in the neighborhood and went there every Saturday for lunch.  Now I live in North Beach and make the N Judah trek out just to get one of their "grindahs" - as we say back in Providence....
author: Rob K.

description: yellow submarine definately has a rock star status in my book.  Their avocado sandwhich is delicious and their house hots are perfectly spicy.  the frech fries are also glorious for they are actual real potatos.  if i were you i would make yellow sub a 'hump day' ritual.
author: Sarah E.

description:
my sandwich was glorious. i got the steak and cheese and split it with my boyfriend. everyone is right, that thing is HUGE. it's delicious. i will definitely be back.

the bread is toasted, the meat is awesome, and i agree with what someone else said about the glorious sauce they put in it. it is like crack cocaine. it's that good.

i just ate this sandwich (well half of it) 5 minutes ago. i am sooooooo full. and happy. thank you yellow submarine.
author: Margaret L.

description: Didn't like it.  If it's your first time, don't put the hot sauce in your sandwich... will totally ruin your experience.  It'll take some time for me to go back and give this place another try.  (I had the chicken sub--not much flavor going on)
author: Grace M.

description:
I was always told that the best food comes from the smallest hole-in-the-wall places. The Yellow Submarine just proves that theory correct. 

I was in town visiting my cousin who lives across the street and who I'm going to be moving in with soon, and he had suggested that we go to lunch there on my last day in San Francisco. So I go in there, and order a Veal Parmesan sandwich. The first bite into it was absolutely breathtaking. I am an avid fan of veal sandwiches, and i usually get one in every city that i go and visit. But this has most definitely given the vast majority of the places I've eaten at a run for its money.  I HIGHLY recommend this place and I cannot wait until I move to that city and am able to indulge in it on a regular basis.
author: Michael H.

description: It's a good place to get a sandwich in a pinch if you've just hiked around golden gate park.   I had the italian sub and it was good.  Size large is huge too so you better have a big appetite.
author: Jeff H.

description: Fucking amazing. Get the Pepper Steak sub, everything on it- w/ home-made chili sauce- this is what makes any sandwich on the menu stand out from any other in the world. So good. Very friendly family too. Cash Only- yet Chase and Wells Fargo ATMs within two blocks.
author: Tanner M.

description: Big sandwiches. Not spectacular, but not bad either. I dislike that they only take cash!
author: Lily Z.

description: My friends took me here when we were heading over to the De Young museum.  The sandwich was surprisingly good.  I expected super hard bread and a so-so meal, but was pleasantly surprised.  The sandwiches are large, so a 12 incher is good for 2 people.  I normally get a 12 inch at Subway, but 6 inches is all I can take from this place.
author: Shaun W.

description: I LOVE THE PASTRAMI!! =) I have only ordered a different sandwich from Yellow Sub once, and it was the meatball which was decent. The pastrami is soooooo damn good tho. They throw the pastrami on the griddle with onions so the onions are nice and soft and flavorful. If you get a large sandwich be prepared for a feast!! The large is actually the size of two fairly large sandwiches. I like that they put hot sauce on there for an added kick too. They also have slammin fries, just thinly sliced potato rounds fried til soft... while a little on the greasy side, they hit the spot. My number two favorite behind Sub Center.
author: Troy K.

description: The Yellow Submarine is very conveniently located in my neighborhood and after about two years of walking past it I finally decided to go in. The sweet old lady behind the counter was very efficient when I was in a hurry which is always a plus! I got the steak and cheese which is a nice piece of steak that is seared on the flattop grill and chopped up. the cheese is toasted onto the bread first so it is nicely melted. it was topped with lettuce and mayo, mustard, hot sauce, oil, red wine vinegar, salt and pepper. the result is quite tasty... some advice is to eat it right away, the half i had on the way to work was a million times better then the half I saved for lunch... kind of a no brainer but worth knowing nonetheless. Great place for a quick bite. But as an expat from Boston, I don't know about the "Boston style sub" that they claim, i've had better in beantown.
author: Margot K.

description: I will never return to Yellow Submarine, no matter how many good reviews it gets. My hopes were high, and so was I, so I expected a great grinder during my visit. Alas, I got sick from the greasiest Pastrami sandwich ever made. Seriously, it felt like someone punched me in the gut. The place had a dirty sheen too, like no one knew how to wipe away the dust bunnies in the corners. yuck.
author: Jon F.

description: I heart Yellow Submarine!  For one thing the name itself is pure gold and I love all the stuff painted on the walls and references to the movie. I always order the steak and cheese with extra hot sauce. SO YUMMY! It takes a quick second to make the sandwiches because they toast the bread and grill the onions to order, but you can call ahead if you're in a hurry. Parking really sucks in the area so see if you can get someone to go with you, then have them circle the block while you jump out and grab some toasty, cheesy deliciousness.
author: Melanie V.

description:
oh YS, i miss you so much that it hurts. 

i had to stop going to you because you're one of my ex boyfriend's favorite places, and upon splitting with him we also split up "our places". i got little lucca's and he got you. you are like a child i lost visiting rights to. and i am like that scorned mother that will always talk shit about your father. but alas, you're better than that. you're above it. i hope your dad is treating you right.

i remember the way your counterperson was so efficient in making my roast beef and provolone on dutch crunch with the works, and how my turkey, avocado, and swiss on french roll was always done quickly yet neatly. when i first visited you, i thought the counterperson didn't hear my preferences because she never looked up and it may interfere with her own zen sandwich creating rhythm, but she got it right the first time! 

it was love at first sight. 
you will always be perfect in my heart. 
knowing you and missing you has made me stronger.
author: Vanessa D.

description: This place is awesome!  The food is sooooo good.  Think schlotzsky's, but fresh.  The price is good, it's a block away from the N-Judah in a kick ass neighborhood.  What more could you want?
author: Daniel H.

description: Wholy Moley! went here for lunch yesterday with the BF...i pass by here almost everyday when i ride the N Line and its always looked good....so i ordered the medium turkey with the works and he ordered the large rueben with fries (i opted for potato salad) we could of almost shared a large because the medium was huge itself! i love their bread how its grilled and its loaded with veggies! the fries were awesome.....fresh cut potatoes deep fried yet not greasy at all! i will definately go here more often now!! oh and the prices are right on as well!
author: shannon b.

description:
My feet are pretty nasty.  Not that they're deformed or insanely huge, but since I'm almost always wearing flip-flops they tend to get quite calloused and dirty.  Luckily I bathe everyday.  So when Bam-Bam and I decided to have a picnic in the park today, we stopped by the Yellow Submarine for some goodies.  Our sandwiches were quickly made by friendly people, a couple of drinks and some of the really-greasy-yet-really-good fried potatoes, and we were out the door and on our way to the Botanical Gardens in GG Park.  What does this have to do with my feet?
Well, when we sat down and started devouring our sandwiches, Bam-Bam almost had a piece of salami shoot out her nose because of how disgusted she was with my feet.  What's a boy to do?  We'd been walking through the park on dusty trails for almost two hours...no amount of explaining could get me off the hook.  Luckily for her I tucked my feet under me in an Indian sit, and luckily for me she was WAY too into her sandwich to really care all that much.  
Yellow Submarine...not the best sandwiches in the world, but for a decent enough picnic lunch in the park, it's ok.  I still would rather have a sandwich from Say Cheese...mmm...now THOSE are good!
author: Zev K.

description: I live in close proximity to the Yellow Sub, and while they aren't world renowned subs, they are quite good.  My personal favorite is the turkey with swiss.  I cannot say enough about how yummy their fries are.  They cut the potatoes in length-wise strips, and man, are they de-lish!!!  Probably not the healthiest of meals, but satisfying in deed :)
author: J B.

description: The Yellow Submarine has pretty good sandwiches. The prices are very reasonable for a nice and toasty sandwich. I usually order the turkey or the avocado sandwiches. They definitely don't disappoint. Sometimes it does take a while for the sandwiches to come out, but this usually happens when they are busy. Their sandwiches are nice, but sometimes they pack on a lot of vegetable opposed to the "star" of the sandwich, such as the turkey and avocados. Their round-cut potato slices do fall short in my opinion. They are surely freshly-cut, but they aren't really crispy and are just kind of round-sliced potatoes that have been fried. Sometimes they aren't crispy. But then again, it is a sandwich place.
author: Vivian L.

description: Pretty Solid Sub spot.  The one caveat is that in my humble opinon, you really have to get the works (everything) on the sandwich in order to capture the essence of what it is that makes it good.  Leave out a few things and you lose the synergy and you'd knock it down a notch. Try these sandwiches with the works, you might surprise yourself.
author: A D.

description: This place is okay, comparing it to Little Luccas in South City, it has nothing on the special pesto sauce they put on their sandwich. I just like the chips/fries but I honestly like Subway's better.
author: Tam T.

description: I'm not the biggest fan in the world of Yellow Submarine... The sammies are pretty good but I've definitely had better. I guess I'm more of a deli sandwich kind of gal, not so much the grilled sandwich kind of gal. The most popular is probably the chicken sandwich, which includes grilled onions, hot sauce, and the regular sandwich condiments. The main reason I'm not a fan is because I HATE onions and hot sauce. Now if you like these two ingredients and think they would sound great on a grilled sandwich I would run right over to yellow submarine and order yourself one!! As for me, I would much rather walk down the street and go to Pluto's any day.
author: Sarah T.

description:
excellent sandwiches for cheap!! its been awhile since i went but i tried the spicy chicken and remembered it tasting reallyyy good :) i looooove toasted subs, screw subway and their "toasted" sandwiches! quiznos comes close but ain't nothing like a hole in the wall sandwich shop.

i've tried going back a few times but always forgot they close REALLY early.. since they're family owned and all.. i think they close at 7 or 8 and all day sunday or something. damn it. so plan your trips, or just go at lunch time to make sure you catch 'em.
author: Jennie L.

description: This place is so good. I grew up on the north shore of Boston and this is definitely the closest you will get to a Boston style cheese steak/ sub shop experience in SF, get a CS with everything on it.
author: john s.

description: I am the Earl of Sandwich and I dub The Yellow Submarine.....Mediocre. I wanted my steak and cheese to be gooey, or greasy, or you know, have flavor. Boy was I let down.
author: Ricky J.

description: I had an great hot pastrami sandwhich.  my friend says this is her favorite sandwhich shop.  the only reason i don't give it five stars is because its cash only
author: Jennifer A.

description: This place has really good sandwiches. I got a turkey and salami sub with lettuce, onions and American mustard. Standard fair, but really well put together. The bread was really tasty as well. The fried potato slices are phenomenal. I mean, really, really good. I've passed by this place for years and I finally went in. I am certainly glad I did.
author: Erik S.

description:
The place so good I drive from Berkeley to eat here. I've been a fan for a long time and it's Elle's favoritte sandwich place. I get the rueben and she gets the cheese. They are a fair price when you consider how big they are.

This is the place for people who love East Coast sandwiches
author: Brian J.

description: Medium veal parmagiana (with the works + provolone) + tater salad + can of Aranciata = happy and full belly.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Best pepper cheese steak I've had yet in the city, and I'm used to cheesesteaks made in Philly!  yum
Great prices, too!
author: Lita M.

description:
Every time my friends and I go to a Giants game, we stop here before heading to the ballpark. I always either get their Reuben or Pepper Steak Sandwich. Their sandwiches are huuuuuuge. Forget the footlong. This thing is like loooong. The sandwich makers know how to fill it up. They aren't stingy at all whatsoever. They truly fill their sandwiches with meat and veggies and so on. Everything is fresh and they ask if you want it toasted or fresh. Toasted duh. 

Their sandwiches aren't that flavorful but it fills you up. The meat is good. I think everything on the menu is great. I've had a bite here and there from almost all the sandwiches. But the Reuben or Pepper Steak is the way to go. Just be prepared to sit on the throne: the toilet. hahaha. It'll be worth it. Always is. 

Small seating area but its more of a grab to go kind of place. Eat it with something to wash down with. Parking sucks since it's the streets of SF and metered. So do what you want. They are pretty quick.
author: Philbert K.

description: This is a great neighborhood sub shop and would be great for folks heading into the park.  Sure some days there is a line, but that's because the place isn't very big, most of the space is open for tables.  Every time I have gone they have been super nice and friendly even when they're getting a mad rush.  I would suggest, if you're in a hurry and you see a line to head somewhere else, but if you have a few minutes seriously go.  The size of the subs are huge and if you get the chips, you wont be hungry for a long long time.  The coleslaw and potato salad is great too. (personal favorite is the pepper stake)
author: aaron a.

description: Takes a little while but the subs are great. Lots of dressings come standard, yet it's not overwhelming. I can vouch for the hot pastrami and Swiss cheese. Four stars.
author: Andrew B.

description:
this is one of the better local sandwich shops in city.  the place offers great fresh sandwiches for a very reasaonable price.  the food is plentyful & will leave you full.  the seating is pretty good & the decor is 70's retro.  i always get a good chuckle at the decor & remember this place back in the 70's,  honestly it has not changed much through the years.  

i typically order the large pastrami & my wife gets the regular cheese steak with all the standard fixins.  the hot sauce is pretty tasty but not uber hot.  the bread is crispy & chewy.  the french fries are very good, they cut the potatoes in chips so you get these fried circles.  best eaten when they come out of the fryer with mayo &/or malt vinegar.  

the prices can not be beat as you leave there with alot of food for your money.  the service is friendly & fast.  the parking is difficult sometimes in this area.  there is a parking lot around the corner.  they only accept cash & they close when they run out of bread so be warned.
author: larry s.

description: I don't get it. Is there a secret sandwich shop in the back of this one? I have been here twice now and both times utterly unsatisfied. You call this a sandwich? Huh?!? Try Little Lucca's or AK subs or heck even subway. I feel like this is the Sanjaya Malakar of Yelp. I was tricked. Why must the reviews for this place be so misleading. ugh.
author: KY L.

description: I just had the chance to drop by this place . Their sandwiches are one of the best that I've had . The place looks pretty ragged and run-down but don't let its looks fool ya ! They have a lot of interesting unique sandwiches . & they're big too ! A medium which is only around $5 something will already fill you up . Add another $1.90 and it's a large . Imagine how bloated you will be lol . I love how they use french bread for your sandwiches instead of the cheap white bread and sourdough rolls lol . And I also love how their bread was not hard to bite into . It was nice and chewy . Another thing I like about this place is that they toast their sandwiches . This place rocks , I'm totally coming back and bringing a friend along with me .
author: Eileen L.

description: It's reminds me a bit of the Seinfeld soup-nazi episode.  It takes a few visits to really get the system down, order the base sub (step aside), pay if they are near the register (step aside), ask for extras or omit things if asked, and only when asked what you want on your sandwich, walk away and enjoy one wonderful sandwich!     There's nothing better on a foggy summer day than a huge toasty submarine sandwich with extra homemade hot sauce slathered on it.  Enjoy!
author: Brye L.

description: The Italian Special with all the fixin' and an ice cold cherry soda is all I need! YUM! The Yellow Submarine has always satisfied my cravings for a big meaty treat.
