The meat is always plentiful in my sandwich and I love that they toast the bread and add hot sauce as a condiment.The regular sized sandwich is plenty big and the price is still very reasonable. I'm not too fond of their french fries though. Sometimes they don't fry it enough and the fries come out real soggy and dripping with oil. Other than that, this place is A-OK in my books!
author: Annie L.

description: Moving to SF from the east coast, I had a hankering for hoagies that I was worried may go unappeased!  Not so - this place has amazingly yummy sandwiches!!!  My favorite is the dry Italian salami.
author: Courtney T.

description:
as sandwich places go, this rocks. i don't know what boston style means other than maybe you might go 80 years between world series victories, but what does that have to do with sandwiches?

i usually get the cooked salami and the fresh cut fries. 

what i miss about this place is the two older women who would work the counter and argue with each other because after thirty years of working there, they were never able to figure out a system. sandwich and a show. couldn't beat it.

how i miss those days.
author: Steve T.

description: My dad has been going to this place since the late 80s and knows the family that runs the place. I have been eating here since I was a teenager and it does not disappoint. I always get a Steak and Cheese with everything except pickles and tomatoes and with their homemade hot sauce. The portions are huge; a large sandwich can be two meals and an order of fries is best shared with someone. My parents and friends have tried some of their other sandwiches and have enjoyed them as well. One of the best sandwich places in the city, IMO.
author: Theo T.

description: something about the bread makes it one of the best sandwiches I have ever had. the stuff in between rules too!
author: a w.

description: Best sub sandwiches in SF....love the potatos.....the ladies behind the counter are over worked...if you get there early before it is busy they can be friendly...it does get busy and then they lose patience....parking can be a challenge...but worth it....
author: Nancy P.

description: I went to this place after me and my friend found out that the Chinese place we were trying to go to was closed on Wednesdays (WHY?).  I thought the sandwiches were just OK; there was nothing great about it.  The bread was toasted nicely, but the meat just wasn't anything special (I got the Italian steak).  The sandwiches were fairly big, though, and I just got a medium.
author: Long H.

description: Long ago, when my husband and I were cash-strapped students living by GG Park, we used to order 2 small sandwiches at Yellow Submarine when we wanted a fine dining fix.  Back then we were impressed by the toasted bread, the special hot sauce, the vinegar and oil that gave the whole sandwich a nice tang.  Fast forward to now, and we're stuck in SF on a dreary rainy day.  The De Young is too crowded for our slightly skittish babies, so we walk around for half an our in soggy jeans and then remember our old dive, Yellow Submarine.  The sandwiches taste exactly the same as before.  It's like an epicurean time warp.  Once the babies graduate from foul-smelling chicken-noodle Gerber purees, we will treat them to a sandwich at Yellow Sub, and thus keep the tradition alive.
author: Samantha R.

description: I'm from Boston. I don't really get how these are Boston subs. Not bad, but not great, either. I probably wouldn't come back.
author: Lesley P.

description: I've probably had over 50 sandwiches here since 1988.  I've had most all of them, and they are all good.  The same owner and her family have been making the best hot sandwiches in san francisco and competition remains thin.
author: Pug P.

description: the pastrami with everything on it and a pile of the thick cut fries all washed down with a cold beer will make you cry. everyone loves a good fat sammie. and lemme tell you, this is the spot. awesome combinations quick and friendly service. not to mention the portions are HUGE! which is never a problem.
author: Katie M.

description: This is hands down, my favorite spot to get a sandwich in the city. The turkey with provolone is my favorite, a San Pellegrino Limonata on the side and you're in heaven. This is the best place in the world if you're famished, and just order the medium!!! IT'S HUUUUGE!!! The homemade hot sauce is to die for! It can get pretty busy during lunch hour, but Yellow Sub never disappoints!!
author: Samantha M.

description:
Yum. I love this place. It's a family joint with a very scary lady that has little patience for undecisive people. So if you have problems with decisions, don't go here!

The food: grilled sandwiches, delicious and juicy and to die for.
author: Tracy Y.

description: Love this place, been there about 10 times haven't trying anything but the cheese steak. But it is one delicious sandwich. Great Price and delicious.
author: Haileab B.

description:
This place is great. 

Terrific sandwhiches that are big, cheap, and tasty.

Contrary to a bunch of the recent reviews, I found everyone there really nice and helpful, and the only issue to be that it's a bit cramped in the ordering area and there's no bathroom.

Great place though!
author: Paul D.

description: I usually fuss about places that don't take credit cards but I can't complain about this spot. I ordered the reuben sandwich and I must say. Damn good stuff. I'm not a fan of describing how the food melts in your mouth and not in your hand or any of that fancy yelp stuff, but let's just say I've found my go-to sandwich spot. I've lived in the Inner Richmond for like 4 months now and I'm upset with myself that I haven't gone here sooner. Oh and if you like hot sauce, ask for the homemade hot sauce. That stuff is a game changer.
author: Chris P.

description: This place is amazing, they make the best sandwich I've had in SF. We'll go completely out of our way to make it out to this family-run joint, just to get our occasional fix. Their sandwiches are big, tasty, and all the ingredients are really great quality. Even the bread is perfectly toasty. Whatever it is that they do, Yellow Submarine has it all figured out. I get the turkey and salame, everything on it. I definitely recommend the hot sauce, it's not actually spicy, but it makes the sandwich super tasty! ... Be sure to get the fries!! ;)
author: Julia F.

description: Peppersteak... best sub sandwich ever. Hands down. I never get anything else, so maybe the other ones are not as good... who knows or cares!
author: Brian K.

description: I once loved this place, but something has changed over the years. The bread is still the same good bread, but for some reason the filling has lost some flavor. Not sure if it's me or them, but their cheesesteak was once amazing to me :( Not so anymore, tasted bland too many times in a row...
author: Anni b.

description: Love this place!!! I have been going here since I was a 18 and now I am still hooked as ever.I was never dissappointed in their sandwiches.Love the smell the moment you walked in and when you walked out with their sandwiches....your mouth just watering and all your senses just caved in to your hunger.I swear that in the next 10 minutes of your life you do not want to talk to anyone or make an eye contact either.Yeah....It's that good.
author: S F.

description: A lot of the time, the bread makes the sandwich. And this place does it up right. Nice and toasty. Great meats and fresh veggies with that sandwich shop feeling that you just don't seem to get all that often out on the west coast. Man, I could go for one right now, it's a damn shame that it's in the Inner Sunset and not closer to my house.
author: Michael E.

description:
The bread is really good and toasted just right.  The remaining parts of the sandwiches are rather lackluster, as are the side dishes.  It's OK, if you're in the neighborhood and want to eat a lot for not much. 

The pepper steak turns out, more often than not, to be onion steak slathered so heavily with grilled onions that the beef, peppers, and cheese are lost in the heavy taste of greasy onions.

Some of the other meats, turkey, ham, etc, seem to be standard deli fare.
author: Richard C.

description: I can verify that the large sandwiches are indeed HUGE, and this is coming from someone with a big appetite who loves to eat. Good toasted sandwiches at reasonable prices; I've been here a few times and I've been satisfied. The "fries" are also great.
author: Jon C.

description: YUM!! This sandwich place does subs (hoagies/grinders) the "Boston Way." Bread is toasted before being made. I have only had the avocado and cheese sub everytime I go and it is soooo good. The large is big enough to share. Dont miss the french fries!! They slice potatoes and give you french frie chips.
author: Alyssa C.

description: I go here when I feel like eating a sandwich because Subway just don't cut it.  I love how it's always that one older lady doing all the food.  People on here said they liked the fries, I didn't really care for them.  Whatever, you should try this place at least once.
author: Iliana C.

description: different but fantastic and if you ask me the fries are to die for. Finish the large pepper steak for lunch and i cant even eat dinner. Love the family style service and prices are reasonable.
author: Lauren M.

description: I love sandwiches. I've lived in the inner sunset for quite some time and only recently discovered this place. What a dummy I am! An amazing array of made to order subs, incredible fries that are unlike anything else I've ever had(make sure you order from the older lady and not one of the kids behind the counter. they alway undercook them), and it's cheap to boot. Seriously, I don't think there's a bad sandwich on the menu. I'd eat here every day if I had the chance. Be sure to get the hot sauce on your sub, too.
author: Tim T.

description: I'll admit I need to return and try something more than turkey and cheese.  Like the potato salad and the cole slaw.  Even the Italian Special.  I will say, however, that the big toasty turkey and cheese I ordered was marvellous.  Someone at work walked by while I was devouring it and said "that smells like a REAL sandwich."  I agree.  But for now, just three stars.
author: Eric S.

description: Best sandwich you will ever have in your life guaranteed.  I used to live pretty close to this place and it's absolutely one of the things I miss the most about living in the city.  Their bread is so fresh and yummy.  Their sauce is magical and seriously makes their sandwiches so unique and so much tastier than other sandwich places.  I especially love their toasted sandwiches.  The owners are so nice- family owned.  I just wish so much that they had a location out here in the East Bay.  Hands down one of my favorite places to eat.
author: Lia B.

description: I remember this place as a kid (ahem 30 years ago) and now I can take my son's.  Meatball sub is great but I like the turkey now. So cool to still see this place around.
author: Angela V.

description: GREAT Deli!  I particularly like the turkey-avocado sandwich and the italian combo.  Been around since ~'76 and it's easy to understand why once you go there.  Highly recommended.
author: Chase N.

description: This place has some of the best sandwiches around! I love the steak and cheese and they always put a ton of provolone which makes it just a little better. My boy loves the hot roast beef with the homemade hot sauce. Good prices and great food.
author: S A.

description: the fries alone kicks major ass. I've only had the avacado/cheese (don't eat the meat much) but it's so, how do you say, yumalicious? Ok the only thing I don't really get is the whole "Boston Sub Style" thing. I'm from Boston and don't remember there being a specific style, except greek meatball and chicken parm subs. Maybe that's what it is. I don't eat meat anymore so maybe yellow meat subs taste like Boston greek subs? The owners look Greek...hmmm
author: Dave R.

description: Yellow Submarine is a fancy name but you could get about the same level (taste and price) of sandwich at Quizno's Subs.  Not many options if you're vegetarian - I had the avocado and cheese sandwich.
author: ITesh J.

description: This place makes a decent sandwich but the best part about it is the people behind the counter. I wouldn't go back without calling my order in, the 15 minute wait was no bueno. I got an italian and it was mediocre to decent. I think that typical hot subs would probably be great from this place. Next time I might try the veal parm or meatball. I haven't given up on this spot yet, but it certainly didn't live up to the hype. For $8 I would like to see some better than McDonalds lettuce.
author: M L.

description: Although it won't get a grade A in cleanliness, as long as you have a strong stomach and a big appetite, it's worth it.  We ordered by phone for a small party and they prepared them quickly for pick up.  I had a medium avocado sandwich and it was soooo delicious!  The hot sauce gives it that extra kick and the toasty bread made that sandwich.... I can't wait to go back :)
author: Jenn T.

description: Best sub shop in San Francisco.  Steak & Cheese is delicious.
author: Michael N.

description: Years ago when I first moved to San Francisco I used to ride the N-Judah into the foggy Sunset all the time.  As I would pass by the Yellow Submarine I would always take notice of the sign that said Boston Style Subs.  I always though this was odd, but I assumed that it meant that they were toasted like grinders which I enjoyed in Boston during my college days.  Sure enough once I finally made it there this was exactly the case.  The sandwiches are delicious.  I normally get a salami one since the toasting really brings out the flavor of the salami, but in my opinion every sandwich is better toasted.  The sandwiches are big as well. Best I have had in San Francisco.
author: Eric M.

description: Best consistent subs around on the west coast!  I had the turkey with everything for about a year of going there. then I switched to a pepper steak!  WOW...the cash only policy can get tedious at times.  I like calling in my order and 15 minutes later.boom! freindly stroll and pick it up...mmmmmmmmmmm Oh busy busy bizzy during lunch. You'll stand at door and wait for food or step out side, it's worth it...Also call and if the mommma is working the phone, I like the way she answers the phone.
author: New Dilly G.

description: Big cheap sandwiches -- Good homemade hot sauce for your cheese steak  sandwich.  The place is a bit dirty and any sandwich beside the steak isn't so good.
author: Johnny B.

description: These are some of the best sandwiches in the City and certainly the best of the sandwich poor Inner Sunset. You can get huge sandwiches that are essentially two normal sized sandwiches in one. I recommend the Italian combo. The circular home-style fries are delicious as well. The only thing holding back the yellow submarine from a five star rating is the slowness with which they make sandwiches. I expect to wait ten minutes even when there's only a few customers. The cash register is just a few feet from the entrance of the restaurant so if there are more than three or four people in line, you will stand outside. The move here is calling ahead to order, and then picking up the sandwiches to nullify the wait. The staff is friendly too which is a little added bonus.
author: Jack D.

description:
yellow submarine is a childhood memory! 
i was raised in the inner sunset... and remember this little place on the corner... my parents would always order peper steak sandwiches with orders of fries...
the sandwiches are toasted in the oven, cheese melting down... delicious! the fries are big round slices of potatos! yummy! 
i continue to go here - when i crave it, i bring my niece and close friends... ahhh i miss living in the sunset...
author: kiko v.

description: It's a pretty run down, old looking place run by a family. The sandwiches are unique with the homemade hot sauce, that is actually hot. i've had pastrami, steak and chicken. liked the chicken the best. for only a 3 star place, i seem to go there quite a bit.
author: Cooter Z.

description:
decided to check this out today, on a months-old recommendation from a friend.

had the corned beef and she had the peppersteak.  i would get either sandwich again for sure.  also get the large cut fries.  parking wasn't all that hard on a sunday @ midday.

the toasted bread is key, and the sandwiches are very hearty and only about $5-$6 for a medium (enough to fill a normal males appetite).  definitely a worthwhile sandwich joint.
author: Jason J.

description: The proportion of meat et al to bread was perfect.  The flavors were great, and the meat sliced perfectly.  It was a great picnic item for a day at GG park.  The fries were ok, a bit greasy and little too much.  Chips would have been a better pairing.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Sandwiches, done well.  An amazing steak and cheese sandwich, with tons of options to go on it.   Other types of sandwiches as well, but why would I care about any of them when they have steak and cheese.  For $8, the large sub is nearly overwhelming in size.  The only problems are that the sandwich is so large, the second half is no longer steaming by the time I get to it and that they don't have spicy mustard.   As for the fries.... giant greasy slices of potato.... so amazingly good....    An excellent choice for getting some food if you are in the Sunset on a cold, rainy day.
author: Alured P.

description: yellow sub sandwiches are packed with flavor and are just what you need when you're craving a cheap and hearty lunch. the sandwiches are HUGE [i can't even finish the smallest size - which is a medium - and usually save the rest for later]. they're pretty generous with the meat portions in the sandwiches, and the bread is toasted just right and delicious even on its own. vegetarians can also be happy and get the avocado sandwich instead of a meat one. oh, and the fries are pretty popular here. they're not your average french fries and are instead more like thick fried potato discs.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Love every sandwich on the menu!!!!!!!  Double Bravo for the Avocado Sub with House Hot Sauce!
author: J F.

description: I don't eat meat so I can't comment on 90% of the menu. Plus I've never had the cheese sandwich so I can't speak to that either, but I can say that the Avocado-wich is tasty. The homemade hot sauce will burn your lips so if you're into that sort of thing, you've got to ask for it. The owners are super nice and the old lady who spread the crusty mustard on the last 1* reviewer is cool too, probably their mom or something. Definitely the best sandwich place in the area.
author: Michael M.

description: I just ate here today.  I eat here a lot.  The regular sandwiches are usually $5.35 they also have a large option available, I don't remember how much those are because the regular sandwiches are huge.  The "fries" seem "natural" to me meaning they are not greasy fast foods kind of fries but round potato slices, not too crispy but if you like a little extra  on the side go for it.  OOo on second thought you could put them inside your sandwich...alright, i may try the fries again one day.  But seriously though mr. pickles is good, Ike's is overpriced, yellow sub is tasty generous and well priced.  Word to wise...beware ucsf work crowd,   its gets super backed up round lunch time.
author: Sarah N.

description: This is place is good, I don't understand all the negative reviews.  Sounds like they'd be better off at Quizzno's or Subway or some fancy place in the Marina...  I have eaten at this place countless times, and I like it better than almost every other place I've been in this city, considering price, quantity, and quality.  I've never been to a place even half as good in my hometown of San Diego.  When I thought of writing this though, I couldn't say the place is great.  A little inconsistent on the quality, but the service is good and the owners are nice.  Definitely better than anything in the Irving proximity.
author: Cole M.

description: I am addicted to the avocado and cheese subs here.  It can get busy at lunchtime, though, so I recommend calling your order in 15-20 minutes ahead and then just waltzing in and picking up your sandwich.  Otherwise you'll spend that time standing elbow to elbow with strangers trying to figure out who got there before whom.
author: Jen W.

description: YUMMY, YUMMY Sandwich!!  I have been going to Yellow Sub for years and I have only ordered the steak and cheese with everything, including home made hot sauce -- the sandwich is so good, I just can't bear to order anything else.  A medium is huge and it's less than $6!  The family that runs the shop is incredibly nice and they have been there for over 25 years.  This place is a true institution and anyone who settles for a piece of crap Quizno sandwich or complains about the atmosphere just doesn't know what's good!
author: Nancy M.

description: wow read that they do the boston sub and wanted a warm sammie on a cold and dreary dark day...meah..., but will try again because I still like the fact that they melt the cheese and toast the bread. I LOVE lightly toasted rolls with that dressing and lots of hot steaming, meat! yup, can't be a vegetable all my life, just part time babe.
author: miriam b.

description: Easily the best sub-shop in the city.  If they had a downtown location I'd eat there every day for lunch.  Their portions are generous and despite what others say I think the subs are quiet flavorful, especially compared to the standard San Francisco chain shop dreck.
author: claude m.

description: Yellow submarine is pretty much as good as the other great sub places int eh city... namely against marina sub and submarine center.  This place also has fairly good fries too. Good value too.  Just wasn't really blown away compared to the others.
author: Patrick C.

description: With so many different food options out there why would one be inclined to patron the yellow submarine amongst your many other options along Irving. Well for one you have an extremely friendly and welcoming staff, there are plenty of different sandwich options to choose from with portions that are quite hearty, and the speed of service is second to none. With that said the one thing that does not quite make this a 5 star rating is that it is a little on the pricey side. However as someone that patrons this establishment about once a week, I highly recommend this restaurant when you want to grab a quick bite to eat.
author: D-L Adventures C.

description: I work in downtown and often eat sandwiches so I never gave this place a chance until today.  Sandwiches on my day off isn't appetizing to me.   I  ate the meatball sandwich and was disappointed.  The balls werent baked hot enough and ended up with a sandwich that was cold and luke warm in various parts.  The guys are all very nice and reheated the sandwich for me.  The taste reminded me of chef boyardee.  I'm giving the place 2 stars for now because I think I might like their cold sandwiches.  I saw what others were eating and it looked a lot better than my sandwich.. hopefully taste better too.
author: Food F.

description: Been eating subs from this spot since High School.  Same family, same subs. I recommend the steak and cheese, very tasty. Every time I go in it brings back memories of the "good ol' days".  I'm thankful that some things have not changed in San Francisco.
author: Sabrina L.

description: Not too many places for a sandwich in the inner Sunset. I'm a hoagie girl, and Yellow subs are nothing in comparison. But they are tasty and toasted. And I dig the whole in the wall while you're eating greasy food thing- reminds me of Philly.
author: Hella M.

description: The first moment I walked in here, I said to myself, "Damn! that smells good". I ordered the veal parmigiana and waited literally 10-15 minutes (the only thing I didn't like, but it was quite busy). Then once I got my food, it was delicious. I am definintely coming back here many many times.
author: Pudgy G.

description: I got the pepper steak sandwich, and it was amazing. My gf got the steak & cheese, but it didn't come with any cheese.  I'm guessing it's because we showed up 30 minutes to close and they were rushing to get us out of there.  Her sandwich was still really good, but I dropped a star off for the rushing to get us out and not telling us until our sandwiches were done that we couldn't finish them inside (it was still 20 minutes to close when we got them).  So, that was pretty annoying, but the sandwiches made up for a lot of it.
author: Michael D.

description: Good food, good service, quality ingredients.  This place came highly recommended to me by someone who'd started eating there, 11 years ago.
author: Lil Jinni L.

description: we was hungry, trying to find a place to eat... so we was in the sunset and the first thing that pop up on the iphone on the yelp search for sandwich was THE YELLOW SUBMARINE... let's go give this place to try, got there around 4ish... found parking quick with no problem, went inside there were 3 customer tops and the dinning area look empty but the reviews on here is mostly good... we order the large pastrami hot sandwich, regular Italian sandwich, french fries, and 2 imported lemonade from Italy  both order took not long... max out like 10 minutes to make... when i went to get my sandwich i was like WHOA... this thing is huge for $9 comparing to ike and little lucca but the question i ask myself... its big but is it good?! first bit into i felt in love and wanted more... oh man, nice n hot plus a great place to eat since it was cold outside. fries finally came, wow... its like potato from scratch and cut into slice like chips... wasn't that crunchy but its ok... both of us finish up the sandwich and fries, wash it down with the italy lemonade with a slight fizz... something new i guess... if you love sandwiches, comes here and give it a try... would i come back here?! yes but i want to try other places so i can compare the differences... panda approved....
author: JessePanda C.

description: for $8, its a HUGE sandwich... perfectly layered, perfectly organized, perfectly cut, made with extreme care... impressive.
author: Ethan L.

description:
This place is absolutely fantastic. I go here every week for my work lunch. It's really filling, and has a little bit of everything I want in a boston sub: a little spiciness, a lotta meat, and a good deal. The owners are friendly and quickly get to recognize and be cool with their regulars.

If you got a big appetite and you're looking for a filling sub, this is the best place in the entire inner sunset for that.
author: V L.

description: The jewish family that owns the place has never been to Boston, I presume.  They are called Grinders in Boston.  This place just offers toasted sandwhiches.
author: Sir Paul L.

description: Best sandwiches in the Sunset - place is a dive, but that's okay.  It's a submarine shop, you know...  Portions are huge, I never get more than the medium, and I've liked all the sandwiches I've gotten (Pastrami, Steak & Cheese, Pepper Steak).  They grill the meat/onions when you put your order in, toast the bread, and voila!  You have your old-school submarine sandwich - it's not made like this anywhere else (by contrast, Quizno's is a touch classier -though hugely corporate- and has more complicated and expensive sandwiches, otherwise similar).
author: Miguel F.

description: Best local sub shop in the City....easy.
author: Scott N.

description: Ok so it is not a philly... It is better... I love this place and have been going since I was 15. They are so nice and the sandwhiches are amazing. I love it and would drive at least once a week to get a sandwhich. Even when I was 9 mo. preggers.... If you have not had it you will have to now...
author: Shayna M.

description: This is the best sandwich place in the city! I have tried almost everything on the menu & even some things that aren't on the menu. If you want a good sub, it doesn't get much better.
author: Dan R.

description:
the sandwiches here are awesome. the subs are pretty big and all of them taste great.
parking is sometimes a problem being on irving st.
try to get there early because it gets real crowded or you should order by phone first
author: Tashi. O.

description: The Best Meatball Sub in the City.  The place is classic.  Love the lady who does the cooking, when she retires the place will lose some of it's greatness.  Homemade meatballs with provolone with a thick toasted bun and a Dad's root beer, doesn't get better that that.
author: M K.

description: What a sub! Steak and Cheese with everything plus an order of fries.  I know, its fattening and artery clogging.  But what the heck, its 4th of July.  I would've given 5 stars if the meat was tastier.  Everything else was perfect, from the bread to the cheese, lettuce and pickle.  Overall, good sandwich and will be back if I have a craving for a cook sandwich.  My body won't allow me to enjoy this more than once in a long while.
author: Goose C.

description: My new obsession. It's only about half a mile from my apartment, which is dangerous. The subs are cheap, delicious, and oh-so greasy; same story with their hand cut potato chip-type things. The gentleman who served me was very friendly, but I must say the sitting area was a little grungy. This is a great place when I'm on my own for dinner and want something quick and tasty to bring home on my way from work.
author: Em G.

description: Yellow Submarine is flat out amazing. Satisfying, but not greasy, fantastic home made hot sauce, and their hand cut whole potato fries are great. Oh, and when I say whole potato fries they literally just cut 1/4 inch lengthwise slabs of potato and deep fry them in deliciousness.
author: Gary S.

description: Best sandwiches in the Sunset. Not the best in the city, though. Home fries can be soggy, I've stopped getting them. Italian combo is decent. I haven't tried the steak, which from what I've read here sounds like what I should try next. The wait can be long on the weekends, particularly when the weather is nice and it gets people who are playing in the park, so phone your order ahead of time and save some waiting.
author: Brent E.

description:
i developed a craving for their turkey subs while pregnant.  shredded lettuce, crisp yet chewy bread, oil & vinnie - it always satisfies.  

but one night i added on an order of fries and was shocked to be given flaccid sheets of potato that tasted a little fishy.  i even asked for them well done but it did not crisp them up at all.  will never try them again but will always return for a sub whenever the craving strikes.
author: dink f.

description:
I love the Yellow Sub. The portions are good, prices are decent, service is generally pretty quick and the guys that work there are nice. Did I mention the subs are great? I like their steak and cheese sub (although I have yet to be disappointed by any sandwich there), and I love their medallion-shaped fries....awesome when they're extra crispy. 

I just wish they were open a little later.
author: El B.

description: I like this place a a lto.  It's super yummy and the family that runs it is nice.  Everyone bitching about the cleanliness needs to chill out. It isn't dirty. No gloves?, big deal. I guarantee that they don't use gloves most of the time in most restaurants (which is ok, as long as people wash up often).
author: k g.

description: OKAY!! I totally agree with the guy that stated this place doesn't deserve less then 3 stars! This is a super submarine sandwich shop. Yes, it has one type of bread, but damn good and ran by a very sweet family and their son's. GREAT for a hang over and love the homemade hot sauce. Nothing but great remarks. The sandwich must be eaten right away if you are having grilled onions.
author: Kim K.

description: These fellas know exactly what theyre doing and they come through strong everytime! As a visitor from LA, I used to make 2 stops into the spot in a 3 day stretch JUST to get my fixing of a unique cheese steak with my beloved "homemade hot sauce"!!  Now I live in The City, and I never take it for granted. These guys are under-rated and if you haven't paid a visit to the Family at YellowSub, you must take a minute to indulge
author: Matt D.

description:
I'm being generous with the 3 stars.  My husband, son and I were in the area so we decided to try this place having read the reviews on Yelp and seeing it on Check Please.  The large size sandwiches are $7.95 each and were really large.  However, I ordered the Hot Pastrami and it had almost no flavor at all.  I was expecting a salty, dripping, greasy mass of flavor and what I got was a rather dry, flavorless mass of a sandwich.  It felt like I had a bad head cold and couldn't taste anything.  I was pretty full after eating only half the sandwich but that's because there was no joy in the eating.
My husband got the Italian combo and my son got the turkey with avocado. Both said their sandwiches were pretty good, not great and definitely not among the best they had ever had.
The service was good though and I am giving a star to the guy that took our order.  He was very patient and nice.
Don't order the pastrami!
author: Debbie A.

description: i can only speak for the steak sandwiches and the fries and they're both pretty good. i'm a little biased when it comes to fries b/c my bf makes the best fries i've ever tasted but i appreciate that they clearly cut the potatoes on site, no frozenness. the steak sandwich was also very good but i probably wouldn't go out of my way for it. if i'm in the area and craving a good sandwich though, i'll most likely be back! also, i would recommend it to others b/c it's a very cute, very small family run hole in the wall type place and you gotta love those!
author: Kristen L.

description:
I watched "Check Please" on Channel 9 last week, and the panel discussed The Yellow Submarine. Since I had never heard of the place, we're from San Jose, my girlfriend and I stopped on the way thru town. We wanted to compare the place to ones we have gone to in the SJ area for decades. It was busy as mentioned, but the line moved along quickly. We ordered the Italian combo sandwich w/ provolone cheese & a side of "fries".

Plus side: Staff was VERY friendly with a family feel & the bread they use is fantastic! The old menu on the wall was interesting for the funky artwork. Prices are ok.

Down side: The sub had good flavor but since it is pushing $6.00 for the smaller one I was expecting more meat, was light. Don't waste your money on the fries unless you bring your own seasoning salt, they have no flavor & were uneventful! My girlfriend thought they were the worst fries she had ever had...

If I happen to be in the area again I'll give it one more shot with the steak sandwich, that seamed to be a crowd favorite. Sorry, I know a lot of people like the place but it just didn't cut it!
author: Bob F.

description: Opened by 2 Bostonian buddies in the late 1960s, hence the yellow submarine --and No Where Man(which is gone) . They were huge fans of the Beattles.  The Menu used to be painted in the same motif (colorful boxed painting of the sandwiches and what's in it).  After 3 years they sold it to the present owners (a Middle Eastern family) her two sons are now running the counters for take outs. They also own the grocery store on 5th Avenue and Irving.  Through the years, as the place having its wear and tear, they had painted out most of the original motif.  The good news is that they have maintained the Bostonian submarine recipe.  My favorite is the huge Steak, cheese and sweet peppers with mushrooms (sauteed) with sauce and their toasted buns.  Mama has her mother in the back sitting on a stool with a huge metal pot peeling the potatoes and cutting them length-wise like potato chips but thicker.  I usually ask to make the fries extra crispy.  It's better to eat there, because once they wrap it, the potatoes aren't as crispy.  the meat ball sandwiches are tasty as well.   I am just salivating as I write about their "joint".
author: Marian G.

description: Some of the best sandwiches in the city, but you have to know what to order.  Pepper Steak or Steak and Cheese are AWESOME! and HUGE! (medium is usually enough, especially with the enormous sliced-chip-style fries.)  Those fries are unique and generally reccomended, although sometimes the largest slices come out underdone and soggy with grease.  Veggie sanwich with avocado is good as are most simple cold cuts.  other items are uneven; pastrami or corned beef is NOT reccomended.  the bread really makes the sandwich;  big toasty french rolls just perfect.  also, take all the usual fixins including mustard mayo lettuce tomato and special hotsauce.  even if you normally wouldn't want some of this stuff on your hot steak sandwich (and i tried the first couple of times to keep the toppings off so as to make more of a traditional "cheesesteak"), these folks have created a magical mixture of flavors and textures with simple condiments which you really need to experience fully. the space is small, old, maybe a bit run down, but clean and charming and somewhat timeless.
author: Ari G.

description: Ok, I generally only order the Italian Combo, unheated.  When I first landed in SF, I went looking for a submarine sandwich like the kind I used to get in NYC and this place is the closest--maybe even better.  You can have your bread toasted or not (and I've seen them burn (slightly) the bread and scrap off the burned parts before making your sandwich).  You can have hot sauce of not.  The lady has been working here for 30+ years and can probably do her job in her sleep.  They've even rennovated once.  My sandwich is always good.  And I love the fried potatoes (actual real sliced potatoes that get fried to softness, yum--frying is so delicious).  Yes, the guys can sometimes be a little brusk, might even ignore you for a while, but these are the best subs around and worth whatever attitude they want to give (they have gotten better, they used to be a little like the soup nazi on Seinfeld).  And once you become a regular, they are quite friendly.  You can even call in your order and won't have to wait there in the tiny little storefront.
author: Kai T.

description: i like to pickup a sandwich here before i head to the cinema down the road.  tasty sandwiches!  have it toasted and it turns into a warm delight.  the bread is not to thick or thin, and withholds the content of the sandwich.  i like the oil and vinegar they splash on -- it's like having a squirt of italian dressing.
author: Sheri N.

description: We ordered four sandwiches and from what I hear from my friends, they were all good.  They heat up the bread which is nice.  I had the corn beef with avocado which was good.  Plus the medium size is plenty of food for you.  There is plenty of lettuce and tomatoes and the folks that work there are really nice.
author: Brian L.

description: I watched "Check Please!" on Channel 9 last Friday, and the three guests  discussed The Yellow Submarine, in addition to two way pricier restaurants. On Monday, I went there to check it out. First of all, for such a small place, it was BUSY! I ordered a medium pepper steak sub with the giant French fries, and there was so much commotion with the other customers and the cooks that at one point, I thought that my order was ready when in fact, someone else's order was ready. I eventually got my meal. I ate the fries first; they were bigger and earthier than any fries that I have ever had. Still, they tasted good. The sandwich was amazing. For a $5.60 sandwich, it was LOADED. I didn't get a chance to eat it until later that night, but it was worth it in the end. It tasted delicious. And the people were so friendly and nice, even amid all the activity. I even mentioned the "Check Please" review and they were happy. Would I rush back? No. But will I go back? Yes.
author: Alex S.

description: I'm not going to lie, the only thing I've tried here so far has been the meatball sandwich but that alone has been amazing enough to keep me coming. (wait I do lie, because I've also tried the not so memorable homemade potato chips but they were a bit too greasy for me so good effort).  I absolutely adore this hole in the wall.  The service is always fast and friendly, definitely not the fake type of nice.  Prices might be a dollar or two above your average subway or quiznos but you definitely get your money's worth because the sandwich is HUMUNGOUS.  A medium (or normal) sized sub is big enough to be split between two, and the large sized sub will definitely satisfy two hungry people.  They are more than generous with their toppings: lettuce, onions, bell pepper, fresh tomatoes galore, cheese, dressing, and to top it all off they toast the sandwich to perfection.  Basically, I highly recommend this place if you are craving a good sandwich for lunch.
author: Megan L.

description: The sandwiches are pretty good here. I had the Dry Italian Salami with the works on it. I was going to get a large, but upon seeing the large sandwich being handed to the person before me, I decided on a medium. I thought the medium was fairly large, great for the price. I think I would have liked the sandwich more if it had just a little more vinegar and hot sauce, but that is all just preference.  My bf decided on a hot pastrami sandwich and he enjoyed it. We decided to order the meal, which came with a drink and cole slaw or potato salad for like 3 dollars more. The bottle of water was a larger size, but the cole slaw that we ordered( which he ended up giving us potato salad by mistake) was actually a really small serving. We also ordered a side of fresh cut potatoes, which were cut like potato chips. The potatoes were soggy, but still tasty. They definitely would have been a whole lot better if they were deep fried fresh, I think they were sitting around for a bit or they did not fry them long enough, not sure which. I would come here again, if I were in the area and try another sandwich. Service is awesome! Be warned, there is no restroom here to wash your hands if you dine in.
author: carebear l.

description: Tried this place the other day for the first time after hearing and reading so much about it. Ordered the large (I was starving) pastrami sub with everything on it and a side of fries, my friend has a regular peppersteak with side of fries as well and we both had beverages, $22 and change. The order of fries is large and we could have shared. They are fried sliced potatoes basically, not crunchy but on the soft side. My pastrami was good although it coulda used a bit more meat. Good place but unimpressed, the both of us. BUT I will come by again and try something else soon as I love subs...So far I think AK subs rocks this place.
author: Steve K.

description: They make the greatest sanwiches.  Not much room to sit and eat, but take out would be fantastic.  Also these ladies have owned it forever.
author: Deborah E.

description: I come form San Diego where no one would ever dream of putting a sandwich in an oven after all of the vegetables were put on the bread. This lead to wilted veggies, and goopy cheese. Yet, this is exactly what the Yellow Submarine chose to do. On top of this, the french fries were a variety of "tasty chips". They were simply round sliced potatoes that were deep fried for a bit in oil. The end result were round, soggy bits of potato. Very few had crunch, and the majority were just drenched in oil.
author: Kelli T.

description: not as good as submarine center,but most definitely worth braving the eucalyptus hive deathtrap of the panhandle/irving/sunsety area for a sandwich.fairly decent pricing for a large sandwich.great customer service
author: Lauren V.

description: Ok seriously good sandwiches come from this place.  I came in with exactly $8 in my wallet, and came out with a gigantic steak and cheese AND a free limonata.   The guy that made the sandwich was friendly and chatty, he told the guy behind me that he has worked there for 6 years.  That seems like some serious commitment for a sandwich artist.  They might want to get rid of the AIDS bike ride donation form from 2004 on the wall in the dining room, but whatever.  The sandwich was so delicious that I almost ate the entire thing before realizing how ridiculously full I was and that meant I got delicious yummy fantastic food for lunch the next day.  So if you want a good giant sized sandwich, head on over to The Yellow Submarine, you can't miss it with it being right in front of the N stops...  Oh but the only reason I deducted a star was for the cash only policy, I accept it in bars but not restaurants, its an thing of mine that really makes no sense.  But I will say that they have an ATM machine that currently only charges $1.95 to take money from it.
author: Meredith N.

description: Sandwiches: Really big (just the medium!), really tasty, inexpensive.
author: John K.

description: i ve taken my pops and my brother here both of them loved it , pastrami with extra mustard and an order of fries cant be beat. . its a family run operation so service is always on point.
author: Wei W.

description: The submarine sandwich has always been iffy to me.  Most of the time the bread sucks.  but not this place - this place hits the spot every time.  Go for a reuben or a steak & cheese.  Even my friend from philly was diggin the hoagies...the dude even went back to yellow submarine after bay 2 breakers the next year...without me!  Also go for the sliced fries (what do you call those things anyway? chips?  they're delicious).
author: Eugene C.

description: I used to like this place more but it's still one of the best places for sandwiches.  I always get the turkey with swiss and grilled onions.  If i'm not terribly ravenous, half of the medium keeps pretty well for a satisfying lunch the next day.  The sandwiches really are huge.  I liked this place more before the most recent price hike.  It used to be the best deal in town.  Now it's a good deal but not the best.  Plus, the crazy old ladies (aka "The Sandwich Nazis) are no longer cute to me.  The past couple of times I've been in there they were downright rude.  I was there to pick up and order that was called in.  I said I was there to pick up an order and was told it wasn't ready.  No problem.  I'd just wait.  She proceeded to ask  if she could help me 3 more times, each time sounding more annoyed than the last.  Each time I told her I was waiting for a pick up.  And each time she told me it wasn't ready yet.  Maybe she's just losing it.  Either way I'll keep going here because the sandwiches are good and I live a couple blocks away.
author: M M.

description: bigger than an average medium sized sub, easy for splitting with a friend.  be sure to call ahead for your order, cause subs this good take a while to prepare.
author: audra k.

description: I am a mom with two rambunctious, always hungry sons. We love this place! I can get two large sandwiches, and  it's enough to feed all three of us. Nice folks behind the counter. Only problem for us is the tricky street parking, but this place is worth driving around the block (and around and around and around) until a spot opens up.
author: Karen H.

description: I just tried the Yellow Submarine on the recommendation of friends and I am so glad they told me about this little gem in the Sunset....  LOVE LOVE LOVE the fries... they are a perfect blend of potato chip and french fries... two of my favorite things all though I don't have them very often.  I had the steak sandwich which was great... and I am from Philadelphia.  =)  The staff was super friendly and the entire experience made me think of our neighborhood sandwich shop in Philly growing up and how much I miss it.  Now I don't have to miss it as much.. =)
author: M. Allan P.

description: Their pepper-steak sandwiches are mmmm-mmm-filling.
author: August S.

description: The Yellow Submarine has the third best sandwich that I have had so far in San Francisco.  They have a basic menu and they make a basic toasted sandwich which turns out pretty good.  I've tried pretty much everything they have and I still like the turkey and cheese the best.  They also have a hot sauce that they put on sandwiches if you ask which is a huge plus for anyone who likes a little kick.  Their fries are also pretty good.   On the downside the service isn't that good, there is no where to park, and the place hasn't been changed in it looks like 30 years.   The way you order your sandwich is unconventional, confusing, and inefficient and the older lady who usually is making the sandwiches gets annoyed by you for everything you order.  I like the sandwiches but I have found myself seeking alternative sandwich places unless I am in the immediate area.
author: Chris H.

description: Not bad but nothing special. The subs don't have much taste for some reason. It's sorta over priced and the old ladies take too long to make stuff (okay I'm an a-hole... I know).
author: Hmmm W.

description: One of the top three for sunset sub places in my book. Wonderful oven toasted sandwiches with a nice vinegar dressing. I like to order the Italian combo and always have about 1/2 left over for later. Especially try the fresh cut fries. They are sliced like thick potato chips and priced at $1.95 for a basket full you can't go wrong!
author: Jamie C.

description: Looking for a good sandwich shop that's not your typical Subways or Quiznos, I came onto Yelp to see what other sandwich lovers had to say. Yellow Submarine in particular had pretty good ratings, so I figured I'd try it after one of my volunteering days at nearby UCSF. I heard good things about the peppered steak sandwich and boy was that a good thing indeed! Order it (or any of their other also just as good sandwiches) and you'll leave feeling satisfied and wanting to go back for more.
author: Sheri L.

description: this place is legit. try the hot pastrami w/provolone & extra hot sauce. their fries are awesome, so try those too. if you're getting a sandwich to go and you're in a hurry, call in your order ahead of time and it will be there waiting for you when you pick it up... this is a good idea for this place since it is so popular, the line is sometimes out the door. it's a total mom&pop place, the sandwiches are enormous and way better than anything you'll get at a chain.
author: Jessica C.

description: Best sub shop I've found in the city.  Great east coast style subs - big, medium is plenty for one, large could feed two.  Prices are reasonable too:  $5 and change for a medium, $7 and change for a large.  Their home made hot sauces is great.  The place is always busy but if you call ahead they'll make your sandwich for you and have it ready when you get there 10 min. later.
author: S. P.

description: This sub is decent not amazing. In my opinion the bread they use overpowers the sandwich. There's just too much bread for what little there is in the sandwich. It doesn't help that the bread is really chewy even after they toast it.
author: christian x.

description: An old school 1970s sub shop run by an interesting family, Yellow Submarine makes me feel like I'm living in a neighborhood of Brooklyn or Queens.
author: Brian R.

description: The best meatball sub I've ever had. Great, giant loaves of bread. They have no fear of lathering the toppings on and the family that works there are adorable.
author: Joe S.

description: I ordered the pepper steak which was tasty but a tad on the bland side.  It was still good though and served its purpose in satisfying my hunger.  The bread was really moist and tasty , but the overall sandwich experience stopped far short of sub center level.  It is also tough to compete with the amazing restaurants around the corner on Irving st.   The portions were quite generous though, and the restaurant gave me a nice neighborhoody feel, which I do value greatly.  The fact that the yellow submarine has been around for so long means that they must be doing something right.  I'd check it out.
author: Kirk J.

description: I love this place!!! Delicious subs, super fresh, and the homemade hot sauce is the perfect degree of spice. Plus it's family owned, not like the big sub chains and everyone who works there is so nice and friendly!!! Try the meatball sub, its my fave!
author: Lindsay E.

description: this is one of my favorite steak sandwich place. a nice place with great sandwiches and potato salad. one of the best for steak sandwiches. the sandwiches are very tasty with lots of meat on a nice bread
author: Cory Y.

description: yumyumyumyumyumyumyumyumyummy!!!! i WISH i lived in the yellow submarine! i would be one well-fed girl. i'm so lucky i stumbled upon this lovely sub place! as soon as i saw italian sausage on the menu, i had to have it. got it with lettuce, tomato, grilled onions, and some other delightful treats on a crunchy french roll. ordered the medium size (only $5.75) but it was BIG! i came hungry but left full with half a sub leftover for later. the combination of flavors and textures was heavenly. the bf got italian steak which was delectable as well. i cannot wait to come back!
author: N. M.

description: Love going here when I'm in the neighborhood. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, but it doesn't disappoint when I do drop in.  Quick, cheap, filling and yummy. I like the pastrami, but have also tried the roast beef and turkey. Friendly service and always reliable.
author: C K.

description: "french fries" mean "fried potatoes slices" here, like thick potato chips. they're really good though. and the pastrami sandwich was awesome. definitely going to come back to try out some other sandwiches.
author: Chris C.

description: this plac is too good. i recommend the steak and cheese. lots of choices to fill your sammich with. the potato slices, or chips, are good too.
author: Bobby J.

description: this place and submarine center are my favorite sandwich joints in the city (and have been for the past nine years).  they make big, hearty sandwiches on softer and thicker bread than sub center, but equally tasty.  the fries are cut in sections of the potato and are pretty good if you're in the mood for some greasy, greased potatoes.  yellow sub and sub center are both family owned, but sometimes the staff at yellow sub is a bit stingy or cranky instead of being welcoming and friendly.  still, a really freaking good sandwich.
author: M K.

description: another real good sub shop. the fries are a great bonus.
author: martin d.
